Reviews.Title: “Loved every second”
Reviews.Author: Blankets
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel and can't wait to go back. Travelling from Australia for business (and being lucky enough to combine this with a family catch up in Chicago), it was a long haul flight and the staff could not have been more attentive and friendly when I arrived and during the entire course of my 4 night stay. The art deco styling of the hotel and my room suited me perfectly. The hotel is perfectly situated for all kinds of shooping, theatre and food adventures. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Niki500
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I were in Chicago for a college visit and we stayed in the Monaco. We asked for a room with a river view. The location is superb, right in the middle of city. All the staff was very friendly and helpful, we received excellent service. The room decor was interesting, not like a standard, boring hotel room. There were window seats, literally in the window, which were great. I thought it was great value for money. Our stay at the Monaco definitely added to the pleasure of being in Chicago and we are planning to stay there again when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “The best value in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: NobRotterdam
Reviews.Content: This hotel simply has it all! Great location, fantastic service, nice people, very affordable (we paid $156 for a river view two queen room), dream beds, beautifull river view from a 'window couch' (see pic) The gym is nice, the free coffee in the morning is nice, the wine tasting in the evening is nice. the pet friendly policy is nice... ....the only thing that is NOT nice is the animal unfriendly possibility to get a goldfish as your companion in your room. The bowl is fish unfriendly and I think it's perhaps a fun idea to let the guest 'sleep with the fishes', but it's bad for the fishes!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: clams5
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel and I go out of my way to stay here while in Chicago. The staff is what you expect at a Kimpton. The rooms are well done and everything - lights, tv, phone, bathroom stuff - works and is easy to use. The free coffee in the lobby gets you quickly on your way. Great location too. And the room rates make it all a great value.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with a minor complaint”
Reviews.Author: northiowatraveler
Reviews.Content: Loved the view from the window seats in the room, and the room itself was amazing. This is a great location for downtown sightseeing. We arrived very early and were able to check into our room, so thank you for that. My only very minor disappointment was this: As an Intouch member, i was able to request a coffee maker and extra blankets...but i had to ask for them after so long. I also mentioned it was my sons birthday and was hoping to find cupcakes delivered in honor of this occasion.....i have heard great things about special deliveries such as this, but no such luck in our case. Its little touches like that, which make a hotel really stand out. All in all, we loved the hotel and would come back again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: John T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a one night 'staycation' and it was amazing! We had a room that overlooked the river that had huge window seats for viewing. We also requested a goldfish to keep us company and I thought this was a clever ammenity. The best part was the service. From the door man at check-in, the concierge for dinner and the front desk throughout the stay everyone was wonderful! My hats off to them. We are already planning our trip back.

Reviews.Title: “High Maintenance Guest - NO PROBLEM!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely. The staff was all VERY approachable, helpful, & went out of their way to assist me on a number of occasions during my brief stay. I had several packages delivered to the hotel, I asked to ensure my room was bedbug free, & I asked for directions and dinner recommendations. They responded to each of my requests with a smile and were amazingly helpful. Amy & Ryan at the front desk obviously take a great deal of pride in their work. I would stay at Hotel Monaco in Chicago again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, restaurant and staff!”
Reviews.Author: Tita M
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Monaco Chicago 12/21/2011. Wanted a quick city escape from the suburbs and Monaco had a great rate for Intouch members (their free membership program - sign up)! Loved the location! It's right in the middle of the city; a short walking distance to theatres, art museum, Michigan Avenue and next to the river! (I love bridges and was delighted by the river view). Valet parking is ridiculous ($46 per night) but this is a city! Sheena was very empathic about the high parking rates and booked us in a room with a river view and gave us 2 free drink tickets to soften the parking blow, thanks Sheena! Kimpton hotels typically have a complimentary wine hour for their guests and we had made it just in time. We were surprised they even had salmon bruschetta bites from their amazing kitchen. This is the 6th Kimpton we've stayed at and can attest that Kimpton hotels offer the best service and they do not have regular restaurants... their restaurants are excellent!! We decided to grab a quick bite at the restaurant (South Water Kitchen) where the staff was superb! We paid a sincere compliment to the hostess on how friendly and genuine she was and she treated us to dessert! Our room was great! The window nook was awesome, great way to unwind, take in the views and nap! The bed and pillows at ALL Kimpton hotels are always extremely comfortable; I never want to leave! Bathroom was a good size and I love the bathrobes! Another great Kimpton find!

Reviews.Title: “They do it right”
Reviews.Author: lovestoroam78
Reviews.Content: Great location and service. The wine tasting at 5:00 was complemented by guitars and a vocalist - a nice touch in the lobby. The room was well appointed - love the bay window seating overlooking the river. The night time view of Marina Towers is classic Chicago. The robes in the room were animal print - for a little variety - and also for sale if you want to pack them. The only glitch was the glass of wine we purchased at the bar was bad - but it was quickly rectified once it was brought to their attention. It seems like they are targeting a younger demagraphic with their weekend deals on the discount sites - and by the folks we saw in the elevator and such - it seems they are succeeding.

Reviews.Title: “First time at a kimpton but certainly not the last!”
Reviews.Author: NJpancakeeater
Reviews.Content: What is there to not love about this place? A clean and posh place where people can bring their dogs with no problem?! Amazing. This was our first time bringing our 50 lb. mutt on vacation and we wanted a clean and comfortable place to stay in the heart of Chicago. The moment we all arrived , we all fell in love with Hotel Monaco. Unfortunately, I did not "like" kimpton hotels on my facebook prior to checking in, so i did not see the magic password that you can say during check in, and you can get things from room upgrades to a meal or whatever the surprise is that day. The one thing i did do is to sign up for, was their loyalty program, so we were able to get free wifi. Now, when we book hotels, the first hotel chain we look for now is Kimpton. Really hope this hotel chain expands more so we can bring our pooch to more places!

Reviews.Title: “No window seat even though I paid for river view :(”
Reviews.Author: Bon_voyage79
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at Hotel Monaco, Chicago. I will say that we slept well and the room was quiet, but overall the hotel was very disappointing. I spent quite a long time trying to decide which hotel to book for this trip â€“ it was really important to me to have a nice view where I could sit in the window and enjoy the city. Every picture on the hotelâ€™s website showed window seats, and the reviews all described window seats as big as twin beds. It sounded great, a perfect place to relax and enjoy the city! For the first time in my life, I decided to spend extra money and upgrade for a river view as this was very important to me. You can imagine my disappointment when I entered the room and saw only one very narrow window (about 3 feet wide) and NO WINDOW SEAT. I did not realize that this was an â€œextraâ€� feature that I should have requested, but as the rest of the stay would prove, one had to ask for almost everything that might be assumed standard. I will say that the hotel delivered a fan to my room as requested, but many of the other amenities or lack thereof were very disappointing. (1) There was no hotel directory book (the little book that lists amenities and maps out the locations of things, etc). (2) There was no shower cap provided. I expect a disposable shower cap in even basic hotels. (3)There was no plastic liner bag for the ice bucket. Again, this is something that I have had in even the most basic hotels. I thought these omissions must have been oversights, so I went down to the front desk the next morning to ask. I was told by the front desk clerk, Ryan, that (1) I probably overlooked the hotel directory (I had not) and (2) the shower cap and ice liner were not, in fact, generally provided amenities and he sneered at me. Ryan was a very unpleasant hotel representative, and he made me feel as though my meager request was a great put-out. I was too afraid to ask him for anything else during the stay. He agreed to have a shower cap and ice bags sent to the room later that day. When we returned, an ice bag and shower cap were provided but were not replenished again throughout the stay. I didnâ€™t know that I needed to ask every single day, but apparently that was the case. And then the hotel was a little too involved when it came to turn-down service. I donâ€™t expect this as a standard, but unfortunately it seemed to be the case. I donâ€™t like people coming in my room when I am not expecting it, but thatâ€™s exactly what happened. I felt very violated by the incident. Who on earth needs turn-down? I can pull down my own sheets, thanks. I soon learned to put the â€œdo not disturbâ€� sign on the door except during the few hours that I wanted my room cleaned. The hotel also made you feel guilty for getting basic services like clean sheets and towels. The little signs everywhere about â€œprotecting the environmentâ€� give you the feeling that if you request clean linens, you might not actually get them. I always imagine the maids saying â€œtough luckâ€� and just tucking the old ones back in. Also, the furniture is completely there for aesthetics and is very uncomfortable. I was disappointed as I really wanted the room to be a place of relaxation. Kimpton implies that it can anticipate your needs, but it did a very poor job with ours. I gave the San Francisco Monaco a top rating during a previous stay, and I expected similar service at this hotel. I did not receive it; instead I felt like my very presence was putting out the hotel staff, and I very much feel that I was a victim of false advertising. I would NEVER have stayed at this hotel had I known that I would receive the pitiful window with no window seat. I think that I will avoid Kimptons in the future. The inconsistency of quality and service is not worth the risk.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Afficionado's Review”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: We love Kimpton Hotels. We try to stay in them anytime there is one in the vicinity of where we are staying. We tried the Monaco in Chicago for a friend's birthday this last December. The Mediterranean Suites are spacious and well laid out. The remodel they recently completed is quirky yet sophisticated. The concierge was nice enough to put some gourmet cupcakes in the room for the birthday girl. The wine hour was nice and the staff was very attentive. The only problem with the whole stay was we found some of the previous hotel guests' trash left behind the pillows on the chaise. Other than that, quality stay and a fun time at Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: enk2121
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days right after the holidays and loved it. I booked the room via hotels.com and got a gorgeous Mediterranean suite for an amazing rate (150/night). For that price, it was 100% worth the extra 30/night for the Jacuzzi and the extra space. As everyone else noted, the window seats are very nice, the wine hour is a great perk, and the location is fantastic (most touristy attractions are walkable, with the notable exception of the museums). There's a 7-11 and a CVS super close by for picking up inexpensive snacks, wine, etc., too. I am definitely planning on staying there again, and I highly recommend it to anyone else who would like to stay in the Loop.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Susan K
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is a reasonably priced hotel in a great location. It s within walking distance of the theatre district, great restaurants and the lake (including Millenium Park with the Bean!). Some rooms have great views but all of them are well decorated. On weekends, complimentary wine is offered in the evening and coffee in the mornings. A nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelguy63
Reviews.Content: You have to love the Kimpton Hotels if for nothing more than their pet policy. Where else do they bring you a goldfish when feeling a little lonely?! Location of the Monaco in Chicago is ideal. Just steps away from the river and the extraordinary architecture for which Chicago is renowned. The room was spacious, comfortable and clean. But itâ€™s the staff that really makes this place. Everyone from the front desk, to room service and doormen could not have been nicer. Always a warm greeting upon returning each day. I had dinner one night in the restaurant which I enjoyed very much. Upon ordering the cheese course, I was enthusiastically told where I can purchase artisan cheese just a few blocks away. I was made to feel more than just another guest. Iâ€™ll definitely be backâ€¦perhaps with my dog next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Hotel Monaco Every Time!”
Reviews.Author: darrenq
Reviews.Content: We like to stay at the Hotel Monaco once or twice a year, especially when they offer special rates by email. As always, the room, the view and the staff were excellent. It's our favorite place to stay in Chicago when we get a night away from the kids. Unlike some other hotels where we've stayed downtown or in the River North area, the Hotel Monaco suites on the upper floors are always quiet, clean and comfortable We also enjoy the window nook seats and the jacuzzi. We've never had the chance to enjoy their morning coffee service or evening wine reception, but they always mention them at check-in. The location is great, so it's close enough to walk or take a short taxi ride to restaurants and other spots. Parking is easy in the adjacent garage or just use the valet. It's expensive, but not much different than other hotels or garages in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and space in downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_CrystalLake_IL
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my family and we wanted to stay downtown for the long President's day weekend. The Hotel Monaco was a great find and we would definitely go back. We stayed in Mediterranean suite which had a lot of room for 4 people. The room had these great window seats where my 9 year old son slept. They also brought in a goldfish for the stay. They had a Wii system on the lobby that my boys played with. The service was great! This is also a pet-friendly hotel and we saw so very well behaved pets! Our own dog is a bit to hyper to bring with us. The big Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom was also a hit!

Reviews.Title: “A little Fishy”
Reviews.Author: walkersandtalkers
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, comfortable bed, nice set-up and plenty of friendly staff. The best part was that they brought me a "companion goldfish" because I was traveling alone. Two nights on a business trip missing my family and the goldfish was always there waiting for me when I came back to the hotel each night. Even had a seat window so I could people watch (while they watched me too). Recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect proposal.”
Reviews.Author: greecegirl40
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were celebrating our anniversary by spending the weekend in the city. A friend recommend Hotel Monaco and after seeing some great rates I booked right away. The whole weekend was perfect. Fast and easy check in. A raid the mini bar voucher. A bottle of champaign delivered to our room. A lovely wine hour. And the room....the room was perfect. A large king bed that was so comfortable u didn't want to get out of it in the morning. And the best part of the room was the window seat overlooking the river and magnificent skyline views. You could curl up there for hours just watching the hustle and bustle of the city. And it was in tht special window seat that my life changed forever. My boyfriend proposed and asked me to be his wife! I'm surprised they couldnt hear my screams of excitement down at the front desk. It was a perfect setting for a perfect proposal. This hotel will always be a very special place to me and one I hope my fiancÃ© and I can return to offen.

Reviews.Title: “Service, Location, Room, Greatness”
Reviews.Author: illwill701
Reviews.Content: I spent a ton of time searching for the perfect hotel downtown to celebrate Valentine's Day. I'm really glad I chose this hotel. The staff was OUTSTANDING and very friendly. The room was top knotch. My girlfriend and I stayed in the Mediterranean suite with river view.....on the 14th floor (top floor). The view was beautiful. We probably took 30-50 pictures just of the view alone. The room was very neat and attention to detail was prevalent. I indicated that this weekend was for a post-Valentine's day celebration in my reservation comments. Subsequently, our concierge had two tasty cupcakes awaiting me amd my love along with a note. Quite thoughtful. A bevy of snacks and drinks are made readily available in the bar. The jaccuzzi in the bathroom was a great touch along with the glass shower. I was just left speechless with the service. And the location.... You're in the middle of the greatest city ever. A quick walk across the Chicago River and you have some of the finest restaurants and stores America has to offer. I don't feel as if I could've made a better decision. I will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Rattylainen
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, spacious and clean room, great bed, friendly goldfish, happy wine hour, good and efficient service ... window seat picnic with the great city view ... I can only warmly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and fun!”
Reviews.Author: kateCA
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a meeting and am so glad that I did not stay in the hotels that were part of the convention. Had internet, fitness center, coffee in the moring and wine in the evening. the room was well appointed and the staff knowlegable. My peers paid much more for a cookie cutter room with charges for fitneess center and the internet at the chain hotels. what fun it a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Window Seat”
Reviews.Author: uwred1
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate for a Saturday night ($165) through Kimpton. Location is great, just off Michigan Avenue. Hotel parking is expensive ($48), but convenient. I noticed several public ramps nearby for the more cost-conscience person. The complimentary wine hour is of course a Kimpton standard. Comfy bed and the window seat in our room was awesome! Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Hits nearly all the right buttons...”
Reviews.Author: Iris033
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Chicago, and we very much enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Monaco. The rooms are very clean and comfortable (alas, we didn't get a goldfish, nor a morning newspaper), and the staff were helpful. During our four-night stay the bathroom toilet flooded (leaky seal, nothing to do with us!), and Glenn the engineer was brilliant. He appeared within about a minute of us reporting the flood, replaced the faulty part, organised housekeeping to mop up the water etc. He is a credit to the hotel... The location is good; plenty of places to dine within a short stroll. We had no noise problems, and we found the staff pleasant.The free wine happy hour was a good idea, and we also enjoyed the free morning coffee, although it would have suited us better if it had not ended at 9am every day we were there! My only quibble would be that I would have liked a coffee maker in the room as room service prices were high. But I would recommend this hotel (the age range of guests was very wide, so it's obviously doing something right), and I would return there if I returned to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay but no goldfish for me!”
Reviews.Author: reptileenthusiast
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Hotel Monaco and I absolutely loved it! Knowledgable and friendly staff, great dining tips (The Gage and Wildberry), the rooms are hip and cool gone wild, and the happy hour (wine and Wii) just right. Location is awesome. I loved my room, especially the picture window/reading nook. And the room was VERY clean.The beds and linens are sooooooo comfortable. And free wireless immediately upon registration in their loyalty club. The only complaint I had was no one asked me if I wanted a goldfish - now I feel so deprived! I'll know next time to ask for one; who doesn't need a little company?

Reviews.Title: “Cute”
Reviews.Author: love_going_vacation
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in December. Hotel is clean, convenient location. Staff is very helpful. I will recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It simply keeps getting better”
Reviews.Author: madqdog
Reviews.Content: Are there fancier hotels in Chicago? Yes. Are there pricier hotels in Chicago? Oh yes. Could there be improvements? Sure (The bathmat was a bit tattered), but the location is perfect, the staff is outstanding to a person, and for value? It simply cannot be beat. Our introduction to the Kimpton Hotel group was first at this location ten years ago. We became Kimpton In Touch Members as a result, having stayed here several times over the years, never tiring of the comfort and convenience. The staff are both accommodating and friendly; they're real people and fun to engage in conversation. For us, the Kimpton Monaco, Chicago is truly a home aawy from home.

Reviews.Title: “Special night at the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: gldnpupper27
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Chicago and to the Hotel Monaco. I was not sure what to expect with either, but was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is a smaller hotel with lots of special things about it. Upon arriving, parking was a real issue and we found it easier to just let the valet do the parking. When checking in, we were asked if we would like a goldfish for our room. Welllll....sure....why not??? This was a first for me. Upon getting to our room, we found a very nicely decorated room with a wonderful view of the waterway to our right. Each window had a good sized windowseat, where you could sit and watch the action down on the street. Just be aware that there is a building across from you and they can also watch everything going on in your room. :) It is a quiet hotel and did not hear any noise from the neighbors, which is important to me. They also provide very nice funky robes...not just the white ones you find in other places. There is a very nice bar and restaurant downstairs if you chose to stay there and eat. The hotel is pretty much in the middle of a very active area of Chicago and within walking distance to quite a few great restaurants. This is an upscale hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. A great place to stay in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Service comes first”
Reviews.Author: maninomaha
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Monaco in the past year, and it only gets better. I reserved a suite facing the river. From the moment I stepped into the hotel I was treated like a VIP. When I left or entered the hotel I was called by name and always asked how my day was. Anything I needed was handled immediately and professionally. Few hotels today make each guest their top priority, The Monaco Chicago does. I ordered room service for breakfast. Israel took care of my order, and the next time I ordered breakfast he remembered everything I wanted, even the extras. Now that is outstanding customer service. The room was kept immaculately clean. Few hotels that I have stayed in treat their guests as well as the Monaco. I can only say if you have the chance to stay here, take it. (And make sure to get a river view room.)

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleased”
Reviews.Author: C O
Reviews.Content: Three friends stayed for a concert at the Chicago Theatre, just a block and a half away. We had plenty of room in a freshly carpeted room with two queen beds. Front desk service was lively and helpful as was the doorman throughout the the afternoon and evening. We ate dinner at the adjacent restaraunt, and again service was really good as was the food. Everything was better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect short stay”
Reviews.Author: justine19
Reviews.Content: We went to the Monaco hotel for a week-end. Perfect. Nice rooms, very warm (thermosthat control in the room), nice bed, very clean. Very nice and efficient staff, very good service. I will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Rod G
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Monaco, a Kimpton Hotel, was awesome. The rooms, the staff, the attached rest/lounge couldn't be better. We had a great view and a very comfortable bed. We have stayed at the Allegro, the Burnham and the Palomar, all Kimpton hotels. The Monaco was the last on our list for Kimpton properties and it was great. We go to Chicago quite often and always stay at one of the Kimpton hotels. They do a better job and their staffs always there for you. Try one out and you will see what I am talking about.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Overlook This Chicago Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DustyLensCap
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived curb-side until left for the airport three days later, I was very much impressed with the hotel, location, and service I received during my three-day stay! It's always a great sign when you are greeted curbside by the doorman and he remembers your name for the next three days! This is an older Chicago hotel with a great deal of character! I appreciated the welcome I received from Rick at the front desk as well as the excellent service I received from the bellman, resturant staff, and banquet staff. The location of this hotel is in the heart of the city, within walking distance of the theater district, river, and excellent resturants. If you're interested in a quiet, very well appointed hotel with lots of character, amazing service in an excellent downtown location--don't miss this Chicago hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I like the renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: gobucky133
Reviews.Content: Quick business trip and I generally like Kimpton Hotels. The renovated rooms are very nice. Spacious and modern (yet classy) decor. It's a great location---just off Michigan Ave. and a block from the El. Check-in was a good experience...they had all my preferences down as a Kimpton InTouch member. The room was very quiet (although it was facing East, so no street). There are many nice hotels in downtown Chicago, but the Hotel Monaco is right up there with the rest!

Reviews.Title: “Monaco”
Reviews.Author: Goodscout
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monaco on a business trip 1-21-2012 for 3 nights. I was greeted by friendly staff. The room was clean, comfy and quiet. I never heard any outside noise. The bed was great and the shower was warm and clean. I ate at the hotel restaurant 1 night. The coho salmon was excellent. Mortons is located next door. Thats another review. I would stay at the Monaco again.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been VERY Good, but.......”
Reviews.Author: KMKC08
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, as we were allowed to check in a bit early. However, I was extremely annoyed when I heard the single gentlemen next to me get upgraded to a suite, while I had a King room with my wife and infants. What was really annoying is that I am a Kimpton "In Touch" member, which is their rewards program. I will be canceling that membership, as it is obviously worthless. I didn't complain, because if they didn't offer, then the staff must not care and I will not stay again. The rooms are clean and well appointed, with comfortable beds but they are small. The window seats are a nice touch when you want to relax and view the river or skyline. The location is great, as you are at the top right corner of the Loop and near Magnificent Mile. One major complaint, and this is a big one.......cold food Every time we ordered room service or ate in the restaurant, our food was COLD. So, why didn't I complain? I don't send food back, as I fear the reprisals. This hotel could be great, but its the little things that make it miss. Boutique seems to be a nice way of saying, "not quite there yet or not 100% perfect".

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BobKathy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at this boutique hotel each time we spend the night in Chicago. We have never been disappointed. It is one block off of Michigan Avenue so is relatively quiet. It is close to shopping, the Art Institute, Symphony Center and wonderful restaurants. The staff is very friendly. The room is comfortable; some of them have window seats that look out onto Wacker Drive. It is a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mishmosh_1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and enjoyed it. Love the hotel happy hour. It provided a nice break from our holiday sight-seeing and shopping to stop and relax. The restaurant downstairs is great and super convenient for breakfast. Can't beat the location, right in the middle of everything. Walk to stores, art museum, restaurants. We paid extra to get a good view and it was worth it. (I think some rooms face a brick wall across an alley.) It was nice to sit in the window seat and watch the city. The room was wonderful, beds are super comfy and we enjoyed having a "pet" goldfish in our room for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Helpful staff, Cute Goldfish”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler32344
Reviews.Content: The Kimpton Hotels are boutique hotels that have an intimacy missing in bigger "chain" hotels. The Hotel Monaco, one of 4 Kimpton Hotels in Chicago is my favorite; the location is perfect for seeing the sights, the shops, restaurants, etc., every staff member was helpful and friendly. Ask for a goldfish for your room and it's a fun addition!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is an excellent hotel! Spotlessly clean, the room was beautifully decorated, well appointed, the bed was very comfortable. The service was truly excelellent. I travel frequently, and I can say with confidence that the service here is among the best, from the bellmen, to the concierge, front desk, and housekeeping; all were exceptionally helpful and friendly. The front desk staff know the area well and gave great tips for entertainment and getting around town. It was our anniversary weekend, and the staff surprised us with a complimentary bottle of champagne chilling in our room. A truly wonderful weekend, and I would highly recommend the hotel. Oh, and if you wish, you can ask for a goldfish to keep you company in your room. A quirky, fun little extra that we enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Downtown Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: michelle039
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel with some very nice touches, like complimentary glass of wine in the lobby each evening! Couple minutes walk to the Magnificent Mile; few minutes in opposite direction to the Art Institute of Chicago. Front desk staff and door staff very friendly, great bed linens, and room very clean. We had the Mediterranean Suite.....fantastic window seats (more like window beds, they were very spacious) Great place to take a break, lie in the window and look out on towards the river. Close to Mortons, The Steakhouse, if you want to splurge; coffee and bagel shops nearby as well. Great area to walk around and explore during the day and evening.

Reviews.Title: “Happy New Year Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: Live in Milwaukee, Wi. Stayed at the Hotel Monaco Chicago for New Year's with "the love of my life" ~ The hotel staff was outstanding starting with the valet! All very professional, courteous people. The hotel was very clean. The room was prepared to my expectations of elegance which added to the romantic environment I so wanted. If you are looking for a quiet, private romantic evening in downtown Chicago, I'd look no further! Thank you Hotel Monaco staff for creating the perfect setting for a perfect night in Chicago! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: gatsbyCleveland_Ohio
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Hotel Monaco Chicago. I can't say enough about the staff, the hotel itself, or the location. The hotel is right on the river. We've always booked the Mediterranean Suite with a river view, and it never disappoints. Lovely window seats that are wide enough to sleep in, a two person jacuzzi that is to die for. They recently renovated (although I found nothing wrong with their previous decor), and there are lots of rich colors. Very relaxing and cushy. The staff is just wonderful. They know when to help, when to leave you alone. The housekeeping staff is quick and quiet. We never heard them moving about in the hallways like we always do at other properties. Our housekeeper Maria left us a not on our last evening, saying it was a pleasure to serve us. She left us Starburst candies. She also would fold our hand towels into a swan for us. One day we were in the elevator going down to get a late lunch, and one of the bellmen gave us free drink tickets for no reason whatsover. Love that! The wine receptions in the evenings are a favorite (they have hot toddies and hot chocolate as well), and the coffee/hot chocolate in the mornings great too. They have hot chocolate "with all of the fixings" - including bacon bits. My husband tried the bacon bits and swears by it - I passed. You can't lose going to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and attractive hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: FuryIII
Reviews.Content: The son and I stayed here when he was visiting the University of Chicago. We arrived late evening and friendly Carolyn made our check-in easy and fast. She also was very helpful when I asked about transportation to the university, and we found it easily accessible via the Metra. The room was great: clean, spacious, attractively decorated with an eye for whimsy and featuring a gorgeous view of the river. The window seats, though a bit high off the ground, were wonderful, and one was the size of a small bed. The housekeeping staff was also really helpful during our stay, which was greatly appreciated. We found the hotel's location to be excellent for a walk to Millennium Park and other attractions. Definitely a recommended property; I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Affordable Luxury”
Reviews.Author: OneHappyVisitor
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight last week and wished I was able to stay longer! This was my 2nd stay here. This hotel is in a great location, walking distance to many theaters, museums, state street shopping and restaurants. The atmosphere is fun, luxurious and still manages to be cozy, not stuffy. The staff were very helpful and friendly and my room was fantastic-especially the window seat overlooking the river! I turned on the soothing "nature sounds" and sat there for quite a while in my spa-like atmosphere. Almost hated to leave the room to go do my exploring! I also got turn-down service without even asking. I walked in my room and found chocolates on my bed, the lights just so and the tv had been turned into an aquarium with soothing music! A tip to all is to join the Kimpton Intouch Member program, it gets you little perks and credit towards free stays. The wine hour (with hot toddies) was very nice too. The only negatives I found were the bath towels were a little rough, the window seat was a little high for us short people (maybe a pretty step stool?) and the coffee was in the lobby, forcing me to get dressed and see other people before I really wanted to. I would and do still recommend this as a great boutique hotel with a great atmosphere, great location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “FAB-u-lous!”
Reviews.Author: inkedearbuds
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in April a couple years ago. If there is one thing I love, it's a boutique hotel. Our room had an awesome view (and large window seat) of the river. The bed was super comfy, and I even recall popping one of those bath fizz balls into the tub one night and soaking away the day's walk. The location is outstanding, and the staff is always ready to help with any need you have. I thought the decor was fantastic, as well. We had an amazing dinner at South Water Kitchen one night. We also used the bar as a pre-planning spot before heading out at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: MrButton
Reviews.Content: I warm and lovely place to stay. Walkable to tons of sights.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome!”
Reviews.Author: Gina C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco Chicago the weekend before Thanksgiving with our family of 4. We stayed in a Mediterranean Suite so we could have a separate room for the kids, but they insisted on sleeping in the huge window seats in the bedroom. We had such a great time staying here. The front desk staff was so welcoming, and the bellmen were very friendly to my children. Every need was taken care of immediately and with a smile. Add to that the amazing river views, the comfortable beds, and the yummy food at South Water Kitchen, and I think we've found our favorite Chicago hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Klion77
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location and loved the rooms! Get a room with the window seat - great place to have your coffee. The rooms were very clean and the staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Chicago Hotel, Hands Down!”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoThereYesterday
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is in the perfect location: across from the river, a quick stroll from Millennium Park and Michigan Avenue. There is so much to do and see within walking distance or you can hop a bus or the el to get you anywhere else in the city. Cabs are also plentiful here. The doorman is happy to get you one if you need it. The lobby is beautiful, the people at the front desk are always welcoming and a complimentary cocktail hour is included (every night, if I'm not mistaken.) The rooms are AWESOME! HM is a boutique and is classically Kimpton in that the rooms are decorated with a modern and unique flair. We stayed in a room with a huge window nook that overlooks the river. Super cool. It's notable that although HM is in a prime location, I have never heard any street noise. This is hard to find in the city-I'd even be willing the pay a little more for the quiet, but you don't have to here! The best part about this place is the value. We paid around $130 on a nice Chicago weekend. I suspect prices go higher on prime Chicago weekends in summer (airshow, Taste of Chicago, etc.) but they do everywhere, so book a stay here and try it out. You'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: familywith3boys
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is my favorite Kimpton properties. I love the service and extra touches and the pizazzz in the way the rooms are decorated. My kids especially liked the window seats! We spent a night in the Mediterranean Suite, which has 3 window seats, including one extra deep one (about 5 feet deep). You can lay in there, bask out the window and really get away from it all. We have 3 kids ages 8-15 and they were entertained playing hide and seek throughout the suite. We were in walking distance to many venues in Chicago--within a mile to Willis Tower and Navy Pier. Very close to Trump Tower, Millenium Park and State Street. Also, a good place to stay if you are going to the theater district. There's a wine reception at night (with hot apple cider for kids); very few appetizeres (just 2 plates which they ran out of and didn't replenish). In the morning they have free coffee and tea and, during this time of year, hot chocolate with all the toppings. Many patrons bring their dogs which you will see some with (all on leashes) in the lobby. The lobby had scrabble game ready to play. My 8 year old received a free gift bag with a yo yo and other little toys. We requested a gold fish, which they offer, for the room and got one, however after 3 requests, which was a bit frustrating. I saw signs that they offer free flip video cameras for use while you are there, but we had brought our own so did not use. Parking is a bit expensive at $43 but it has in and out privileges and you can drop your car off anytime the day you check in and if you check out by 2:00 pm the next day,you will only be charged for one day (even if over than 24 hours).

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hotel Monaco!!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel645
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Hotel Monaco the last few times we were in Chicago, most recently Dec 16-18th. Great location close to Millennium Park, Michigan Ave and the theatre district! Rooms are comfortable and fun! Highly recommend staying there when visiting Chicago or any other city that has a Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel well located”
Reviews.Author: nicolas414
Reviews.Content: Modern good hotel well located in the loop. The hotel is very close to the "State" CTA train station (all train lines) and bus stop is very close. It is located next to the Hard Rock CafÃ© Hotel. River north neighborhood (for restaurants and bars) and Mag Mile (for shopping) is very close and can easily be reached on foot. State street in the loop (Macy's, Foot locker etc) is 5 min walk as well as the Millenium Park. The rooms are well furnished and have flat screen TV and Ipod/Ipad pluggin music station. Rooms are large and have all needed facilities. You can even have a gold fish in your room (free of charge)! On the hotel website you will find the best rates available. Daily from 5pm to 6pm, the hotel offers a free wine aperitif in the lobby and free coffee in the morning, We booked the cheapest room that was good but had absolutely no view on the street (95usd per night + tax without breakfast). Rooms with a view are more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Weekend”
Reviews.Author: AB121212
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Mediterranean suite for two nights. We found the room very spacious and well laid out. The bathroom was a good size, but we did not use the tub. It looked like it would take a lot of water to fill! The bathrobes were fun, the one in our room probably could have used replacing as it was well worn - but not a big deal. The bathroom and bedrooms were very clean! Everyone was very friendly. We only have minor feedback. We would have LOVED a coffee maker in the room. The hotel had free coffee downstairs, but then you have to get dressed and look decent to make the walk down there. We got some coffee to take up to our room, though the cups were small. The only other thing was the remote control in the living room of our suite was sticky from a previous guest. I am not sure how often those things get cleaned but the buttons were sticking and it looked like it could have used some cleaning, plus the batteries were out. We used the remote from the bedroom for both TV's. Not a huge deal as we would have called downstairs if it was a big issue. Overall we had an excellent stay and would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Only place in Chi town!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney C
Reviews.Content: Whether for a romantic stay with my husband, or a family weekend with the dog, Hotel Monaco is our favorite hotel in Chicago. The staff is amazing, the rooms are immaculate and beautiful, and the location is perfect. Although it's very pet friendly, there isn't the slightest hint (odor) anywhere! Just the occasional beagle or poodle strolling with its owner through the lobby! The evening wine hour and morning coffee in the lobby were icing on the cake. We will be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Staff”
Reviews.Author: chimarycha
Reviews.Content: Let's start by saying, I love a Kimpton hotel, but I love this one more than most. This is my preferred hotel for business trips to Chicago. The hotel is conveniently located at the top of the loop, so you can walk anywhere you need to go. Are there rooms with el track veiws, yes, but there are also rooms with views of the river and Marina Towers. The rooms have window seats and very comfortable beds and seating areas. The rooms and location are great, but the staff are amazing. You feel genuinely welcomed by the front desk. Room service is open late, so when your flight into O'Hare is delayed (which it will be) you can have a nice meal. They also keep delivery menus at the front desk, in case nothing on the delivery menu peaks your interest. Feeling lonely? Miss your pet? They will bring you a goldfish. The cleaning staff is also top-notch. One member of the cleaning crew left me a note asking me to leave her any special instructions on the nightstand so that she could ensure I would enjoy my stay. The people at this hotel are simply great. If I were to nit-pick, I would warn you that 1.) the picture on the tv is not good and 2.) the toilet paper is on the rough side. That said, I still give this hotel an excellent rating.

Reviews.Title: “Fun night in the city!”
Reviews.Author: LilCricket
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Hotel Monaco after going to the theater - hotel was very clean, great location and quiet - would stay at Hotel Monaco again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Sbaygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ventured into the big city for our 39th wedding anniversary yesterday. We chose the Hotel Monaco for an overnight stay because I had stayed at a Monaco in Alexandria VA last year and liked it. The Chicago version did not disappoint! From the moment of our arrival until our departure, we were treated with attentive hospitality. If you are considering a stay at a Kimpton property, I recommend you sign up for their Kimpton Rewards. It's free. Also if you are on Facebook, "like" Kimpton.., you will get access to special unadvertised perks. We received a fantastic room rate, a $10 credit towards our in-room mini-bar, 2 free drink vouchers at the South Water Kitchen restaurant adjacent to the hotel, and a complimentary morning newspaper (although inexplicably we received the New York Times instead of a Chicago paper). Additionally we were surprised with a complimentary bottle of bubbly, compliments of Ryan, the assistant general manager. What a thoughtful touch to help us celebrate our special day! The lobby was tastefully decked out for the holiday season, and a cozy fireplace provided extra ambiance. The evening wine reception, a signature Kimpton touch, was delightful. It's a great way to settle in and meet fellow travelers from far and near. If you are a pet lover, there's sure to be a four legged guest in attendance as well. Our room was very clean and quiet, although our outdoor view was of another building next door. Since we were only staying one night, however, this was not an issue for us. The Aveda toiletries are very nice. The only improvement I would suggest would be to provide a complimentary shower cap, as this is typically something we ladies forget to bring. The hotel is located in the north Loop area, just a short walk to the theater district and lots of good dining. Walk one block east to Michigan Avenue and catch a bus for a short ride to the Mag Mile shopping district, or take a stroll through Millennium Park and wind up at the Art Institute for a world-class cultural experience. Yes, I am Chicago-born but have happily lived my adult life in "the burbs". A trip into the city for me is a treat, and this brief respite was truly a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kmls
Reviews.Content: We booked this Kimpton Hotel based on a friend's recommendation, and we were not disappointed. We are still in the midst of our three-night stay here, and sold on the Hotel Monaco experience! The room is gorgeous, quiet, and the added touch of a window seat with the Chicago river view charmed us from the get-go. The staff has been extremely polite and pleasant. Location is nearly unbeatable right at the border of the river and the Loop. 100% certain we will book the Monaco for our next visit in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: Streamborne
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed a holiday season weekend in Chicago and stayed at the Monaco because we like Kimpton hotels and find them to be an excellent value. Location was very good - within easy walk of the Chicago Symphony Center (which we attended one evening), the great shopping along Michigan Ave. (just across the river), the Chriskindlmarkt, and many excellent restaurants. Monaco is well-appointed and has a complimentary evening wine service. The adjoining South Water Kitchen serves an excellent breakfast/brunch. Monaco is not quite the Four Seasons but far less pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: fleamarketfilms
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was beautiful. The staff were amazing. We were upgraded to a double queen river view suite. The view was spectacular from the "Meditation Nook"(Window Seat). We will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy stay”
Reviews.Author: SanjBha
Reviews.Content: Every year we stay here for a meeting. The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming. We love the nightly wine hour as it brings all of our friends who stay here together. No matter what goes on with the meeting, we meet at 5 for a wine. The location is great- easy walk to Michigan. Rooms are big with window seats. Art deco style and very clean. Only hang up is the gym room which was small until recently. Now it has been expanded and is pretty nice. The adjacent restaurant serves a nice breakfast too! Free wifi if you join the Kimpton rewards program (for free). The net effect is that we feel like we will keep returning here!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Jes'peachy
Reviews.Content: Celebrated a friend's birthday with Christmas shopping, eating, enjoying Chicago art/theater offerings, and this hotel made us feel so welcome. Hot chocolate in the morning and wine in the evening were treats. Comfortable room with a view of river-- great beds and linens. Even had a pet goldfish (we named him "Potbelly") for a few days. Hotel staff had insightful restaurant choices. We plan to visit again-- maybe make it a holiday tradition!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: gohde16
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago. We had some difficulty getting on the right street to get us to the front of the hotel when we first arrived but once inside it was like coming home. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Even though our room lacked a fantastic view the room made up for it in size, cleanliness and comfort. The thermostat was accurate and quiet. We enjoyed our big flat screen tv and felt totally at home throughout our stay. We found the hotel to be in a great location for shopping, restaurants and we were still close enough to walk to Grant Park! And did I mention...the restaurant was great!

Reviews.Title: “Like a boutique”
Reviews.Author: Nancy R
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! Very charming, eclectic, boutique-like hotel with great service and accommodations. My teenage daugther and I have made it a tradition to stay here the Friday after Thanksgiving. We go see "A Christmas Carol" at the Goodman Theater, just a couple of blocks away. We have dinner in the city and then go shopping on Saturday. It is a great outing in my favorite city. My only negative comments is that our view this year was not as nice as last year (but still loved the room) and the parking (valet only) is expensive. This year we parked at the Theater Parking for the Goodman (the theater gives you a discount ticket) and then checked into the hotel; for 24 hours it cost $20 with the discount ($31 regularly) versus the $46 charged by the hotel. Since we were on a shortstay, it was no big deal to walk the two blocks with our light luggage. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the big city”
Reviews.Author: dwraff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just finished our 3 day stay at the Hotel Monaco and thought I would give a quick review. Â To start with, the service is wonderful. Â Everyone that we dealt with at the hotel were very pleasant and professional. Â Not over the top, forced smile, fake enthusiastic friendly, just pleasant and efficient customer service. The room we stayed in, which had a wonderful river view, was very nice and well cleaned. Â My wife and I loved the multiple window seats overlooking the river or city, depending on where you sat/lounged/snoozed. Â Nice little hotel that you should check out on your next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fab-u-lous!”
Reviews.Author: MommyKeyes
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location, great deals, window seat overlooking the river, zebra and tiger terry robes, goldfish pet in your room if you wish, eclectic decor is fabulous never boring, lobby wine reception. Saw this hotel featured on the travel channel and couldn't wait to experience it first hand. It was everything and more. My new favorite hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: NKLounger
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Monaco. The location is perfect. The rooms were clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I got a low price as part of a package deal so the hotel offered good value. Otherwise, I was hoping for a bit more based on the other reviews I saw. I think this is a solid 3 1/2 star hotel. Good but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a location”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: Can't fault the friendly staff. Hotels rooms are clean and large. Location is absolutely superb! Parks, Sears, Magnificent Mile all within easy walking distance... Sorted out a cab back to the airport no problem. Strongly recommend walking to the Hilton to see that and also the Artist Cafe for breakfast. We were a family of four and a half - four adults and a six month old. Ideal hotel for us - we stayed on the 11th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Another Kimpton success”
Reviews.Author: Caroline M
Reviews.Content: This hotel like the others in the chain was amazing for our stay in Chicago.. It is placed perfectly for north and south of the river and right on the Loop. Staff and service are excellent. Everyone is fun and friendly, you feel so much at home. Nothing is too much trouble. The main problem is getting out of those lovely comfortable beds to visit the city! The restaurant though a bit pricey was excellent. A turkey wrap was enough for 2 and the best fries ever. It makes such a difference coming back to a place at the end of your day where the staff are really interested in what you have done and bought. A great stay , thanks so much.

Reviews.Title: “Bravo, Hotel Monaco!”
Reviews.Author: 531k
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Monaco for the very first time the weekend of November 18. Having never heard anything - good or bad - about the property, I had no idea what to expect. What a delight! Everything was excellent all the way around - from the decor, the impeccable maid service, friendly front desk staff (thanks, Mark!), delicious food in the restaurant, great downtown location to the goldfish friend to keep us company! As a suburbanite who often commutes into the city for events and a way to escape, I've found a real gem that I'll visit again. Be sure to sign up for their InTouch loyalty program. This free membership gave us $10 towards a mini-bar purchase as well as free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco...a perfect stay, as usual!”
Reviews.Author: jimissy10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monaco several times...and it is our favorite hotel on the planet! However, it has been a while since we shared our feelings and experiences with fellow travelers, so we decided it was time to write another review. Practically speaking, the Hotel Monaco is ideally located. It's near the corner of Wabash and Wacker, just steps away from public transportation, across the street from a 7-Eleven and one of our other favorite haunts in Chicago--The Emerald Loop. The hotel restaurant, South Water Kitchen, is just wonderful! Throw in the afternoon wine reception, and we are always tempted to just hang out in the 200-block of North Wabash and never leave...everything we really need is right there! The staff--every desk clerk, bell-hop, housekeeper--is tremendously friendly and helpful. Case in point: We forgot to bring the power cable for our laptop, and the front desk staff tried and tried to locate one for us. Even better case in point: Leftovers from our meal at the aforementioned Emerald Loop were re-warmed for us at 3:00 am when we returned from a night on the town and decided we were hungry. But, unlike at home, these leftovers weren't just nuked...the staff plated it up beautifully and served it as if it had come from their own restaurant! Way above and beyond! Finally, to put it simply, it is just beautiful at the Monaco. The decor...the artwork...the color scheme...I always start to feel relaxed as soon as we walk into the lobby. Then we walk into our room, and I can almost hear my tension cracking away. Visit their website...take a virtual tour...sign up to be a Kimpton In-Touch member (a free service)...and go to the Monaco!

Reviews.Title: “Location makes this a great downtown hotel.”
Reviews.Author: peachesrsweet
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights and really liked being able to walk many places so easily. The rooms are comfortable and the window seat is so fun. We had a top floor room with a view so make sure to request river view. It was special for a country dweller like me!

Reviews.Title: “Window Seats and the View- wow!”
Reviews.Author: DetroitareaKate
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed in the Hotel Palomar, but decided to try a different hotel in the Kimpton chain. Rooms are nice and beds are comfy. Our bathroom was a bit outdated, but it was fine. We stayed in a room with a view over the Chicago River and window seats. This feature was so cool and unique. Where we have no complaints about Hotel Monaco and had a great stay, Palomar has nicer rooms and a more interesting bar. If you're looking for a room with a view, Monaco should be your choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great location”
Reviews.Author: GoBlue88
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here on business several times. Perfect loop location just across the river from Trump's new building. Good fitness center, free wine tastings every night from 5-6pm, very nice rooms, free WiFi. Short walk to the nearest train/subway stop, not to mention many restaurants and bars. Also has good meeting facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MariaWaltham
Reviews.Content: This first-time visit to Chicago for a one day traing could have been stressful. Not so when you are staying in this beautiful hotel. Start with a room on the 9th floor, looking at the river and dramatic high rises. Add the most luxurious window seat to in the city and you will forget the flight and taxi ride needed to get here. I would definitely like to come back. Good gym facilities. Wish there was a pool. Nice wine hour at 5:00. Great, attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable short stay”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monaco on an overnight visit to Chicago. From the doorman to the Bellman to the Front Desk clerk to the Restaurant staff, they were all excellent in their roles and made our short stay very enjoyable. The room was exactly as described on the website and was extremely comfortable and well equipped. We would stay here again as the hotel met every requirement we had and is so well located for business and social needs.

Reviews.Title: “I want to go back! Best Hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: shus s
Reviews.Content: I usually can't be bothered with writing reviews and i'm extremly picky when it comes to hotels and cleanliness - however Hotel Monaco excedded all my expectations that i had to write a review. From our arrival to departure we have no complaints! The Bell hops - valet service - house keeping are all so kind and genuine, i would have to say that they are alot more welcoming and friendly then the actual front desk personel. The rooms decor is stunning and a decent size. The beds are extremly comfortable and location of the hotel is excellent. Another plus for us was the fact that it was pet friendly. We ordered room service for breakfast during our stay and it was delicious! Although it is less expensive if you just go downstairs to the restaurant and eat there rather then order room service. However the food is excellent and the portions are a decent size. The hotel also offers complimentary tea and starbucks coffee every morning - another plus! And every evening they have complimentary wine as well. Its an excellent location for shopping just a block away from Macy's on State Street which is about 8-9 floors of sheer shoppers heaven and about a block or two away from Michigan Ave - which offers the magnificent mile, water tower place and the huge oversized Marilyn Monroe. I fell in love with Chicago and Hotel Monaco. If your contemplating on which hotel to stay in - your search is over Hotel Monaco is a MUST! you will not regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my first stay at a Kimpton”
Reviews.Author: MexicaliGal
Reviews.Content: this was my first stay at a Kimpton Hotel and hopefully not the last. The Hotel Monaco has lots of personal touches that made my stay on business enjoyable. First the decor of this boutique hotel is lovely. Makes you feel more like you're staying at home - or should I say "a really nice" home, than at a hotel. They had a wine hour every night from 5-6pm in the lobby. You could head down, grab your glass and bring it back to your room, or stick around the nice lobby and socialize. I even got a goldfish to keep me company in the room! Just ask at the front desk. The staff very friendly and helpful. Every time you re-entered the building, you were greeted with a "Welcome Home". Nice touch. If you bring down your details within 3 hrs of departing, they will take care of printing your boarding pass if you need one. The location is right on the South end on The Miracle Mile and the North end of the business loop. Great location for walking to shopping, restaurants and Millennium Park. If you were ambitious, you can even walk to the Aquarium and some of the museums from here. Lastly - be sure to become a free member of the Kimpton In Touch Loyalty program before you go and you'll get free wi-fi, and it doesn't hurt to Facebook friend them as well before you go, I got a gift delivered to my room for being a friend - two delicious cupcakes from the local bakery!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: LaineyBlu
Reviews.Content: Over the past three years, I've had the opportunity to travel a lot and stay in many hotels, ranging from youth hostels to five star suites. Out of all of them, Monaco is the best I've found. The staff were all incredibly nice and friendly, and they made a point not just to give me what I asked for, but to ask what I needed, and offer things I didn't think of. Turn down service included bringing ice, so I never had to go get it. Joining Kimpton In-Touch before my stay let me enter my preferences and get free wi-fi. I saved up for a special trip and got a suite. It was gorgeous, huge, and luxurious. I've found that beds in four-star and five-star places usually aren't any more comfortable than beds in cheapo motels, but the bed at the Monaco was perfect. The decor looks a little tacky in the website photos, but in person it's beautiful. I especially loved the window seats. They were very high, but with a bit of a running start and a hop, I could climb up onto a huge, wide, thick cushion and look down onto the bustling street, up to the Sears (Willis) Tower and Chicago skyline, and catch a glimpse of the Michigan River. The window seats were big and comfortable enough to sleep in if I had wanted to. I had three of them in my room. The minibar did not have sensors, so I could store my own drinks in the fridge without worrying about being charged for something I didn't use. The bathroom was smaller than your average four star suite bathroom, but the jetted tub was almost big enough to swim in, and so deep the water would have come up to my neck sitting upright. It would have been nice to have more room and better lighting for makeup. I did my makeup in the full length mirror in the giant bedroom, where there was more light, and a tiny table. I had room service once, and the food was OK. The price was more than the convenience was worth. The location right next to the Magnificent Mile was perfect for me as a tourist and someone who loves to shop. Luckily I had a friend in Chicago to show me how to use the transit system and where to go for fun. The bare facts in this review don't quite describe why my stay was so much nicer than any other. I think it was just the friendliness of the staff and the atmosphere of the hotel that made it exceptional. One of the best trips of my life.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: bob w
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived by train from Maryland early on the 27th of October, it was raining and we decided to take the bags to the hotel and go out and sight see. When we arrived we were told to wait because she could get us in the room early. We sat in the beautiful lobby and had a cup of coffee and read the paper, within 30 minutes she came over to us to tell us that the room was ready, We were taken to the room and WOW, quite a room, big bed and a wonderful view overlooking the Chicago river, The large window had a large window seat large enough to sleep in!!!! My wife and myself would sit there and read the paper and look out the window, so relaxing. The hotel location is great too, close to many nice bars and eateries in the area and within walking distance, both north and south. We will come back to this hotel, we have stayed in Monoco hotels before and were never dissapointed. The staff was great!!! from the Bellboy to the Manager, top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: DrFritz
Reviews.Content: Like most Kimpton's, the hospitality was first rate - especially at the wine hour. In the case of the Chicago Monaco, the location was also first rate. Very centrally located. We had a river view room that included a window bench that offered a great place to stretch out and read while viewing the river.

Reviews.Title: “very good... if you find a good price”
Reviews.Author: carola
Reviews.Content: Clean and beautiful room and bathroom. good location very near magnificent mile. small lobby and pretty nice attached restaurant. nothing out of the ordinary but if you find a good deal go for it. ask for the fish in your room, nice detail.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: mntravellers3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice over the summer. We ended up staying in the same room both times. The room was large and modern, and we loved the window seat! It was very clean and felt new. The location is great, within easy walking distance of shopping and sightseeing. I'm a Kimpton In Touch member, so I was able to get a good rate through that. Since it's a Kimpton, it's a pet friendly hotel, so we were able to bring our dog at no extra charge. I've also stayed a the Hotel Palomar (another Kimpton hotel close by) and prefer this one for it's homier atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for work and going back for pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Ejkeller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights for a business trip and loved the hotel. I've stayed at 2 of the other Kimpton hotels in Chicago (Burnham and Allegro) and all 3 are great but this one has a slightly better location in my mind than the other 2 mentioned. Love the wine hour and Starbucks coffee in the morning. If you join the Kimpton loyalty program, you also get a $10 mini bar credit, free Wi-fi, a newspaper, and a nightly turndown service. Wow! Room was large and comfortable. Great fitness room. Everything about this hotel was great and I'm heading back in December for a pleasure stay this time!

Reviews.Title: “Neat boutique hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LTKING
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monaco based on the TA reviews. After I booked it, I later found out my sister stayed there and she told me she loves Kimpton hotels. This hotel is in the heart of everything, in my opinion. Each day I got out and walked around made me realize what a fantastic location this place is. I got lucky and got a fantastic high room with a view of the river. Part of what makes this hotel unique is that each room has a nook, which juts out over the street so you have (or I had) a fantiastic view of the street and the river. It's a great place to read and watch over the city. We used it ever day we were there. The hotel had a very lively social hour each day, that many people went down to hang out. Of the 5 nights I was there, I could walk to 4 of the restaurants I booked. Walking to the Michigan shopping district took less than 10 minutes. I love the comforter on the bed. The staff was great and you can "adopt" a fish if you get lonely, believe it or not.

Reviews.Title: “One of my fav's”
Reviews.Author: lberezny
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for travellers' new to Chicago and wanting to see all the sights. We've stayed at other Kimpton's and like them a lot. This is one of the best. Nice room, excellent attention to our safe which wasn't working when we arrived and an engineer stayed to fix it until it was working or we felt we would need to change our room. Helpful staff - proud of their city. Great restaurant. We will return! Linda and Joel Zuieback

Reviews.Title: “Great room, location”
Reviews.Author: Dexterb
Reviews.Content: Our recent 4 night stay could not have been better. We had a great room with a window seat. The hotel is in a perfect location for walking or taking the subway. The staff was great and the nightly wine hour was a perfect way to relax after a day of sightseeing. I wouldn't conisder staying at another hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Below Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Joe-Bob-69
Reviews.Content: My first stay at this hotel and was expecting good things based on reviews. For some reason, I kept being disappointed at every turn. Noisy room on the 4th floor. Could not get the room to cool down - it was stifling. BE WARNED - No water, no mini-bar no vending machine, no nothing once you get in your room. You might as well be in prison. They have coffee in the morning, but it starts at 6 so I had to wait both days. I guess that is convenient for them, but what about me? Workout facility - pretty small but not the smallest. The only treadmill I could get on was broken. Guess what a cooler with water in it! Oh no - it was only stocked for one day. After that nothing. Way to set expectations and then fail to deliver. Same with towels - one day they have them - next day they don't. They essentially forced me to sign up for their loyalty program to avoid a riduculous $10 charge for wireless (go a few doors down to Starbucks where it is free). They should fire the marketing moron who came up with that approach. I have stayed at much better for less. Won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, excellent location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: popgirl101
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Hotel Monaco and we weren't disappointed. The location was excellent, well within walking distance of Michigan Avenue, State Street and Millennium Park. The Trump Tower is also just over the road - a useful landmark if you get lost!. The room was stylishly decorated and we LOVED the enormous windowsill that you could sit in and people-watch - a real bonus. Everything was very clean and the shower was excellent (my pet peeve is bad water pressure in hotels!). The staff were friendly and helpful, room service was prompt and we had a really good meal at South Water Kitchen, the restaurant downstairs. All in all, a really good hotel and we loved our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “First time in the windy city.”
Reviews.Author: jessica_schmidt3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here about a year ago and had such an amazing time. I have never been to Chicago and really had the best hotel to stay in and view the city. We had the 10th floor and the room was so beautiful and comfortable. I have a temperpidic bed and have a had time with hotel room bed, or anyother beds. THe beds they have are Sooooo, soft. I wanted to take it home with me, the pillows, sheets, and blankets were soft as well. They have a wine hour, bath room was huge and loved the big bath tub!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky Hotel With A LOT of Swagger”
Reviews.Author: Shan16
Reviews.Content: Friendly/hospitable staff, chic modern decor, great location -- 5 min walk to shopping on Magnificent Mile & Millennium Park and it overlooks the Chicago River. Sign-up to become a Kimpton member (it's free) and you'll get a discount on rates along with free wi-fi and a $10 credit to raid the mini bar when you check-in. Also, if you become their friend on Facebook, you'll get a complimentary bottle of wine and a sweet note. You get comfy animal print robes to wear, Aveda products, an umbrella in case of rain and if you get lonely, they'll even bring up a goldfish to your room. Concierge was friendly and gave us great suggestions. Spend a little more for one of the corner rooms with the two large window seats that overlook the river... you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LWS-NYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a wedding and had an excellent time. Our room was spacious wih a large bathroom - the rooms are definitely not cookie cutter. It was well decorated and modern. As members of the Kimpton hotel program, we received free internet and a $10 minibar credit. In the closet, were not only the robe you find in many hotels, but also some slipper socks (for a cold evening) and an umbrella in case it rained. Matress was firm and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great service. Boutique hotel with lots of little amenities. The most powerful hotel shower ever!”
Reviews.Author: Arubaguest
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here for a much needed girls weekend. Close to Michigan ave shopping, right on the river. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Classic Kimpton kitch (leopard print robes!) combined with high quality service. Make sure to ask for a room with a large window overlooking the river so you can enjoy the windowsill makeshift lounge area.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time Was Had By All!”
Reviews.Author: gingerann_11
Reviews.Content: My son, his seven year old daughter, my eighty seven year old mother and myself all converged on Chicago in the dead of winter just to see each other (we live in the surrounding globe). My grandaughter was allowed to sleep on the windowsill of the ladies room. My son had one ajoining. What fun!

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheshireCatBedford
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently placed for sight-seeing and shopping. The staff are efficient and helpful. Our room was lovely and the potions and lotions in the bathroom were by Aveda. We used the restaurant twice during our stay. The food is good but the chef doesn't seem to know quite where he's going - some dishes are huge and rustic Italian-style, others are more French - beautifully presented and the portions much smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, companion goldfish, not enough coffee”
Reviews.Author: mneumark
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and very pet-friendly. The people were very nice, the beds were amazing, turn down was lovely. We even got a companion goldfish to stay with us in the room, and housekeeping took care of him during our stay - adorable! Free coffee in the morning, but there were short hours and no decaf, which was odd for such a nice hotel otherwise. Free wine in the evening, which is awesome. Overall very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: ginam650
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a couple of nights in a Mediterranean Suite. Check in was a breeze, the bellman brought up our bags and gave us a tour of the room and everything in it and made sure we were good before he left. I think everyone talks about the window seats, but I'm going to talk about them too because it was the BEST thing about the room. It was the first place I went to when we would come back to the room, they are great. The bathroom was super nice. The bathtub was huge, the shower was a bit on the small side, but it worked fine. The separate living room with a tv was nice and the room was decorated beautifully. The bed was very comfortable and the staff brought up extra pillows within 5 minutes of calling the front desk for them. The staff was great about answering questions about good restaurants and some great local festivals that were happening over the weekend. Our room was on the 9th floor and had a clear view of the river which was beautiful, especially at night. I posted a comment on the hotels facebook page and when we came back one evening there were two cupcakes waiting for us, with a nice note thanking us for being a facebook fan...it's the little things! :) Kimpton Hotels really know what they are doing. They truly know how to make people feel comfortable and know how to make people happy. The coffee/tea in the mornings was great and the wine reception in the evening was a great way to meet other travelers and get to know people. I can't wait to go away again just so I can stay at a Kimpton Hotel, the next time I think I'll bring my dog.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgw W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco over marathon weekend after a friend recommended we stay here and we will definitely be back. I've never reviewed a hotel but we had such a good experience I feel compelled to spread the word about this quaint hotel. Our trip started on a good note when we got a personal email from Mark at the front desk a couple of days prior to our arrival.
