He answered a few questions we had and we already felt welcome and we hadn't even packed our bags yet. In the past we have stayed at the Ritz or the Peninsula, and as much as we like those hotels, the Monaco is much better value for money, especially if you are travelling with children. I believe we stayed the riverview Mediterranean suite, which we would book again in a heartbeat. The kids had a separate room. One of our kids opted to sleep in the massive window seat/bench area & he is still talking about it a week later. The other slept on the pull-out sofa, which is remarkably stable and sturdy for a pull-out. We were spoiled by the starbucks coffee in the lobby every morning and are now addicted to the Garrett's Chicago Mix popcorn that was given to us at check-in. We didn't do this, but the hotel will put a goldfish bowl in your room if you or your children are needing a pet for your stay--very cute touch. The staff were warm and welcoming--we truly had the feeling of being in a home away from home and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Pombero23
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! Good breakfast in restaurant, clean rooms, friendly staff, wine reception and more!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous room with a view!”
Reviews.Author: Sam O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for two nights with our 8 year old daughter. The hotel staff were wonderful and the room was fabulous. We had a 2 queen river view, the window seat was a huge hit with us. A great comfortable spot for the 3 of us to watch the world go by. My daughter loved the goldfish pet and the staff provided her with a child size animal print robe to match ours. It is in a great location, we walked to Navy Pier, Magnificent Mile and hopped on the El to Willis Tower. We hopped on the Wendella boat lake and river tour just one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Helpfull and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Elefant09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very stylish , everything fits together It has the atmosphere of the glamorous hotels of former times with modern design. Ia was disappointed that our room did not have one of the alcoves, in the description it seemed that every room has one and I was looking forward to it. Our View was nonexistent with a parking garage blocking it. But that was the only bad thing. The room was very clean, comfortable and nicely furnished, although I prefer wood instead of carpet in a hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The concierge booked us on a excellent boat trip(( Architectural tour) tour on short notice. They have a very nice restaurant which is not too formal but casual and very nice. They have great specials every night and there also, the staff is very nice ( including the cook who came out to ask if everything is fine ) I would definitely stay there again. Location is great

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelerfl0rida
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. I picked it based on the trip advisor rating and I was not disappointed. The staff is friendly and takes care of requests. The room was clean and warm. The bed was comfortable. There was a window seat with a great view of the river. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem!”
Reviews.Author: ajo123
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely hotel in a great location. The roooms were very comfortable. Great for shopping and walking around the city. The concierge was very helpful regarding sightseeing and eateries. Make sure you take a boat trip- we took the architectural/history tour which was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Water Views”
Reviews.Author: JLee78
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick getaway with the wife. We had a great visit, and managed to fit a lot into three days. The hotel is close to everything, with easy access to the train station and just a few minute walk to the major attractions (Mag Mile, Navy Pier, Millennium Park, etc.). We only had to use cabs a few times, and even then we could have taken public transportation. The room was clean and spacious, we had a 12th floor river view. If you have not experienced the Monaco windows, they are what make this very good hotel truly great. Thank you to the front desk for recommending we wait for the 12th floor room to be ready (we arrived early). It was great people watching from the window, and free Internet access for Kimpton InTouch members is nice. We are foodies, and made sure to visit a number of spots, and would recommend the following; - Mindy's Hot Chocolate (Wicker Park) - a little bit out of the way, but we really liked the neighborhood and the restaurant was amazing. The Mexican Hot Chocolate and burger were excellent. - Frontera Grill - Rick Bayless is all over Top Chef and Food Network, and with good reason. - Russian Tea Time - a little hole in the wall a few blocks from the hotel. Great "comfort food" - Lao Sze Chuan (Chinatown) - a quick trip down the red line for excellent Szechuan cooking Overall, it was a great trip, my wife also ran in the 10k Susan G. Komen Race for the Cure. The Caps lost to the Hawks, but its just pre-season. We'll be back to Chicago for another visit and will definitely stay at the Hotel Monaco again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business”
Reviews.Author: Uphill_from_Denver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel Monaco this past week, while in Chicago for a conference. My room was large, the bed was comfortable, the water pressure in the shower was good. One nice thing is the shower head is set HIGH no need to duck your head to get wet here. Not much in the way of views from my 8th floor room, but the window was large and let in enough light. The hotel is near the EL and is right between the loop and N. Michigan easy to walk to either.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: KandSSurrey
Reviews.Content: Easy to get too - either Cab from Airport - about $35 - or via CTA - wabash stop only about 2-3 mins down the road. Just round the corner from Al Capones 'place' where the stratosphere is. (not open to public at present) The hotel is clean, friendly and very good location, we found everything pretty easy to get too. They have a 'Wine' hour 5-6pm and is a good place to meet others in hotel and exchange ideas / outings that you have done. Hotel currently is offering a free loan of a Flip camera, and they download the pictures and email them to you. - only found this out about 24 hrs before due to leave. Breakfast is good, but a little less choice than Bakery on the Corner and more money. They have a bar too, and this is useful if weather turns. If i go back to Chicago - probably will - i will definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, service, and experience”
Reviews.Author: Mthecica
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several Kimpyons and have consistently been impressed by the service, location, rooms, and overall experience. Because of this we had very high expectations for the Hotel Monaco. Our expectations were exceeded at every turn! Our room was spacious and inviting - especially the window seat overlooking the river. Every employee we came in contact with was friendly, cheerful, knowledgeable, and helpful. We were staying during Lollapalooza, and employees frequently asked us questions about the festival and our experience there, and didn't bat an eye when we returned dripping wet and muddy from one of the shows. The Hotel Monaco was exactly what we've cone to expect from Kimpton and ensured that we will continue to patronage this spectacular hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy decor, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: layla6202
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Chicago for the first time and stayed at the Hotel Monaco. We could not have picked a more perfect location. Not only was the hotel within walking distance to just about everything on our to do list (Willis Tower, Millenium Mile, Wendella Architectural boat tour, the Navy Pier), but there is an el-train stop right around the corner from the hotel so you can catch the train to other great locations such as Lincoln Park or Wrigley Field. My only requests for any hotel are generally: clean and quiet please. The Monaco gave us that and more; our room was on the twelfth floor, far away from any ice machines, street or elevator noise. Although the hotel is on busy street, once you enter its doors, it is like a quiet sanctuary where the staff are extremely helpful and friendly. The room decor was trendy and modern, yet comfortable with assets such as a window seat with pillows and a blanket to watch the view of the river and animal print bathrobes to lounge about. The beds were extremely comfortable, and the evening turn-down service leaves above-average chocolates on your pillow each night. I advise future guests to sign up to be a (free) Kimpton member so they can take advantage of the free wi-fi; otherwise, there is a fee for that service. Also, if you become a Kimpton member, you will get a $10 gift card to raid the mini-bar. If you'd rather enjoy a drink with others, then you might enjoy the complimentary wine social in the evenings, or the coffee and tea bar in the morning. This hotel has put some thought into what guests want, and then gone the extra mile such as having goldfish available to share your room with you in case you're lonely. I have no qualms about recomennending this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful from every aspect”
Reviews.Author: msb1323
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at a Kimpton in Chicago and we will return. Everybody we interfaced with was interesting, helpful, warm and made us feel special. Wonderful location for walking in every direction and most convenient for the train to the airport. Quiet, warm and inviting. Marcia

Reviews.Title: “Loved the window nook”
Reviews.Author: Lesley L
Reviews.Content: My family of three really loved this hotel. The location was perfect. We walked everywhere. My 3 year old loved the window nook! Wine reception every night was wonderful and the staff was very friendly. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a cool hip hotel in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: Cinderella-SFO
Reviews.Content: We were in the agricultural area of Illinois for a family reunion (at Starved Rock Resort) - and stopped in Chicago for a stay on both ends of the trip, and it also happend to be my birthday, I love the 'tude of these guys at the Monaco ( SFO, Seattle, Salt Lake have been previous visits) - you can ask for a goldfish in your room to keep you company - and it magically appears in a crystal clear bowl with aquarium stones that match the accent colors of the room! (turq) Notified along the way of an opportunity for an upgrade at min $, we had a fantastic corner suite, art deco/classy design, a little tongue in cheek, and wonderful black & white bold hounds tooth fabric covered window benches to sit/sip coffee and watch the Chicago street activity along the river. Very well located, friendly staff, (*even a water bowl in the lobby for visiting canines) and sized right for an intimate stay. The bar/restaurant was accommodating with our late afternoon arrival, serving up deeeelicious burgers - a perfect Chicago meal. So well located, no need for car/taxi - We walked Michigan Ave to the park, explored the architecture of the area, meet a dear friend for dinner and returned to a very welcoming room. Bathroom luxurious and decor fun and colorful. Definately our place of choice for a next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: netolin7
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautifully appointed and comfortable rooms. Very friendly and helpful employees. Evening wine reception and added plis.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: robcandia
Reviews.Content: Great location! Great staff! Clean room. Comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: nyeslonye
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location, large rooms, classy yet comfortable and unassuming.....I have stayed in many nice hotels in Chicago ( The Omni, Marriott, The Conrad) and this is everything you look for in a hotel. The personalized service of the smaller boutique hotels is just something the large chains cannot match. The late afternoon/early evening wine receptions give you an opportunity to meet new people...LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming alternative in the Loop”
Reviews.Author: jd294
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers great Kimpton perks like the wine hour, complimentary coffee, paper delivery and free wifi (for In Touch members). The rooms are big with great views of the river. And the staff was friendly and helpful. I saw some roughness around the edges (cracked tiles around the shower), but in general this is great option for downtown.

Reviews.Title: “I miss it already!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer672
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great stay here last weekend. We stayed in a Riverview King room on the 12th Floor. Magnificent views, comfy room (just a teeny bit small for two) and the hotel staff was great. We made use of the consierge services a number of times and his recommendations were spot-on. The maid service was also fantastic. I've never been to a hotel that does turn-down service without being asked. It was a special treat. And I can't imagine a better location. We walked to everything we wanted to see, except Wrigley Field (took the subway, which was a few blocks away). My one complaint was the slowness of the Internet speed. It was glacial. But as a Kimpton member, at least I didn't have to pay for it. One other very minor complaint (which I'm only posting because I think the hotel reads this, according to their FB updates), is that there are no good places to hang a towel to dry when you're done using it. I'm glad that they are environmentally conscious in many ways and encourage guests to re-use towels, which we do at home, but with two of us, I had to put mine over the shower curtain rod and my husband put his on top of the door. There is one small hook on the back of the door, but is an odd design and the towel falls right off. The restaurant attached to the hotel is also very nice. We enjoyed two meals there and the service was excellent. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Value, Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: hilaryNC
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend joining the Kimpton Club before you arrive. It gives you free interenet and a $10 credit for the mini bar! The staff was fantastic - very helpful in recommending local restaurants and being great hosts to their guests. Really, one of the waitresses in the restaurant recognized by friend and I and asked if we had a good night's sleep! The rooms weren't huge, but they were nicely decorated and CLEAN. I would highly recommend this to my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and appreciated the small things”
Reviews.Author: ILBadgerFan
Reviews.Content: This was a combined business and leisure trip with my wife and 10 month old daughter. We loved the location: walking distance to Grant Park, River Walk, and Millenium Park. Walking distance to the south side of the Magnificent and about a ~$7-8 cab ride (pre-tip) to the very north part of the Magnificent Mile. We were in the River View King Deluxe Room and as some have already described the room is a tad smaller than some other rooms at other hotels but not in a clausterphobic way. My daughter absolutely loved the window nook that overlooked the River and the bustle of the intersection below. Some of the small things I mentioned which makes you feel like more than just a renter, I put a * if you have to join the Loyalty program (Kimpton In Touch): free internet access*, wine hour, Starbucks coffee in the morning, $10 worth of food/drink from the room minibar* (other things like dog treats in the lobby, I have never gotten a taste for them, but I imagine if I brought a pet it would be appreciated. My wife also "friended" them on Facebook and there were two cupcakes from Sugarbliss as a thank you waiting for us in the room (I will put a separate Sugarbliss review on here, but let's just say my wife would probably leave me for a Sugarbliss cupcake daily for the rest of her life, and I would sort of understand). Staff was also, very friendly. There are a lot of nice hotels in this area of Chicago but would highly recommend giving them a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property in Chicago Loop”
Reviews.Author: Dan S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Monaco for 3 days while in Chicago on business. The staff was very efficient and welcoming, particularly Jorge. The location is excellent with great access to the Loop, River North and Michigan Avenue. I was extremely pleased with The Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but a tad pricey.”
Reviews.Author: LadybootsLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We liked this place a lot, but my goodness is it over priced. $46 per night just to park our car!! That hurt. Also a $10 per day internet charge. I get really offended having to pay for wifi in nice hotels, I mean seriously Motel 6 offers it for free!! We were travelling with our dog and this place is very pet friendly. Treats, a toy, doggie bags-a nice touch. Fantastic location just a stones throw from Millennium Park.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jbizoe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after reading such wonderful reviews about Hotel Monaco on tripadvisor. We decided to go to Chicago for a long weekend and summer get away. We were both very impressed after we checked in. The room was very clean and updated with modern furnishings. The best part of the hotel is the location. It is so close to everything downtown. The hotel is also pet friendly except I don't know where you would take your dog to go to the bathroom? The hotel also has a complimentary wine hour every evening but we were never there to take advantage of it. They also have free starbucks coffee in the morning which was a plus. Would definetly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Huge suite for great price”
Reviews.Author: LisaF4UA
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel before as Hotel Monoaco is one of our favorite hotel chains. This was the first time we've stayed in a two-room suite. The living area was large with plenty of seating and a desk. The desk being in the living area was great because my teenage son likes to stay up late on the computer. The sofa bed could use replacing, but isn't that always the case with sofa beds. The bedroom was huge and being a corner room with window seating you could sleep on, provided great views overlooking the river. Two flat screen TV's were also a plus. We always enjoy the afternoon wine in the lobby free of charge! Since it was extremely cold this time of year, the morning coffee and tea and afternoon hot chocolate hit the spot. Hotel Monaco is located in a great location for visiting the Theatre District, Art Museum, Macy's, the park, etc., but the only downside are the beggars that hang out on the corner outside the hotel. One night we were screamed and cursed at as we walked to dinner, and another time we were stopped by someone as we walked back from Mag Mile. During the day the area is crowded with shoppers and workers and there are no problems, but later in the evening it's more secluded. We've been in the summer when the days are longer and have had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “great introduction to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: EnglishinUS Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Location great for our short stay, close to sites, restaurants, shops, transport systems etc. Staff really welcoming, helpful and polite. Restaurant good value for bar snacks and breakfast. Room a bit noisy from air conditioning plant on roof!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NJDevils1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Friday to Monday for a weekend getaway. Our flight arrived early morning and they had a room ready for us to check into. The room was very clean and the maid service was exceptional. The hotel is located in area where you can easily walk to everything or access mass transit. The staff was helpful when we asked for suggestions and directions. I will definitely stay here again when we are in town.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: rosei_11
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! Convenient to absolutely everything, Staff very helpful and afternoon refreshments and evening wine tasting a real bonus. Won't stay anywhere else if back in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: conniemappleton-wi
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Hotel Monaco in Chicago! My husband, myself and our 2 children stayed for a long weekend. the location is just about perfect. The staff is very friendly and more than willing to help and answer questions. The rooms are beautiful, recently renovated but a bit small for the 4 of us (kids are 22 and 18) but perfect for my husband and myself when we visit our son at Columbia college this fall. I love the "cocktail hour". the entire hotel has a very "homey" and very warm feel. See you this fall Hotel Monaco!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding. Feel lucky to get such a fantastic room.”
Reviews.Author: markmywordz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business conference and unfortunately all the regular rooms were booked so I upgraded to one of the Mediterranean Suites and wow am I glad I did. My suite was on the top floor on the corner with the best view. It was absolutely the very best single room in the hotel (Room 1411.....ask for it if you can). It was a two room suite with a huge sitting room with a sofabed and good work desk. The bedroom has a great bed with the softest, most comfortable bed sheets I've ever seen at a hotel. Plus a chaise and decent sized chest. (The drawers for your clothes are a little on the smallish side). The bathroom features a small corner shower but a huge two person whirlpool tub. The amenities are four star and plentiful (Aveda....I'm not a huge Aveda fan but at least they were big enough for use. Most hotels these days give you a scant few drops of shampoo and a soap bar shaving that's so small you can't hold it.) The countertop was solid granite. The shower and sink had plenty of water pressure with ample hot water. The closet featured two funky bath robes you can use or even buy to take with you. One of the best features is the large window wells (my corner suite had SIX of them) that have a large cushioned bottom and two pillows. They're perfect for sitting up in and taking in the view, which is nothing short of wonderous. My suite overlooked the river from two views....it was outstanding. There are two large flat screen TVs, but the reception on the one in the bedroom was a bit fuzzy. The wireless internet worked well but cost $10 daily unless you joined their free affinity program which is easy to do....a no brainer there. Parking is expensive at $46 a day. Try not to park here if you don't have to, there are other lots nearby within two blocks but they aren't that much cheaper. The staff was absolutely outstanding. VERY friendly and helpful. There is a spa and fitness center and they have complimentary coffee in the morning and an hour long free wine and snack reception daily. The location simply cannot be beat. It is just one block off Michigan Avenue and right on the Chicago River. Perfect Central Loop location. I probably wouldn't pay $400 or so per night unless you had to, but if you can get this hotel at this location in the low $200's, you've got a great deal for a very fine property in a great location in one of the best cities for visiting in the whole world.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: KimVancouverBC
Reviews.Content: Superb location. Easy walk to everything. Employee service and attitude was fantastic. Great way to be introduced to Chicago if it's your first visit.

Reviews.Title: “Will be our "go to" hotel when we are in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: cadreaminCt
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about our recent stay at Hotel Monaco. Staff was outstanding, location can't be beat, and the room was wonderful. Great views of the river from the window seats! Room was very spacious and spotless. Super comfortable beds and quiet considering we were street side. We will be travelling quite often to Chicago in the next few years and hope to only stay at Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashelr2000
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend stay at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago. The location was perfect, and we were upgraded through an email deal when we arrived. Our room had a fantastic bay window...perfect for a little down time in the afternoon to rejuvenate for the evenings festivities. Would absolutely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,!”
Reviews.Author: AdventureDrMom
Reviews.Content: can use public transpo to get anywhere, close to Michigan Ave, Art Institute, night life, etc., etc. We biked along the river and lakefront. Boat cruises on the lake and river right across the river. Great Amenities. Comfy bed. Tons of great restaurants close by. You cannot lose here!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I Have Stayed At In Chicago”
Reviews.Author: maninomaha
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked into the Monaco, the level of service provided was equal to any 5 star hotel I have stayed in. Everyone on staff was personal, and went out of their way to help the guests. One morning I ordered breakfast in the room and something was left off the tray. It was brought up immediately. No wait. When I returned to hotel later that afternoon there was a large plate of fresh fruit left on the desk, with a note of apology. I was surprised and impressed as I had not been inconvenienced at all. Thank you to Isreal, who left it for me. The hotel had just been renovated and and the rooms were absolutely beautiful. From now on I will be a loyal guest of the Monaco. Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Canuck019
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights July 22-25 and had a great experience. We booked through their site as they had a pretty good deal going on. Upon arrival, we asked for one of the rooms with the window seats. She offered us two options for the room, and we chose one with a view of the river and two smaller window seats to avoid a room near the elevator. It was a very spacious room with turn down service and aveda products in the washroom. You could hear the L train faintly from our room but not enough to bother me as a light sleeper. There was the reception from 5-6 with wine which was nice but nothing to really brag about. I felt as though every request was accommodated without question and they held our bags until we had to check out. I would definitely stay here again in the future! Great great location to everything, including L train, millennium mile, restarants, coffee places...you name it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Would return.”
Reviews.Author: hereford
Reviews.Content: We booked online at another website. We could have gotten a slightly better rate if we had used the Kimpton Hotel's website with their promo rate section. So be sure to check. This is a wonderful small boutique hotel in an excellent downtown Chicago location. The property is very well cared for with all furnishings fixtures in perfect condition. Free internet for Kimpton members--so it is worth joining. Good location for walking north up the Magnificent Mile, close to many excellent restaurants, and around the corner from the theatre district. Excellent nearby public transportation. We especially appreciated the hotel staff. All were professional, helpful and attentive. The 5-6 p.m. wine hour was well managed and also offered a small tray of hors d'oeuvres. The atmosphere is subdued elegance with a small entry reception area, and beautiful well designed guest rooms in an art deco style. Considering how close it is to the trams, which is a plus if you like to use public transportation, we were not disturbed by the noise.You need to ask if you wish a coffee pot in the room. Hot beverages are available in the lobby in the morning. Cold beverages were available throughout the afternoon. Would definitely go back to the Hotel Monaco Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great to stay again”
Reviews.Author: RedCharleston
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here again for 3 nights. It is a great property, perfect location, and very good service. Previously we have stayed in the Mediterranean King Corner Suite with RIver View. LOVE THIS SUITE. When we booked this time, none of these were available so we got a King River View Room. View was great, room was great, but noise from hall was awful - early every morning we began hearing the doors slam in the hall - byt the 3rd morning we realized it was the maid'scloset which was just outside of our room - I will never stay in one of these rooms again b/c of that and will only choose this hotel if we can get the Med Corner Suite - difference is there is a living room off the hall and then the bedroom isolated from the hall noise. WOrse case is I will let the hotel know about this problem and definitely always request a room away from the maid's closet.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: waterbaby0928
Reviews.Content: I will tell you why- 1) the suite was perfect for a family of 4. Plenty of sleeping space with a sofa bed and 3 window seat beds. You could have 4 kids and stay in the suite with room for everyone. The suite has a jacuzzi tub that is like a small swimming pool. It also has a mini-fridge. 2) free coffee/tea in the morning, juice and chips in the afternoon, and wine from 5-6pm. 3) you can have a goldfish in your room- kids loved it 4) the staff is awesome, everyone is super nice and so helpful - i told them it was my son's 3rd bday and they had cupcakes waiting for us in the room when we checked in 5) great location- walking distance or a $5 cab ride away from everything in downtown. being right next to the river, you can also take a river taxi everywhere. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “For a 4 star hotel we expected more!”
Reviews.Author: momadot
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice but nothing really special. The view was great. If you stay here make sure to get the river view. The wine hour was wonderful. The service was wonderful. The concierge was very helpful. Check in and check out were both quick and easy. We did have a few complaints. The bedroom was too warm for us. We had a 2 room suite and the ac vents were in the living room half. The fridge was extremely small and they had it filled. Would have like to have had room to put our own bottles of water and soda in there. We had to request a coffeemaker, one is not automatically provided. I will say it was delivered in less that 5 min and they sent plenty of coffee. The ice machine was on the floor below ours. That was a pain to go up and down the elevator to fill our ice bucket. The people were wonderful and took great care of us. They took pictures of us, gave us directions to places, told us the bus numbers to take when needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: teacher314
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during the St. Patrick's Day weekend. Our room overlooked the street (no problems with noise) - in fact, the dyeing of the river was nearly visible from our window! The room was clean and had eclectic, fun decor. The staff was very polite (especially as it was a busy weekend). We had breakfast in the restaurant in the hotel, which was a great place to people-watch as they walked by the windows in their green outifts. The breakfast was quite good and reasonably priced. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dimmey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco quite a few years ago, after discovering it on a Travel Channel hotel review show. Since that time whenever we are in Chicago, we stay at the Monaco. Itâ€™s a great buy. Itâ€™s close to shopping, the art museum, Millennium Park and is in a great area. From the people who greet you at the front desk to the cleaning staff, we have never been in a hotel where so many people have a good report with their clients. The wine hour is a nice touch. Pets are welcome with food & water bowls and pet beds provided. They will even provide turn down treats for your pet. Donâ€™t have a pet; ask for a goldfish and one will be in your room. We have tried both the Mediterranean Suites and the River View Rooms. We love the River View where itâ€™s cozy to sit in the window and watch the city at night. The concierge will help you get to any spot and will advise you to local dining, nightlife or attractions. For a reasonable price you will feel pampered throughout your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ducks062
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Monaco. The extras were what made it unique to "standard" hotels. They offer Starbucks coffee in the morning and complimentary wine hour every evening from 5-6pm. If you join Kimpton "In Touch", WiFi and choice of a daily newspaper are extras that are included for no additional cost. Request a higher floor river view room for a terrific vantage point relaxing on the window seat. Keep in mind that pets are allowed at this hotel. We did see a few dogs and they were well behaved! Service was great too. Everything the concierge recommended to us from bike rentals, an architectural boat tour, and restaurant suggestions were perfect for us. We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- GREAT location!”
Reviews.Author: XCrun12345
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco offered a great experience! Check in was easy, the front desk attendant was VERY friendly (and perceptive- I mentioned it was my 30th birthday and she had a surprise bottle of champagne sent up to the room!), the rooms were clean, and the location in Chicago was perfect! The concierge, though a little unapproachable (not enough sincere eye contact or guest recognition), was VERY informative and offered perfect suggestions for our stay! The room service was lightning fast, and the staff members were always friendly and smiling. The bellman in front, hailing cabs, was always SO nice and helpful, despite being BUSY! If I had any complaints, it would be that the sink in the bathroom didn't drain very quickly and the fitness center was smaller than my closet at home! The room's AC claimed that it was 60 degrees, but it most certainly never dropped below 70...though we hardly watched TV, the channels are VERY limited and the menu when you turn the TV on is a pain. There was also one rainy morning that we wished we had a DVD player for...still, all of these are small things in the whole spectrum of things! Great hotel and I'd stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Rates, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Dreamtripper_8
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco in Chicago was a great find - we spent 3 nights there and just loved the complimentary wine tastings each evening, the spacious lounge area, and the friendly staff. The rooms are well equipped and the window seats were a real bonus - to curl up and read a book or just people watch. Although it was full the hotel was very quiet - no noise issues at all. Across the street from the Chicago River Walk, close to Millenium Park and some great shopping and architecturally attractive buildings. It's well worth the high ratings it receives.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location in Chicago Loop”
Reviews.Author: Clarkkp
Reviews.Content: Convenient location and good bang for the buck make this Kimpton Hotel a great choice for business or leisure stays in the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Huge fan of this facility -- a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: JDBuchanan
Reviews.Content: My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Monaco. The location is great. Service was impressive, with the little touches -- such as water, coffee, and tea -- that make all the difference. Combined with the impressive rate we were given during our stay, these qualities made the Hotel Monaco a tremendous value for a short stay. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in the city!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTraveleroften
Reviews.Content: Aside from the intimate wine hour, the newly renovated rooms, and the incredible views of the city, if they aren't taken...the staff at this hotel treats you like royalty! I love the location, right near the theatre district, and the Magnificent Mile is across the bridge, but everyone there is so helpful and friendly. You can have a pet goldfish delivered to keep you company when missing your pets at home, and they serve great coffee in the morning. There is also a great rest. and room service that is fabulous! If you wish to feel like someone special, and enjoy a clean, safe, stay, don't miss this opportunity! No I don't work there, and I don't like to share my secret, but they do deserve this great review, and it is the nicest stay I have had in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location/Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgraham7
Reviews.Content: Just got back from long weekend in Chicago at the Monaco. The location was fantastic with rooms overlooking the river. We had a suite which had plently of room and the service was great. Just a few blocks from the blue line getting to/from O'hare was very easy. Would stay here again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TexasTX_Travelers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night for a business meeting and was thoroughly impressed. I checked in very early in the day and was upgraded to a beautiful suite overlooking the river and the Trump tower. The staff was extremely friendly and all seemed very much like they enjoyed working there. The hotel had a wonderful turn-down service with a chocolate on the pillow and your bathrobe laid out for you. The robes are either zebra or leopard print. The bathroom in my suite had a large jetted tub and a separate (small) shower. The room was very clean and had neat window seats by every window. Everything was in excellent working condition and the room just felt comfortable. The only small complaint I had is that I ate lunch in the restaurant and they screwed up my order twice and offered nothing but a shallow apology. They have a wine reception every night in the lobby which was nice. The hotel is convenient to downtown and close to multiple train stations. Wonderful experience that I would strongly recommend when staying in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Chicago Vacation”
Reviews.Author: haliger
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Monaco was an absolute pleasure. The staff were always friendly, courteous and professional. The room was on the top floor and had a river view, which I highly recommend. Eventhough the hotel is located downtown there were no noticable city "noises". Bed comfort outstanding! I also appreciated the personal touch of "goldfish". Service to the room was impecable and I never encountered any problems. The location was perfect....very centralized in order to tour the city and it's attractions. The restuarant located adjacent to the hotel is fantastic. Enjoyed daily complimentary continental breakfast (waiter excellent). It's very difficult to say what I enjoyed most about Hotel Monaco as it provides everything you need to feel comfortable, safe and content during a vacation to a city I've never been to previously. If you like to watch tv, don't expect a lot of channels (maybe 25) But I wasn't there to watche tv so not an issue for me. I would highly recommend Hotel Monaco! Lastly, if you are flying to Chicago for a vacation and all of your activities will be within City limits and nearyby communities, get a metro pass for the train/bus. I purchased the 3 day one for $14,00 and it was well worth it. Very simple public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: KLMtraveler91
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco from July 14-18, 2011. We arrived at 11:00am and stopped by the hotel to leave our luggage. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and welcoming. They immediately checked us into a room 4 hours early! Since I had the secret password of the month we were offered a choice between some nice amenities. Our treat totaled almost $100 (just for saying the word at checkin)! We had a room with a king bed and a view of the river and Trump Tower. Our room was extremely clean as was the entire facility. Turndown service was great. The minifridge was well stocked. Since we are InTouch members we got to "raid the mini-bar" of a few items. We loved the location. It was centrally located to almost all the attractions we wanted to see. We were able to quickly catch public transportation to other attractions. We arrived via Midway airport and took the Orange Line. It got us within a block of the hotel - very easy walk, even with luggage. South Water Kitchen was fabulous. We enjoyed nightcaps at he bar on several evenings as well as breakfast in the restaurant section. The wait staff was friendly, helpful and very prompt. When we asked the front desk for directions to the business center, they offered to print our boarding passes for our return flight. Most hotel staff just point you in a direction - not the staff at Hotel Monaco. Unfortuately we were always out exploring the city during the evening wine hour. Sad we missed that opportunity. We would stay at the Hotel Monaco again. It was an awesome experience!

Reviews.Title: “As advertised.”
Reviews.Author: Drknite12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasure. The location is excellent for finding your way around to the sights. The cool drinks waiting for you at all times were wonderful , as were the alcoholic beverages available at night. The concierge was a great help in getting around, as well as restaurant reccomendations. Restaurant was also very good. Cleanliness, upkeep and amenities within the room were all top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. Great location, large comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: b walker
Reviews.Content: We were very surprised by the size layout and comfort of our room. King size bed was extremely comfortable room very clean although servicing didn't take place for us until mid afternoon Hotel location is very close to he golden mile and also within walking distance of downtown. Recommend becoming kimpton chain member for free wi fi and a discount on the mini bar. We arrived late at night and had room service which was just acceptable. The in-house restaurant is commendable and seemingly popular with non hotel patrons. Some of the tables are outdoors on the pavement inviting relaxed al fresco dining.There are also many other eating places nearby. Check in and out smooth and quick.Would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Forget those behemoth Chicago hotels....this place is a gem”
Reviews.Author: Parnezio
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a 5 day stay with my 3 young adult sons. We were lucky to get an online special from the hotel for the Mediterranean Suite overlooking the Chicago river. Two of my sons loved sleeping in the window seats that are actually twin beds. The room had some pretty funky decor, and was very spacious and immaculately clean. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge and bell boys. Location was ideal, midway between the loop district and magnificent mile, with great theater and shopping a stone's throw away. We enjoyed the afternoon free wine hour. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: msluv2travel23
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel good area just too far from where I needed to be... service was eh.... I guess it was because I didnt book directly with them (discount) I was given a room facing a beautiful brick wall.) Otherwise the room was clean and comfy .. the bed was too given the fact that I was never in the room the brick wall thing wouldve been more annoying than it was... I would go back if I could stay riverview if not I wouldnt bother I love great service and I was not getting it here. reception seemed a bit snooty..she never asked one question abou myt flight? ...first time to Chicago? The wine reception info ...nothing nada zilch...I hose to spend my $$ there and I can choose not to. There are too many hotels that are willing to give outstanding service so one will repeatedly come back. This just was not the case here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: RoLo822
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Hotel Monaco & loved it! Cool, funky deco vibe throughout the hotel. We enjoyed having the temporary pets in our room, the goldfish are a charming touch. We found the staff to be friendly, but not overly-so. Nice happy hour with wine and watermelon sangria, which hit the spot after a long, hot day of sight seeing. We didn't eat at South Water Kitchen, but we did have a great meal at nearby Shaw's Crab House and the best breakfast in town has to be at Yolk, where we went both mornings. We didn't find the beds to be especially comfortable, too soft for our taste, but we loved everything else about the place. So much to do in Chicago, we wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jamo_oink
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Monaco for four days, location is great just a block away from the river and Mich Ave (stores, parks etc..). Also close walk to pretty much everything. The rooms were very nicely decorated, it does not look like the typical hotel room. The window seat/bed was the highlight of the room. Also free yoga kits with yoga channel :). The bed was very comfy but pillows were a bit too high and firm for my taste. It was a wonderful experience overall and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Wondful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrsIncredible62
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a Kimpton Hotel and we fell in love with the Hotel Monaco. The front desk staff at check in were so helpful and fun and we were thrilled we were given an upgrade to a river view. Our daughter adored the window seat and could have spent our entire time in Chicago sitting in it. We loved having a gold fish in our room and I loved the animal print bathrobs. We were so suprised to find a gift of beautiful cupcakes from Sugar Bliss after returning to our room one afternoon. All of the staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. The location was wonderful and within walking distance to so many things. The evening wine recption was a nice touch and the sangria was really tasty. We had breakfast and lunch at South Water Kitchen and while the food was quite good, the service was outstanding. We can't wait to make another visit to the Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in fabulous location, but the service prevents 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Krivokrasov
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is in a perfect location, convenient to numerous sites, restaurants and public transportation. The room was comfortable, and the ones overlooking the river have great views. However, the one thing that was an unfortunate constant during our 4-night stay was the standoffish attitude of the front desk staff. Every time we approached them to ask a simple question, they acted like we were a bother and inconvenience, to the point where we simply stopped asking for advice. Certainly not what you would expect from a concierge staff at an upscale hotel, but fortunately it was the only blemish on an otherwise great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Love Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: Texas1980
Reviews.Content: I got home from our stay at Hotel Monaco yesterday. We enjoyed everything about the hotel! Beds are SIX diamond, room service was nice, the room was extremely clean, staff was friendly and the AC temperature was perfectly cool! The bartender Dan makes a killer bloody mary at the attached restaurant. I'm officially a fan of the Kimpton brand after having such a great experience at Hotel Monaco! If only they had a location in New Orleans or San Antonio! A few things to know before your stay..using the business room was a bit overpriced, so if you have to print anything off during your trip try to do it before you get there. Also, if you want your room cleaned when you leave for the day just flip around the sign on the door so it says Service. The maid service was outstanding so I recommend it! We left to see the sights around 12PM each day and they still came to our room each day, Another couple travelling with us did not get their room cleaned because they did not use the door sign, One of the friends I travelled with works for a very popular hotel chain and agrees that this place rocks! Room 410 has no cushion in the window seats but we were so impressed with the rest of the room, I'd still recommend it...the view and overall experience was worth MORE than what we paid. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: old_metalhed
Reviews.Content: We are presently staying at Hotel Monaco Chicago for 3 nights. After the 2nd night, I am writing this review (due to a monster thunderstorm rolling through the city right now!). The room is immaculate; the king bed and feather pillows are extremely comfortable, bathroom is very nice with great water pressure, and very clean as well. Staff are friendly and very accommodating. And the location overlooks the Chicago river and State Street bridge. We have a sit in window that offers a nice view. Hotel restaurant offers the best french toast. We'd stay here again anytime we travel to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for this surprise visit!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly73
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for my mom & a friend during a surprise stay for them in Chicago. Location was great & the service, comfort level, and friendliness of the staff could not have been better. Will definitely recommend this hotel to future visitors!

Reviews.Title: “A top notch hotel for families!”
Reviews.Author: STLgirl05
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter (2 years old), and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco early in July for 4 nights. We all absolutely loved it! A highlight for the family was the window seats...our daughter fell in LOVE with them and that was the only place she wanted to be while we were in our room. She loved to sit up there and "see what happens" (her words). We had also requested a goldfish in our room prior to our arrival, and we received not one, but TWO goldfish on our second day, which we named Harold and Dorothy. She loved having the fish to come home to each day! The rooms are modern, yet comfortable. We stayed in a Mediterranean Suite on the 3rd floor, and it was a great location. The soaking tub was probably one of the biggest, deepest tubs I have ever seen. The shower is very tiny, so be prepared for that. I am 5'3", and it was a little difficult to maneuver around in it. Our room was cleaned each day, and we also had turndown service on most evenings, which was nice. We did take advantage of the wine hour most nights. This was very enjoyable...great wine (also some sangria), and great conversation with some of the other guests staying at the hotel. They even had board games and Jeopardy! on the Wii for people to enjoy. Also, I would definitely recommend becoming a Facebook fan of the hotel. You just might get a little extra gift from the hotel (we received two cupcakes from Sugar Bliss, SO delicious!). The hotel is in a great location...very close to the river walk, as well as Millennium Park and Michigan Avenue, among other things. One tiny issue was the cost of parking. Everything we looked at on their website said that parking was $42 a night, but when we got there, it was $46 a night. It might be helpful to others if they update their website and promotional materials so everyone is informed. I know it's only a $4 difference per night, but it adds up after a few nights. I could go on and on about all of the positive attributes of this hotel, but all in all, it was spectactular. They have really thought of just about everything, and there are so many unique extras offered by them that you don't see often from other hotels, especially at such an affordable hotel as this one. The window seats alone are worth it! Don't hesitate to book this hotel, you will be very happy that you did! It is certainly at the top of our list for the next time we come to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Constantine-TA
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Monaco over the Canada Day weekend and truly enjoyed our stay. Chicago is a great city, and this hotel has 5* quality. Location is great: close to the subway, 5 minutes away from the Magnificent Mile, and 10 minutes away from the Grant Park. Our room was on the 2nd floor and I was concerned it would be noisy. However, it was very quiet and we both slept soundly. Our room was small but very comfortable and clean. I became a Facebook friend of this hotel and got a few nice freebies thrown in (e.g., continental breakfast and cocktails). Internet is free if you join Kimpton's loyalty program (it's free). Overall, great hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel Chain”
Reviews.Author: cooncat123
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Monaco upholds the standards of similar Kimpton hotels with helpful staff, quiet rooms, great amenities, and reasonable pricesl It's 4 blocks to the blue line to get back and forth to O Hare. It's near Wacker Drive, river walk and the downtown loop. I was there for a concert at the Chicago Theater -- beautiful in its own right. It has a restaurant in the hotel, and some highly regarded restaurants nearby. My only suggestion is to provide a softer thinner pillow on request.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely - would have liked more time to nap in that window seat”
Reviews.Author: jcbexleyoh
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, well-appointed, stylish - easy location to shops on N Wabash (Nordstrom, Bloomingdales), Clark St restaurants like Frontera Grill, and a block from Michigan Avenue. Staff attentive, helpful, kind. Parking guys flexible - car was easy to get and safe. Hotel Monaco enhanced our visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: roadgard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco for four nights (sightseeing/pleasure) in June. The location was perfect for us to walk to most of the places we wanted to see. The room was not particularly large, but very nicely furnished and impeccably clean. The staff was pleasant, helpful all the time we were there. They offer a free afternoon wine service in the lobby. Our room (12th floor) looked out across Wabash Avenue toward a larger office building. By looking way East we could see a little of the Chicago river, and by looking way West we could see a little of the El. Not so exciting views, but we came to see Chicago and we figured you can't get much more Chicago then Wabash Avenue and office buildings. The bed was wonderful. The room had a desk with office chair and a small sofa. All the usual accoutrements. The bathroom was perfectly functional and spotless, but there were no grab bars around the tub/shower and there was not room enough for two to brush their teeth at the same time (not that they would want to). i have entered a separate review for their restaurant, The Water Street Kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and the location.”
Reviews.Author: lini04
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is right off the Magnificent Mile and close to several attractions. One day we walked to Oak Street Beach. It was about a mile away. The Monaco was consistent with the Kimpton brand- very friendly service, very clean, beautifully modern decor, and the feel of a small boutique hotel. They are pet friendly and have a complimentary wine services from 5-6. My husband was a big fan of the Starbucks coffee in the mornings. I loved the window seats and the very comfy bed! Make sure to book through the hotel (the generally match other websites) in order to get their special deals like free parking. You can look on their website to see all the offers. It also pays to be a Kimpton InTouch member. You can get free wifi and other email offers.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: mrpond2u
Reviews.Content: Upgrade the room. Sit in the window and chill in an awesome hotel. Love this place. Not on Michigan Ave, but only a block away. Excellent rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Addy83
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for our anniversay weekend and to meet some friends for a baseball game. We wanted something centrally located, and this was right in the middle of everything and right accross the street from the boat dock where we had booked a tour as luck would have it. Our room didn't have the window seat, but did have a lovely "fainting couch" that I pretty much camped out on whenever we were in the room. I would just kick back in one of the robes they provided and putz around on my computer (they have free internet, you just have to sign up for it, which is no biggie). I was impressed with service, when we walked in, and told them our name, they said, oh yes, you made your reservations through such-and-such and for this many nights, etc. No searching in the computer for us like I have had at other hotels (esp. when I book through a 3rd party), so check-in was a breeze. They are very pet friendly, but I never heard any barking, so I'm not sure if they alternate floors or something. So, even though it was unusally rainy and cold for May, we have a lovely time and were able to walk anywhere we wanted (excpet Wrigley Field, but you have to take a cab from pretty much anywhere downtown to get there). It's an unassuming hotel from the outside, but inside it has really fun decor, a pleasant staff and great amenities. Oh, and the beds were SUPER comfy! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “We'd Come Back to Hotel Monaco in a Chicago Second!”
Reviews.Author: MarciaD
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend a long weekend in Chicago at the last minute. I was shopping location and price, expecting to end up in a low budget airport chain hotel. Well, let me tell you, Kimpton Hotels have outdone themselves with the Monaco. The rate was affordable (join their loyalty club for some extra benefits during your first stay!) and the location was perfect. Right on Wabash in the loop. We had a room overlooking the river with comfy cushioned window seats. The place was immaculate and very well kept up. The front desk staff, as well as other staff we met during our stay, was awesome. We were made to feel welcome and well taken care of. The staff was very helpful with recos for dinner spots and some sight-seeing. Long review short, great price, great location, lovely room, welcoming atmosphere, no complaints... except that eventually we had to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: TN_girl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting (we actually used the hotels facilities, which were very nice). Rooms were clean and trendy (reminded me of the W chain). Front desk was very nice, helpful. Cocktail hour each day was nice, although early (I think it's from 4-6). Didn't get to tour Chicago, because we were stuck in meetings, so I can't comment on location. But the beds were super comfy and linens were nice. My only complaint was noise. (If you are in a lower room, you'll hear street noise. Higher rooms, you'll hear the train noise. If you are in the middle, like I was (7th floor) - you get BOTH! Take earplugs if you are a light sleeper!!) But, I don't think you can avoid noise in a city!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: Dragases
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to take a weekend in Chicago in order to go to the symphony and have a few decent meals. From the moment we entered the Hotel Monaco--4 hours before check-in time--we knew we had come to the right place. Everyone from the doorman to the desk clerk (who gave us our room immediately) was helpful and friendly--though not to the point of familiarity. Our room was pleasant and comfortable, and we had two breakfasts and one lunch in the hotel, all of them much above average for hotel food. We have stayed at more expensive hotels in Chicago (and had one disastrous experience at a less expensive place), but for price, location, comfort, and courtesy, there is no better place in Chicago than the Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: MDTravelers60
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago for 4 nights for an extended Memorial Day weekend. I love the city of Chicago, and we wanted to do several walking tours of areas we were not familiar with. Staying at Hotel Monaco was a pleasure. Its location is perfect for walking to many destinations and for riding the EL to others. We had a riverview room on the 11th floor that was spacious, immaculately clean, and comfortable. We used the "door hanger - Service Please" card each morning early, and our room was always cleaned before we returned from breakfast. This type of good service is something that we haven't experienced in years, even in more expensive hotels. Everyone associated with the hotel was pleasantly cheerful and most helpful. And even though it rained on the day we arrived and the last full day we were there, we had a great time sitting in the window seat, watching the water and people, talking, and reading! The breakfasts at the South Water Kitchen were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Super Clean & Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler83
Reviews.Content: So clean! I am a real "neat freak", and actually take apart the bedding to check for cleanliness. This hotel was spotless. The staff is the best. I enjoyed the free morning coffee/tea and the wine hour. Concierge gave an excellent dinner suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: alliegato
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel but I could hear the train all night and slept horribly. Would not recommend for light sleepers.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ruby&Cody
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights for work. A great choice. Close to trains. Fun window box seat. Room larger than expected for the price. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here everytime”
Reviews.Author: badzeitgeist
Reviews.Content: We're big fans of Kimpton hotels, and have had many great experiences there, but this one was just over the top. It was a combined business/leisure trip, and we were upgraded to a two-room "Mediterranean" suite that was huge, functional, and just stunningly beautiful. Big window seats were great to relax and enjoy views of the river. The staff was incredibly helpful and pleasant, the location was both close to work, shopping, dining and tourist-y stuff. The Kimpton loyalty program (Kimpton In Touch) has nice perks, too. I get to Chicago a couple of times a year, and there is no doubt this will be my first choice hotel from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect....”
Reviews.Author: Windfeld-C
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Chicago and what more do you really want from a hotel than a great location, service minded staff and a good night's sleep? We experienced all three and we were more than pleased with our stay at the Monaco. We were upgraded to a riverview suite - thank you so much for that! Before my fiancee arrived I literally spent hours in the window looking at people, traffic, weather and whoever passing by on the street seven floors below the room. The hotel has a perfect location for exploring Chicago - the theater district being next door, the Magnificent Mile just down the street, Millennium Park just five minutes away and of course the Chicago River across the street. What a marvellous stay this was - once my fiancee arrived for our first trip together. Be sure to join Kimpton InTouch for free wifi and a $10 voucher to use for minibar items for first timers. Only bad thing was the $42 a night parking. I needed the car to make daytrips to the suburbs. Now I look forward to staying at the Kimpton Monaco in San Francisco and the Kimpton Solamar in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: carolina2323
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monaco over Labor Day weekend 2010. I had been to Chicago twice before and every time I would see the Monaco I would promise myself the next time I came back I would stay there. I finally got my chance and I couldn't have loved the hotel more. Everyone was so nice and informative, we asked where to find good pizza and we got a whole speech along with a marked map to find the best pizza and no wait. The wine in the evenings set the tone for a couple of great nights in the city. The room was so spacious and luxurious, i especially loved the soaking tub and meditation nook. I did not want to leave this beautiful hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Stay at the Awesome Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: shormk2
Reviews.Content: We could not have asked for more during our recent stay at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago. We received awesome service from a friendly staff. Every request from a fan for the room to starch for ironing my husband's shirt was fulfilled. We were very happy with the location, the free wine hour, and the room decor- absolutely loved the window seats overlooking the river! Will definitely stay there again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: realapprsr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Monaco at Wabash and Wacker along the Chicago River for a week-long conference from 5/15 to 5/20. We've stayed in this hotel before, and it always delivers top quality service and facilities. The hotel was within walking distance to my conference six blocks away, and the coffee reception in the morning and wine reception in the afternoon were welcome distractions. While parking fees in downtown hotels in any large city are quite high, we had a package rate which included parking. Our room with a view overlooking the new Trump Tower, while somewhat smaller than some other rooms in the hotel, was more than adequate for out purposes. The free wi-fi for Kimpton frequent stay members was most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of extras, comfortable, good value. Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AbsoluteAllice
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Kimpton Hotel Monaco in Chicago while travelling on a business trip. This hotel is excellent, its comfortable, has great decor and very friendly staff. Each morning they serve complimentary Starbucks Coffe/Tea in the lobby. I was thrilled to find that they had Stevia Packets as one of the sweetener options at the coffee/tea station. In the early evening they have free 'happy hour' where you can try various internation wines. The lobby is so comfortable and feels like a very well-to-do living room. The guest rooms are very comfortable and have unique decor. The picture on their website really shows what it looks like. Internet is FREE if you sign up for the Kimpton in touch Rewards program and it was really easy to do. This hotel chain was highly recommended to me by a friend and now I see why! I recommend staying here if you are in Chicago. It's in a great location and is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service - close to the L”
Reviews.Author: bwphd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a "deal" and were very pleasantly surprised. The staff was outstanding in terms of helpfulness with our questions about Chicago. Housekeeping and maintenance also gave prompt attention to needs such as delivering a hair dryer to the room and fixing a remote control on the wide screen TV. Free coffee in the lobby (which we brought into the on-site restaurant to finish and they didn't mind). Comfortable room, free internet (if you sign up for the free rewards program with Kimpton Hotels). The L is just 1.5 blocks away so we took it out to various sites.

Reviews.Title: “nothing short of excellent”
Reviews.Author: sunholiday2009
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel May 12-15 with friends. Location is excellent, close to millenium park and magnificent mile, easily accessed from airport by transit. We flew in to Midway Airport, a 30 minute ride on the Orange Line. Rooms were very spacious and impeccable. Staff and service were excellent. Concierge very friendly and helpful. Morning coffee is lovely and the evening wine reception is nice. Would highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again when I visit Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mikb1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here, if there was anything to be said, it would be in general and that Chicago doesnt really cater for tourists, unlike a lot of other countries, except for the internet you really had to search the city for information. Navy Pier was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco is a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: babettetenhaken
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Easter weekend and found the staff welcoming and attentive to our needs. Our family was coming in from three cities and there was no hitch to checking in and getting great accommodations. We try to stay at Kimpton venues whenever we travel. The chain does a great job of hiring staff, no matter what city you are traveling in. The restaurants are always first rate as well. We celebrated Easter brunch at Southwater Kitchen and had a delicious meal. We ended up also celebrating our anniversary (on Easter as well). The staff, from hostess, sous chef, to manager, to fantastic server, to busboy had fun making the evening memorable for us and interactive!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: tsogl
Reviews.Content: We had a reasonably nice stay at the Hotel Monaco but did not find it to be as phenomenal as some reviews might suggest. The room was nice, but not extraordinary. The room did not have adequate drawer space, particularly for a stay of more than a couple of days. The service was generally excellent. Although Kimpton InTouch members have free wireless Internet, in our case, the free Internet was more than offset by the ridiculously high cost of the Kimpton business center. We used the computers in the business center for a total of approximately 10 minutes and printed approximately 10-15 pages, which ended up costing us somewhere in the range of $23. This is a significant contrast to many other hotels where we have stayed in Chicago, where the front desk has printed out documents for us. Next time, we will stay elsewhere or go to FedEx Office.

Reviews.Title: “So far not so good”
Reviews.Author: fob25
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews, I decided to stay here for a couple of days on my way to a conference. Personally I'm a Marriott person but hey I was up for an adventure and decided to check out the Kimpton chain. When I arrived I asked if I could get a roon on a high floor which was a big mistake because the front desk manager told me that I would have to wait because rooms were not available when I checked in around 1 p.m. The manager told me that she would give me a call when the room is ready. I hung out at the bar for a couple of hours waiting for the call then I realized that I was probably forgotten after looking at my watch a little bit after 3 p.m. So, when I went to the front desk obviously the shift has changed because they had a different set of people working and I asked the front desk person if my room was ready. Of course, he has never heard of me before and asked me the same questions as if I was checking for the very first time. I asked him what happened the the woman before him and he said that I didn't get the call because the room wasn't ready. Oh, suddenly it was ready when I inquire? How about she forgot before she left. Honnesty is the best policy. Wonder if I would even get the call if I didn't go ask myself. Anyway, I signed up for the Kimpton loyalty program and will probably not participate just on principle. I'll stick with Marriott and Hyatt. To be fair the room is nice but not worth the 2 hour wait after a long flight for a high floor with a view of a brick building next door. The restaurant in the hotel has excellent service especially the bartendar. Just wish the actually hotel staff has the same level of attentiveness as their restaurant. I'm sure Chicago has other unique hotel options with excellent service to explore.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with a friendly atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: lah343
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco for our anniversary and I was completely impressed with our experience there. Every staff member we encountered was friendly and accommodating. But one staff member really went above and beyond for us. A few days prior to our trip I corresponded with concierge Ryan. I wanted to have a few things in our room upon arrival (flowers, wine, and some bath products) Ryan was so helpful and his friendly positive attitude was reassuring. The minute I got off the phone with him the day before our trip I knew everything would be taken care of and I could just relax. When we got to the hotel everything was perfect. The room was beautiful. Hotel Monaco has been remodeled since my first visit and they have done a wonderful job. I couldn't be more pleased. We spent three wonderful days there and I didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Still A Gem In the Heart of the Loop”
Reviews.Author: STYLEONTHEGO
Reviews.Content: I just spent 2 nights at this property with my partner and was delighted to find all the creature comforts of this hotel still intact two years after we had stayed there the first time. The rooms have been refreshed with quirky but functional and fun furniture. The window boxes are a delightful way to watch the day go by and comfortable enough to get some work done or just relax and watch TV. The staff are very pleasant and gracious. The hotel is well maintained, clean, and a great location for exploring Chicago. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Melissa712
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of Kimpton hotels, and Hotel Monaco did not disappoint. Beautiful rooms, wonderful customer service and a great location. I hope to be back on our next stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Cozy in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: KYTravelista
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during a girlâ€™s trip to Chicago. I found the hotel to be conveniently located with wonderful amenities. My friends and I partook in the complimentary wine hour held from 5-6 every day. The rooms were very clean and cozy and the bed was so comfortable I didn't want to get up in the morning. I loved the big windows and the animal print robes were fun too! I was told when I made the reservation that if I signed up for Kimpton in Touch (a free reward program for Kimpton hotels) prior to my arrival that internet would be free, which is exactly what I did and had no problems when I arrived. The staff was extremely helpful and went above and beyond to provide excellent service. The staff gave us recommendations for multiple restaurants. One evening it was pouring rain and we were trying to get a van cab for six people. As cabs were scarce during the 5-o-clock rush hour traffic during a rainstorm, the doorman ran up and down the street for 10 minutes in the pouring rain blowing his whistle trying to get us a cab! Bottom line: I had a wonderful experience here and plan to stay here again during future visits to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco: A must-stay”
Reviews.Author: kvanbu28
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a room for a special occasion, and this hotel surpassed every expectation. We stayed in a suite and it was absolutely gorgeous. The bed was comfortable, and the room was very spacious. The jacuzzi was also HUGE, while it may be for "two," it was about 4 feet deep. We also enjoyed the hosted wine hour. Although we did not have a goldfish in our room (which was something I had been looking forward to after all the reviews), I'm wondering if that's usually for guests who stay more than one night. Also, we arrived in Chicago around 8 in the morning, and were able to actually check-in (7 hours early!) when we went to drop off our bags. The staff couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. Overall, I really couldn't have asked for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful atmosphere, fantastic service, will stay again”
Reviews.Author: Breyeun
Reviews.Content: Great smaller boutique hotel, intimate atmosphere and unique Z Gallery decor, attentive service; unique small amenities that no one else is doing. Location great, right on the river, downtown, close to transportation. Front desk, front door excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: BookGal01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay in Kimpton Hotels whenever we can, because they offer excellent value, have fantastic staff, and are in great locations. The Hotel Monaco Chicago is located close to the river in the Chicago Loop, and they offer spacious rooms with a river view that cost just a bit more than their standard rooms. The river view rooms have deep window seats with cushions, and you can relax in the window and watch the river traffic and the scene around you. The staff couldn't have been better; they were cordial, professional, and caring. The hotel is within walking distance of many good restaurants, Millennium Park, and public transit stations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! Our kids loved it!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMom91
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 kids) came to Chicago with another couple for the Chicago Shamrock Shuffle. I have stayed at one other Kimpton Hotel, and I LOVE Kimpton! Hotel Monaco is ideally placed, and everyone was so nice and helpful. Our kids (5 and 7) loved the gift bags when we checked in, and having a goldfish in our room (whom we named "Princess") made their stay. The grown ups enjoyed the wine reception, and our son was so pleased to see the Wii in the lobby! It was a perfect balance for everyone! The hotel is clean and gorgeous! I love how the staff greets you with a "welcome back!" when you return. We will definitely be back in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: deltakilo34
Reviews.Content: After staying at another Kimpton hotel, we gave this one a try and were very impressed. Staff and accommodations were excellent. Hotel is very close to Chicago river, the L, Marshall Fields (hurts to call it Macy's) and the mile. Breakfast at the hotel was good. We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Property, Comfortable/Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: SeattletravellerUW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monaco Chicago for two nights this week for work. It was my first experience at a Kimpton Hotel and I absolutely loved it. The rooms were trendy but not overly-so; they were large and nicely decorated and I didn't want to get out of bed in the morning because it was so plush and comfy. The bathrooms were also large and the shower head was spa-like. I loved the free Aveda amenities and animal print robes. My coworker had a room on the train-side of the building the first night and asked to be moved the next night because it kept her up all night.
