My room was very quiet but it faced another building and had no view whatsoever, so that was the only drawback. There was complimentary coffee, tea and newspapers in the lobby each morning and a wine hour each evening. The staff that I encountered were all very friendly and the hotel was impeccably clean. The location is in a perfect location near shopping, the Chicago theater district and famous Chicago marquee, and Millenium park - all are walkable. I'd highly recommend it for business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Monaco.. Beautiful rooms,, and amazing, outstanding staff we could not ask for more.. The door guys esp Pete”
Reviews.Author: imheatherrenae
Reviews.Content: Loved Hotel Monaco.. Beautiful rooms,, and amazing, outstanding staff we could not ask for more.. The door guys esp Peter was so helpful, and he always offered suggestions since this was our first visit to Chicago. We had a fish in our room, and my daughter thought that was the coolest. She got to name the fish at the front "Dorothy"... The window seats, were the best. My daughter slept in them, she could not stay out of them... It was wonderful, since we came in the winter we do have plans to come back this summer. We will be sure to stay at Hotel Monaco. we just check out today, and I'm very sad to not be sleeping in the most comfortable beds they have to offer.. I thank the entire staff for everything. They really take their job seriously, and make sure the customer is happy

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location off Michigan Ave!”
Reviews.Author: perfectlyfrank
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed her for a weekend and were treated like royalty. This is a boutique hotel that caters to all its customers and offers expert advice on restaurants and sights. The room was large for this type of hotel. The BIG plus was having a huge window seat that overlooked the River where you can stretch out and people-watch with your morning coffee. The hotel restaurant was reasonably priced for a big city and the bar had nightly specials on drinks. The only negative was the cost of parking was $42/day. Could have found cheaper rates but was convenient to have in/out privileges there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, lovely facility and incredible service”
Reviews.Author: singlemom41
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying downtown, and this was a great location. Plenty to do within walking distance, including some outstanding restaurants. The rooms were very nice, just a touch on the small side (which ended up not mattering to me). The staff was superb; friendly, helpful and solicitous, very genuine. They made me feel like their most important guest at every interaction. It was the kind of experience I'd expect from a much more expensive hotel. I enthusiastically recommend the Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Aerobietraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Monaco while attending a trade show at McCormick Place. The hotel and all of its services were first rate. From the doorman bringing an umbrella out to the curb to rescue me in a downpoor when I arrived to the front desk giving advice about local restaurants (There are great ones nearby), the staff could not have been more helpful. The hotel is just two blocks from the Randolph Street train station where you can easily catch the train that stops right inside McCormick Place so the location is perfect for someone that wants to stay in a beautiful, enjoyable boutique hotel while attending an event at McCormick Place.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Kaytgilbert
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Kimpton for four days this past week and I can't say enough good things about the hotel. When I had made the reservation I mentioned that this was an annual trip with my granddaughter. When we arrived the room we found two wonderful cupcakes waiting for us, with a note welcoming us and wishing us fun on our annual trip. This set the tone for our stay and it continued on throughout. From the front desk to the waiters in the adjoining resturant. everything was perfect. I would be happy to return to the Kimpton if I have the opportunity to visit Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel. I'd stay the again and again.”
Reviews.Author: AmberVon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a newly remodeled suite on the 14th floor. The suite was really large which we weren't expecting. We loved the window seats and I often sat in the window while updating on my iPad. The jacuzzi tub was a really nice touch. Service was great - they did their jobs without us even knowing they were there. Very QUIET hotel. Although we occasionally heard the nearby above ground subway, we never heard another hotel guest or any hall noise. Location was the best - right in the middle of everything and great for St. Patrick's Day festivities. Only complaints are that the bed was too firm and that there are strangely no dresser drawers of any kind in the room. We had to keep our things in our suitcases and strewn over the couch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accommodation with a personal touch”
Reviews.Author: sbh2004
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms at the hotel for 4 nights for four adults and two kids. Both the rooms were on the higher floors with the famous window seats and great views. The two queen size rooms are pretty large. The rooms are very clean and beautifully designed. I spent a lot of time on the window seats and it is a beautiful feature. We also enjoyed the wine receptions. The staff is very friendly and hospitable. Great location for shopping and restaurants. The front desk recommended some really great places especially an Italian restaurant right around the corner. This will definitely be our hotel of choice every time we are in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “River views, great location, wonderful suite”
Reviews.Author: cinchud
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco on a quiet Sunday night. We were upgraded to a corner suite with views of the Chicago River to the north & west. The king-sized bed was very comfortable with a nice comforter. The staff couldn't do enough for us. Breakfast at the South Water Kitchen was delicious. The location was convenient to theaters, although we took a cab due to the cold weather.

Reviews.Title: “cute, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovecookie24
Reviews.Content: I had to stay an extra night in Chicago for a business trip and decided on Hotel Monaco from the cute whimsical photos of the rooms on TripAdvisor. My check in was smooth and efficient. I was given a room on a higher floor with a wonderful view of the Chicago River. The room was very spacious, with striped walls, plush red velvety curtains, and a giant mirror facing the bed. I loved the cushiony window seat. The bathroom was stocked with nice Aveda toiletries. The location of the hotel was wonderful. Right along the river for a nice stroll, and 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue, where there are tons of shops and restaurants. The hotel offers a Cocktail Hour in the evening as well as coffee in the mornings. A total added bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “If you love Brick Walls and Alleyways, then this view is for you.”
Reviews.Author: epe105
Reviews.Content: If you love Brick Walls and Alleyways, then this view is for you. I asked for a room facing the river, I get a room facing a Brick Wall. That really pissed me off. From all the great reviews, I was expecting better. Before I came here, I stayed in a Hyatt in NYC, and that was awesome. There was nothing about the hotel that blew me away. The wine hour was ok. I was hoping there would be something better food, but I guess that's why it's a wine hour. I ordered room service one night. There wasn't really anywhere to eat it, so I had to eat it on my bed to watch tv. This was my first time coming to Chicago, and I think it will be my last. Just thoroughly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Welcoming - Great Wine Hour”
Reviews.Author: ClovisChicago
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience for me. I admittedly chose this hotel not because of tripadvisor, however, but because of its LOCATION. It was located near a two-day exam I was taking. Ordinarily, I completely/totally rely on tripadvisor reviewers for selecting my hotels for travel. Briefly, I enjoyed greatly enjoyed my stay here. The staff was more than outstanding. Room service, which I ordinarily NEVER use, was prompt and the food good. Even more, I request additional soaps and shampoos, and they sent me more than what I had requested promptly. This hotel is located right near the river, and across the river in Chicago is where you will find many famous bars and restaurants that are worth viewing. South and east of the hotel are many famous museums worth seeing: Art Institute, Shedd Aquarium, and the Planetarium (see a show; it is worth it). WINE HOUR Well, this is a totally true story. After my exam, I was feeling depressed, dejected, and exhausted. ASIDE: I passed. When I return to the hotel, the hotel was providing a FREE WINE tasting. This was EXACTLY what I needed. I had MORE than my fair share. A friend of mine also stopped by -- I texted him to stop by to grab a glass of wine-- and he sure did. We enjoyed ourselves. We both need a glass of wine at exactly the right now. I was so spent after two days of exam taking. My friend was not a guest, but they did not ask. It spared me the whole, "Well, I am a friend, and he is my guest" thing. Thank you for that. Again, on the location, it is not far from many bars. I used a cab from the hotel to go further up north for a bar and it cost only 12 bucks. I was very surprised. Thus, as for location, you are literally at a just about perfect spot for seeing Chicago. Although I chose this hotel for its proximity to my exam, I would CERTAINLY stay here again for its (a) location, (b) service, (c) wine hour. Absolutely zero complaints. Nothing but happiness. Keep up the great work, Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Steve60097
Reviews.Content: If you need/want to stay in the River North / Loop area, I would recommend this hotel. I think the rates are somewhat less than comparable hotels nearby, and I just think the location, amenities, and service exceed the other sites. I've stayed here several times, and plan to make this my first choice for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Mid-Week Getaway”
Reviews.Author: mtngirljen
Reviews.Content: I love Kimpton hotels. They are always immaculate and offer incredible service. This is another one that doesn't disappoint. Awesome location, guest service, room with a window seat, view, and rate. It made for a perfect little getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and amenities at the Monaco = a perfect New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: MissFiona
Reviews.Content: When we arrived for our New Year's Eve stay, they couldn't find a record of our reservation for a king room with river view, which we'd made online directly with the hotel. The minute I showed them our paper copy, they said, "Don't worry. We'll take good care of you." And they did, giving us a corner suite with gorgeous city and river views and a jacuzzi. at the same price And there were four of their wonderful cushioned, deep window seats to lounge in, Then there was a very sociable complimentary wine hour in the lobby. Perfect timing! We took a jacuzzi dip, dressed up, and enjoyed our own champagne with some delicious room service offerings, including a wonderful cheese plate and sumptuous chocolate dessert with salty peanut gelato. We walked up Michigan Avenue just in time for the countdown at the NYE party at the Knickerbocker, which is a tradition with us. They really seem to have their priorities right at the Monaco. The staff is relaxed, friendly, and very efficient. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Marconap
Reviews.Content: I am writing from our riverview room, sitting by the window: this is a great place to stay, right in the center of the action, hotel personnel is friendly and helpful, wine hour in the afternoon a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, mixed experience - would not return.”
Reviews.Author: astabway
Reviews.Content: If this were advertised as a three star hotel, or even three 1/2 I would have no complaints, but a four star hotel this is not. I was in town for four days on a business/leisure trip. It was my partners first time in Chicago nd we brought our dog. We loved the fact that the hotel is pet friendly and even provided a special dog gift at check-in. We loved the much discussed window seats, they are spacious and comfortable and a great reading spot. The staff was competent but not very helpful. I called from the airport and asked for help getting a car service to the hotel - they woman at the desk told me that she needed an hour lead time and that I'd have to wait for a while; when I protested, she was less friendly and told me that I should have booked earlier. I hung up and called the concierge at the Chicago Intercontinental (I've never stayed at the one in Chicago, but have stayed at the one in LA), the concierge immediately booked a car delivering me from O'Hare to the Monaco without a question, and very courteously. The room was small but pleasant enough; the bathroom was small and the wallpaper and paint were peeling, also no hooks for towels or robes. One afternoon when we were stepping out, I asked the front desk to have our room cleabed (it was 5pm) he said "On a Sunday night? They all went home, there's no one to do that," so I asked for fresh towels and could the old towels be removed, he said "I'll see what I can do". When we returned at around 11pm, a stack of towels was sitting in the hallway on the floor by the door. Not really four star behavior. The food at the restaurant is atrocious, especially the breakfast. Bad coffee, fake syrup, spongy waffles and burnt bacon. Awful! The waitstaff is lovely however and very professional. While I wouldn't stay at the Monaco again, I might try another in the Kimpton chain, though likely not in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice!”
Reviews.Author: spencersbride
Reviews.Content: This hotel is rated 10 out of 163 for a reason. Spencer and I were in town only a short time to catch a concert at the Chicago Theater. Unfortunately, we didn't have time to enjoy everything the Hotel Monaco has to offer (wine hour, hot chocolate, time to relax in the window overlooking the river...), but that didn't stop us from being very impressed and wanting to come back. The service was excellent from the time we called en route for an earlier check-in to the time we left valet parking wishing us a safe trip home. The location is perfect with shopping, restaurants, the Chicago Theater, and Millennium Park just a few steps away. The room was clean, comfortable and quiet and the staff met every request without hesitation. We cannot wait to come back and spend more time in this great city and hotel!

Reviews.Title: “This is my hotel of choice for Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Interlochenkids
Reviews.Content: ....Gracious staff, spacious, well decorated rooms, extremely comfortable, roomy if not luxurious bathroom, beautiful bedding, good location for theater, Macy's, river area, nice wine happy hour each day. Period. LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: “Shopping and theater at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: leslie06
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Comfy, cozy, wine hour at 5, fresh coffee in the a.m., hot chocolate during the day. In between Michigan Avenue and State Street-shoppers, it can't get any better. Easy walk to theaters. A few small negatives--and I told them--the worst toilet paper ever, like sandpaper, and this is a luxury hotel. And they need to put a little more counter space in the bathroom and add a closet in the suite bedroom. Right now, there is just a closet in the living room. I understand they are undertaking renovations, hopefully these will be on list. The toilet paper can be remedied immediately! But a fun, warm, place to stay. And for a light sleeper, I have to say it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, fantastic staff, amazing window seats.”
Reviews.Author: DoraDementia
Reviews.Content: close to the CTA so easy to get around. Rooms are very nice and have everything u need, comfy beds and nice fluffy towels, minibar is a little expensive. Manager has a reception for an hour each evening with complimentary wine and ordouvres. Two great things about this hotel are the staff who are all super friendly and efficient and the window seats. If you can get a room at the front you get a huge window seat where you can look out over the city, it's fantastic for people watching. Thanks to Fereror Rocher and white chocolate on the desk for their service and getting us a fab room. Would definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, cleanliness, decoration, staff, all great.”
Reviews.Author: MasterBoneco
Reviews.Content: Ok, not the regular hotel for a convention, but the price was great. Better to stay there with your girlfriend/ wife. Excelent location, "kitsch" decor - but the good type, on purpose. Accessories on the closet were funy indeed. Kimpton is growing fast and with all the merits. IÂ´ve had dinner at big named hotels nearby and - what a difference: unpersonal staff and old, eighties ambience. A little bit of style doesnÂ´t hurt, and, if the price is right, you have a killer deal.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Trip”
Reviews.Author: vacaalotnyc
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago early October when we came out to see Billy Elliott. We have two children 8 and 10 so traveling is not always easy. We loved everything about this property. It is a small boutique hotel in a wonderful location. However the most outstanding feature of this property were its employees. From Gwen at the front desk, to Dan who delivered our food and Jack at the door - each and everyone one of them went out of thier way to make sure we had a great time. Dan even brought my kids cupcakes one day! The suite we stayed in was one of the nicest rooms I have ever seen - complete w/ window seats for viewing the activity on the street below. Two seconds after we got into our room Gwen had sent up little robes and goldfish for our room. The bathroom was big and beautiful and the tub was HUGE. The hotel hosts a wine hour and set up the Wii in the lobby while we enjoyed our wine and decided where to eat. The restaurant next door is really great so you never even have to leave. I am never staying anywhere else in Chicago - ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Views, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: NMTaosena
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! I'd never stayed at a Kimpton - boy, am I a believer now! Upgraded at just a small price for a river view room w. window seat, and it was just a stunning view. Wonderful location - easy walk to the Art Institute & Michigan Avenue shopping. The room was somewhat smallish, but it was fine for my husband & me. Really liked the decor, and the bed was comfortable. All the staff was so welcoming & friendly & nice - I'd especially like to thank the concierge Rich Gamez for his attentiveness. One tiny discordant note - the bottom sheet on the bed was a flat sheet, and barely big enough to be tucked in (maybe just an inch to tuck in). Every morning found my sweetie & me with the sheet completely untucked & half off the bed & a wrinkled mess - and we're not even restless sleepers! But other than that (and I hope the hotel will get either fitted sheets or larger sheets!) everything was A+. The bathroom was pretty basic but totally acceptable, but for the price, this hotel is the best bargain in town.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: MississippiRenita
Reviews.Content: I read and read and read some more trying to decide which hotel to stay in for my birthday celebration. Hotel Monaco seemed to have the best reviews for our budget. I must say they surpassed my expectations. We loved the staff! Some hotels have friendly folks but it seems fake. These people seem genuinely nice and appear to love their jobs. Everyone from the bellman to the front desk to the housekeeping staff. We had the lake view room with the window seat. Others have already gone on about this, and I agree! Pay extra and get this view. We had Trump Tower and Wrigley building in our view along with the Chicago river. I LOVED the bath robes, and the bath balls ($7). I am a Gold Marriott awards member, and there has never been a Marriott that made me feel as welcome as the Hotel Monaco. Unfortunately, I do not have many Kimptons in my geographical area. With all the hotels in Chicago, it is hard to stand out. Some how - some way the Hotel Monaco does just that! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Thoughtful staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: wunderwoof
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend for my first trip to Chicago. Location is excellent, a half block south of the river and a block north of the Loop. Wonderful Gwen at the front desk gave us a room on the top floor (only 14 floors) with a window seat that, from an angle at least, has a river view. The first evening, a little goodie bag was left in the room in honor of my first visit to the city. Small gesture, but it scored big points. Smallish king room (some are larger), with desk and chair, and a comfy, but worn, upholstered chair and ottoman. Bed linens are new and the mattress comfortable. Decent lighting for reading. Would have liked a heater or heat lamp in the basic hotel bath, but it does have a magnifying mirror and Aveda products. Bathrobes provided. Minibar fridge isn't locked, and there was room to store our own soda in it. Some noise carries from hallway, but we were near elevator--the price we paid for a free upgrade. Worst noise came from "El" trains turning the corner a block away, but it was tolerable. Rooms facing the back probably don't get that noise, but those rooms don't have much of a view. In the pretty lobby, comp coffee and tea in a.m., and comp wine hour every evening. Free newspaper and wi-fi in room with Kimpton "in touch" membership. Everyone we encountered on the staff, from doormen to housekeepers, were all efficient and pleasant. The decent price we got on the room didn't include breakfast. We paid a lot of money for it one morning (yummy French toast, mediocre smoothie). The other days we got juice, yogurt and muffins from the 7-Eleven across the street or the Corner Bakery a block away. Didn't get to the restaurant for dinner, but did have a late dinner in the attached bar. Nice decor. Great pulled pork sandwich. We took the unfinished bottle of wine to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience for a country boy going to town”
Reviews.Author: Tucker124
Reviews.Content: Being from a small town in Tennessee, I was very unsure of what to expect from the large city hotel. I was very surprised by the down home feel my wife and I received from the staff at the hotel from check-in to check-out. We were met by the doorman who graciously took care of our car and helped us check into our room. The young man at the desk did a great job of advising us on which tours to take and a great Italian restaurant in the West Loop neighborhood. Since we don't travel to large cities often we really appreciated the friendly atmosphere of the staff.........they always made us feel welcome and answered our questions easily and friendly. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a pleasant experience free from the hustle and bustle of big city life, well located and within walking distance of everything. Thanks to all for a wonderful weekend.................we plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, clean worth staying here & I LIVE IN CHICAGO”
Reviews.Author: ktee036
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night with friends because we had a free night stay. Had been to the hotel before for dinner and lunch in the restaurant downstairs. I LIVE IN CHICAGO, so really do not stay in the hotels there much. But this hotel was different, Fun, Something New & really fresh different idea for a hotel. We were just there for one night the service was really great, clean & large rooms. The window bench/ seats are so nice to just sit on and read a book. Almost fell asleep sitting there and reading. Next time I have family come in to chicago I would recommend them to stay there....IF THEY WANT TO STAY IN THE BUSINESS DISTRICT. I wish it was just a bit more NORTH closer to the Shopping, dining and Night Life. For the same price you can get a room at the JAMES and be in the heart of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Still Our Favorite Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: DaylilyFan
Reviews.Content: There are a few glitches--the mattress depressions, ,the stains on the ottoman, the tear in the chair slipcover, front desk messages not always relayed to housekeeping staff, and the employees are never the same from visit to visit--but the housekeeping is excellent, our room (1418) is spacious and has a large closet, my husband thinks I look cute in the tiger-print robe, the TV is great, there's an iPod dock and plenty of hot water. For us the location is perfect, we walk everywhere: Lyric Opera, Michigan Avenue, the Art Insitute and Field Museum.... If you stand on the Wrigley Building Plaza looking south, the sunlight on the buildings across the river produces a gorgeous view. There's a small fitness center, but you should really walk along the lake if the weather cooperates (see the hotel's jogging path map for ideas). I admit the parking charge is high, but other hotels are worse. I walked past Hotel Sax, and the rate was $52/day! For breakfast, a Corner Bakery is nearby and inexpensive, but the adjacent South Water restaurant serves a first-class breakfast that is worth the extra money to us.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could live here”
Reviews.Author: JanGirl
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as I sit in one of our four window seats since I decided I can not wait to shout my love for this place. We decided to book this hotel for our anniversary for many reasons but mostly because they are pet friendly. We also have stayed at other Kimpton properties and have never been disappointed. We booked a river view Mediterranean suite. Wow. I simply can't put down in words the amazingness (even a word?) of this room. Amazing view! I would pay extra to get the river view. The room has four awesome window seats. Just to let you know, I rarely use the word awesome but in this case, it is definetely the proper word. The jacuzzi whirlpool is just what the doctor ordered. I brought my own bath bombs to use but the hotel has some to purchase at $7/piece. The bedding is simply divine. I seriously could spend the entire day sitting in bed or one of the window seats. The best part of this hotel are the employees. They make you feel at home the minute that you arrive. Each one has the amazing ability to make you feel totally welcome. We have stayed at other hotels that make you feel like a burden...totally not the case at Hotel Monaco. When we arrived, they delivered champagne to the room for our anniversary. Wow! It is the little things that this hotel has to offer that makes it the best place that we have stayed at...this was our first stay here at Hotel Monaco but it definitely will not be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Great again”
Reviews.Author: ScartchGolfer
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time we have stayed at this hotel and it has always lived upto our expectations. Great location and excellent staff,we will stay here everytime we are in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was perfect”
Reviews.Author: kwin080
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It was a boutique hotel so small enough to be intimate but not too small as to not have the features I wanted. I had a river view with a window seat to look over the river and the city. The front desk was very friendly and helpful and always willing to give advise or help in any way. There was a wine hour from 5 to 6pm which was very nice and hot cookies in the afternoon (I missed these as I was in my conference). The rooms were spacious enough and very clean. The hotel was located a few blocks off of Michigan avenue so I could easily walk to the areas I wanted to go. Overall an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Urban Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyMai
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at Hotel Monaco. I've stayed in this hotel chain before and am never disappointed. How can you go wrong with free Starbucks in the morning, wine hour every day, great concierge service, great customer service and a cute hotel that is close to everything? The housekeeper even made fun animals out of my towels every day and brought me bottled water. I'd definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BigOrange56
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Monaco September 24th-27th. Had a Queen-Queen Room on the 12th Floor and it was quiet and comfortable. The room was well laid out, large, clean and with a nice touch of luxury. Staff could not have been more helpful and attentive. Located at the river and across from Trupp Hotel always provided some beautiful scenery.The major shopping, located on the Magnificent Mile was fairly close, but required quite a few blocks of walking (bring your tennis shoes) or a $4.00 cab ride. The "L" (subway) at the Randolph/Wabash stop is just two blocks away and will give you access to most of the other lines covering most of the city. The hotel will have a major redo this December, but I have stayed in relatively new places that did not look as well kept as this property!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location - Don't bid on it though”
Reviews.Author: osbornauto
Reviews.Content: I ended up at this hotel by bidding $150 per night for a 4 star hotel in the loop area of Chicago on priceline.com. The average room in the area was $250, so I did pretty good. I enjoyed the location, right next to th "L" and plenty of restaraunts and theatre within walking distance. We ended up with room 401, all the way in the back of the hotel with no view except the roof over their eeting rooms. I guess that's what I get for bidding on a room. As hindsight, I wish I had just booked a room at the hotel with a view and paid whatever their rate was. It was a clean hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Parking was expensive, but probaly less than most downtown hotels. I would stay there again and pay full price, the only reason I marked the room down was because of the room I got, not their fault, mine for bidding! Recommendation - It would have been nice to have in-room coffee maker.

Reviews.Title: “Love love love!!”
Reviews.Author: SabrinaMogle
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend in Chicago for my sisters (30th) birthday and were delighted with our experience at the Hotel Monaco! I travel quite frequently. On business, I stay at Hiltons, but for personal travel - I like to stick to boutique hotels for the more unique experience! Not only was the decor unique and fun, the room was the perfect size and was super clean! AND it is in a fantastic location! With 4 girls to one room (2 double beds) we were surprised not to feel squished in! The staff was very friendly/helpful. They brought her (my sister) a complimentary bottle of champagne to help celebrate the weekend. Not only was it delivered to the room on ice with 4 glasses, they specifically asked for her, with a "Happy Birthday from Hotel Monaco" AND stayed to take a pic of all of us - Very impressed! Lastly, it was no problem, (strolling in at 6am Sunday morning) to get a later check out! We're already planning our next trip and I will certainly be recommending this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loving our room! we will be back”
Reviews.Author: BrownEyedGal513
Reviews.Content: I'm actually writing this review from my bed at Hotel Monaco. It is more than I expected. Very very very great place and for the price even better!! Everything was clean, staff very friendly, valet was also nice. I have a talkative 3 year old and the man outside was a sweetheart to him. I could go on and on, but I'm getting sleepy so I will just say this place is NICE! oh and you can sit in the windows too!!! we got a few good shots of the kids sitting down in the windows. Man I love this place already lol. We will be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect spot...”
Reviews.Author: tillwemeetagain
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at this hotel and felt it was an excellent place to stay. Perfect spot right by the river and a couple minute walk to the theaters, resturants, shopping, u name it was close by. They had wine every evening for an hour, free to their guests and we had that most nights and was even a good wine. The staff was EXCELLENT, a great big thank you to Rich our Concierge who we asked if he could possibly get us some Oprah tickets and he managed to get us some Stand-by tickets, was so impressed. The rooms were really nice the housekeeping noticed we ate some rice krispy squares (wrappers in our garbage) and she dropped those off as well as a yogart my husband had eaten with a little note telling us to enjoy. So would i recomend this hotel Yes yes yes...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cailin_og
Reviews.Content: We spent eight nights in Chicago so it was important to pick the right hotel and, after considerable research, we selected the Hotel Monaco. The highlights for us were; Perfect north loop location; Fantastic rooms (photos do not do the quirky colourful decor justice, spacious with high ceilings, spotless and fab view of the river); Reasonable cost (in comparison to other similar properties); Great extras (morning tea, wine hour etc.) and last but not least; 5 star service (from all of the staff we met but in particular the wonderful Gwen on the desk (thanks Gwen!)). I cannot understand some of the previous posters comments as we found the Hotel Monaco to be as close to perfect as you can get. The only small point we did pick up on was the unusually small bath but that is not something that bothered us. Overall the Hotel Monaco far surpassed our (quite high) expectations and we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, inviting, friendly hotel - but a tad tired and worn”
Reviews.Author: witheachother
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic five-day stay at the Hotel Monaco, although our mediterranean suite was in need of updating and in dire need of shelving in the bathroom and more drawers in the bedroom. The staff is friendly and for the most part, accommodating. For two days, I requested an upgrade to a suite with a view and was repeatedly told there were none available. Checking the hotel's website there were indeed suites with a view available. So it appears that the refusal for an upgrade had more to do with the great Travel Ticker nightly rate we received ($179) than availability. Nonetheless, we had a partial view of the river and enjoyed the room with the deep jacuzzi tub, as well as $10 worth of free goodies from the mini bar. We were very pleased with the services of our breakfast waiter during the weekdays. We whispered the secret Kimpton word for August (found on twitter) to the check-in clerk and received continental breakfast coupons for two for each morning, as well cocktail coupons for two for each evening of our stay. This, in addition to the free coffee in the mornings, the free lemonade and iced tea in the afternoons, and the white or red wine reception in the lobby every evening. I was somewhat disappointed we did not get the promised goldfish pet (was planning to nickname it Abe Froeman!), as the aquarium, unfortunately, was having problems. Oh well, perhaps the next visit. All in all, a super deal, a great location, friendly staff and many perks. Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nesbitevans
Reviews.Content: What a breath of fresh air in these days of boring corporate-style hotels to find the Monaco with its more eccentric and colourful style. I stayed here for 5 nights while attending a nearby conference. The staff were helpful even before I arrived when I informed them that I would be arriving in the middle of the night - no problem, they said. My room was wonderful and possibly one of the bigger rooms judging by the floor plan. Unfortunately I only had a standard room so no nice view (in fact I looked out onto another building) and no window seat. The view (or lack of) made my room a little dark but this was not really too much of a problem. I enjoyed the space and the decor. I loved the fact that the bathroom was big enough for a shower and a bath but I hated the way the cleaning lady kept leaving the curtain around the bath - spooked me out to keep coming in and finding it like that, imagining some monster was going to pounce on me from behind! The Aveda products were good but a little in short supply. Otherwise, the wifi was free, the bed was super comfortable, there was plenty of storage and my room was quiet. I liked the mini bar but why no tonic for the gin and why no tea and coffee making facilities? I know the hotel has complimentary coffee in the lobby each morning but I like a coffee later in the day. The highlight was the wine hour. Not only is this very sociable and a time to unwind but there are also some small sample plates of food which I must say were delicious. Otherwise, I did not eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food. This is truly a 4 star hotel (or probably more accurately a 4.5 star) as there are some services missing that one would expect in a 5 start hotel but to be honest, I didn't miss them and I would almost certainly come back when in Chicago. No more boring corporate hotels for me!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in the shadow of Trump Tower”
Reviews.Author: zuari
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here. I like the decor and the silly, faux-fur robes. We were happily surprised on our first visit, where I discovered the fantastic "meditation spaces," high window seats with lots of cushioning that allow for reading or just staring out the window at the Chicago River and lazily taking in the city. When you're ready to move, it's an easy walk to many wonderful restaurants, Michigan Avenue, Millenium Park and the Chicago Art Institute. One very nice feature: a wine happy hour every night, with choices of red, white, and in the summer, sangria. The hotel restaurant's also quite good, esp for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of everything!”
Reviews.Author: Karlosandmh11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco over Labour Day weekend and it was everything we were hoping it would be after reading other reviews. A couple of the nice touches of the hotel - Aveda toiletries, complimentary Starbucks coffee & tea every morning, fresh afternoon beverages, and a wine reception every night - a great way to start your evening out in the city! The staff were helpful and courteous and the maid even made animals out of fresh towels to welcome us home after a long day of sightseeing. The rooms are not necessarily modern but they are warm and welcoming and a touch majestic with window seats looking out over the river. One other note of importance, this hotel is close to everything!! We walked everywhere on our trip because the hotel was so centra and yet surprisingly quiet. lWe really enjoyed our stay and look forward to returning to Hotel Monaco on our next stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Worse For The Wear”
Reviews.Author: Travis-n-Tina
Reviews.Content: We were impressed by the Hotel Monaco's earlier reviews and chose to stay there for our get-away weekend. While the hotel is certainly comfortable, we were a little taken aback by the worn-out condition of the room and the hectic pace of the lobby area, in which the staff seemed frequently overwhelmed. First, the location is quite good. Located on the northeast corner of the Loop district, the Hotel Monaco is just two blocks from the Magnificent Mile and one block from any of the public transit trains. Also, the guest floor public area was quite charming and warm, with big, mahogany doors, bright carpet, and lime/cream striped wall paper. Once inside our room, though, we were a bit disappointed. The curtains would not close completely, allowing beams of sunshine to burst in at sunrise. The curtains were also tattered, with holes and tears plainly visible. The seating chair was threadbare and the carpet could use a good steam-vacuuming. On the plus side, our bath was quite ample, clean and well-maintained. The lobby seemed over-run with people when we came and went (perhaps they all heard we were coming and wanted to catch a glimpse? Ha!) While some of the crowds may be contributed to the evening social, hour, we also saw some fairly significant lines of guests waiting for desk service. The staff, particularly the doormen were quite charming, though we felt they were overwhelmed at times. That's not their fault, but we felt a little sorry for them. All-in-all, a good choice, but we'd likely explore another of Chicago's boutique options on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Kimpton Hotels - Simply Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ostatekitty
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Chicago earlier this month and stayed at the Hotel Monaco. It was just great. The window seat in our 11th floor room was an amazing touch. The ceilings in the rooms are very high, and they've set the window seat just a little higher than normal in the rooms, so that you really feel like you're looking down on the city. Our room had a view of the Chicago river and the trump tower and the window seat was a great place to read, write post cards, or make dinner reservations using Kimpton's free wi-fi. And of course, the evening wine reception as usual could not be beaten. Monaco is also a few steps away from Morton's Steakhouse, which I highly recommend. And there is a well-stocked 7-11 right across the street. The hotel is in a great area if you want to take any of the river tours - the Chicago River Architecture Tour leaves from a stop nearby (it's great - be sure to get tickets in advance to be sure you get the slot you want). There are also water taxi stops within walking distance that will take you to the Willis/Sears tower or the navy pier. Monaco is another great Kimpton hotel - if you go to Chicago, do yourself a favor and stay there! Oh, and sadly our beloved Chocolate Lab Kelso stayed home...but pets are always welcome at Kimpton hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Can't do much better than the Hotel Monaco !!!”
Reviews.Author: Tripticket
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the Hotel Monaco on business a few times about 7 years ago and nothing has changed. And that is a GOOD thing. The decor, style and ambience of the hotel have held up well and are top notch. We were upgraded to a great Riverview room and absolutely loved the window seats and the view from the room. Perhaps the best thing about the Monaco is the location. Right on the bottom edge of the Miracle Mile and at the top of Chicago's Loop district - with easy access to everything - you could not ask for a better locaiton to take in all the city has to offer. You can almost walk to everything depending on how ambitious you are. We walked (with kids aged 8 - 14) from the hotel to the Shedd Aquarium, the Miracle Mile, the Willis Tower (formerly Sears Tower), Navy Pier, etc... and while some of the walks were a bit long (1.5 miles) they went by quickly. Easy access to the "El" (elevated train) only one block down the street from the hotel is also a plus as is the immediate access (and view) of the river where you can take water taxi's and sightseeing trips along the river. As in all big cities parking is a bit much ($42 per day) which is in & out access (valet only attached to the hotel) but you can choose to park in a "self-park" nearby for approx $30 per day. On this trip, we chose to take the Amtrack train which was a good option coming into Union Station and a 5 minute cab ride ($7.50) to the hotel worked out well. On departure, (back to Union Station) we took a water taxi from Michigan Ave river bridge area (about 1 block from hotel - $2 per person) and the water taxi ride took about 10 minutes to the Madison Ave dock (about 2 blocks from Union Station). So the water taxi ride was well worth it to see the city form a different perspective. Back to the Monaco - the Hotel was 14 stories and we had a room on the 14th floor (1408 to be exact) which was a double queen bed room with PLENTY of space with two window seats to take in the view of the city. In fact, you could sleep on one of the window seats overlooking the river, views of Willis Tower, etc.. (which one of us did and I must say it was pretty cool). The service was excellent and attentive, we never had to worry about a thing. Being a boutique hotel, the Monaco is the perfect combination of medium size and great service. We definitely did not feel like we were "just another guest" as sometimes happens in larger hotels. No pool here but who needs one with so much to do in the area. They do have a decent workout room. Short walk to Millenium Park, Buckingham Fountain, Miracle Mile, Theatre District, etc... who could ask for more from a place to stay. And the AAA rate was more than reasonable if you can get it. All in all, one of the best vacations ever and in large part due to the comfortable hotel and location which we were lucky to get. Thanks Kimpton and thanks Hotel Monaco. Our new favorite. We will be back. Note: The Monaco also has sister properties (The Hotel Burnham and Hotel Allegro) in the same area - which I have stayed at while on business years back - and these are similarly well run...that being said, you just can't beat the location of the Monaco. In my opinion, the Burnham is very cool for it's architectural history and feel and the Allegro is somewhat of a "hip" style - but each of the hotels definitely deserves a four star rating. Note: While I hate to even mention this subject when speaking of the Monaco...I was quite concerned when looking for places to stay about the "B e d b u g issue". We all know it is an increasing problem in many hotels. I can safely say The Monaco has no such problems that we could tell. Totally clean. Trust me, I looked. No problems at all. In fact, teh room and beds were so clean and comfortable, I slept great.

Reviews.Title: “Little extras add up to a lot.”
Reviews.Author: SavannahGal
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel went out of their way on many occasions to make our stay enjoyable. For starters, our reservation was booked by someone else who mistakenly booked a king room for our family of four. Hotel Monaco was sold out for the weekend but said they would keep trying to find something for us. I explained that I was going to have my husband's office try to find another hotel with two beds while I took my boys for lunch. They understood and said we could store our bags there until we found another hotel since we had just flown in and had no place to store them. While we were having lunch, we received a call saying someone had checked in with a queen room but agreed to switch to our king room. After checking into our new double queen room, we found we were at the back of the hotel looking at a parking garage. Not the prettiest view but the room was nice and it was very quiet. The next morning my six year old mentioned our lovely view to the front desk. They said they would try and get him a better room. About four hours later we received another call saying they had a room for us with a view of the river and fantastic window seats. My kids loved it. They read their books in the window seats every night before bed. The hotel also provided little unexpected treats: they brought us a gold fish, a mini robe for my youngest son, free Starbucks coffee in the lobby in the mornings, iced coffee after breakfast hours, lemonade in the afternoon and a wonderfully festive wine reception in the evenings complete with "lowkey" Wii for the kids and young at heart. It was almost like visiting someone's home. Everyone we encountered was fantastic. My six year old also locked our safe and forgot his code. They fellow came up to unlock it and refused a tip. And then the day of our departure, housekeeping left a Reese's cup for our boys and wrote a nice note about how she had seen peanut butter on our tray at breakfast every morning so she thought they would like the treat. We travel to Chicago a couple times each year and hope to always stay at Hotel Monaco from now on. The little extras easily make stays nicer than the impersonal stays at the larger and more expensive hotels of past years. I might also add that the location is great if you like the theater district, State street and Michigan avenue shopping and Millennium Park. It is also about halfway between Lincoln Park and the Museum campus.

Reviews.Title: “lollapalooza!”
Reviews.Author: jamesm0m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel last weekend so our son could enjoy the annual music fest, lollapolooza and my husband and I could enjoy the city. The hotel is pretty, clean, fun, and enjoys a great location. Certain rooms have large window seats that seem like perches over the city, and we were lucky enough to get one of these. My only complaint is that we are Kimpton members, and I asked the man checking us in to key in our member number. But when I checked out and asked for confirmation that our number was indeed keyed in, I learned that it wasn't. That would have been OK, I guess, but I also learned that as Kimpton members, we could have enjoyed $10 worth of minibar treats on the house. That sure would have been nice to know when I was eyeing those pricey M&Ms around midnight!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissPT
Reviews.Content: I had a week at The Monaco with my partner; overall good stay. First of all the location is excellent- in the Loop for trains (train from O'Hare to Clark/Lake is $2.25, then 5 mins walk to hotel), Millenium Park is nearby, Cultural Centre 5 mins walk, Museum campus 30 mins walk, Art Institute 15 mins walk. Check out what is free- concerts in parks, days at museums etc. Near North and River North have better restaurants bars. Macys Walnut Room has good food, half price bottles of wine of Wednesdays. Pastoral on Clark, 2 mins from hotel, does gourmet sandwichs and salads- good option for picnic, if a bit pricey. 7/11 for basics across the road. Ladies, Fashion Nails on Clark has mani/pedi for $35, you don't need to book. The room we had was spacious with a kingsize bed with a large bathroom. The view was of a blank wall, but we weren't there to look at the view from hotel! Decor is a bit loud for my taste- patterned carpet, stripey wall paper and red upholstery. But there are photos on hotel website, so this shouldn't be a surprise when you book. Good bed linen but a very soft bed- if you prefer a harder mattress I'd suggesting contacting the hotel when you book. Located beside a busy street, but the noise was ok. But this is the middle of a city so expect to hear sirens. Aveda toiletries were plentiful, heaps of towels, plenty of space for our stuff. The bath was teeny, but at the next hotel we stayed at it was the same so I guess that is maybe standard in USA. Huge plus was the complimentary gold fish- he was very cute! I got the yoga bag, brought up very quickly, but the yoga chanel didn't work the whole time we were there. No big deal though. Good freebies- wine in the evening and Starbucks coffee/tea in the morning. Breakfast in the South Water Kitchen was very variable. Toast, fruit, juice and coffee were complimentary, but anything else to be paid for. First day, thick toast and nicely presented fruit and juice and coffee arrived quickly- perfect. On another occasion, the juice didn't arrived and we had to ask again for milk. Fruit plates and toast were very variable- some days it looked thrown together, like they had run out stuff. One day were told by reception that breakfast ran till 11am but the restaurant maintained it was 10.30, and when we visited reception both staff were more interested in something else. On check-out, with member of staff who had ignored us, we weren't asked if we enjoyed our stay. I got the impression he just wanted to be rid of us. However I would say this was isolated, all the other staff we had contact with were helpful and friendly. On the whole, good stay. Great location, spacious rooms, friendly staff, thoughtful freebies. Hotel had a good atmosphere. Breakfast the only letdown.

Reviews.Title: “Did we miss something?”
Reviews.Author: Superb
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we booked this hotel expecting to get something really special. We had a room with a view of a blank wall - not what I was expecting. No sign of chocolates or anything "extra" in the room. It was comfortable and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Although we enjoyed the wine hour the "snacks" were taken by the first people there and not replaced. The "Living Room" looks good but was short of comfortable seats for sitting reading the papers. Sunday Brunch in the Southwater Kitchen was excellent and dinner was good but breakfast the following morning was quite disappointing. The location is ideal for exploring the area and if we return to Chicago we may well stay there again. However, we wouldn't be expecting anything out of the ordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: cftjw
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week as a base for visiting Chicago down town area and it was just perfect. A great land mark across the street was the new Trump Tower, it can be seen for miles! Our room was OK, but as we only slept in it - it was fine. We were there for a family wedding at the end of the week, so had a wonderful time visiting a great city. The architecture in Chicago is fantastic, be a real tourist and go on the open top buses, leaving not far from the hotel. The river is just across the street from the hotel and you can walk right up to Navy Pier (if you like real commercialism) or to the Lake itself. Take a sunset cruise on the lake, also from just across the street and over the bridge to catch the Wendella. The staff were good at recommending restaurants. The 5- 6pm wine hour was good to come back to after a day's sight seeing. But the advertised sweets and pastries never appeared. Breakfast (not included) can be taken in the attached restaurant, this was usually quick and filling. Do try the bar at the top of the Wit Hotel for great food and a fantastic atmosphere! All in all a perfect location for downtown sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel just off the loop”
Reviews.Author: alexandrao22
Reviews.Content: Just loved this hotel. Very central to the river and the parks. I was really happy with the space as you never know what you will get. We got room 805 a suite and it really made a difference to the whole trip I think. Overlooked the street and a view of the canals [river] much better than a brick wall and the suite was huge. We took the L in from Midway and was 1 block away from hotel. This was our first time to Chicago and we loved it. The only thing was that the sofa bed was impossible to sleep on. Also very close to good shopping on State St. and Mag mile. Got the city pass and took the bus to all the spots.This hotel has a good restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: kellyhawk
Reviews.Content: Our family's first visit to Chicago was fantastic and our choice to stay at Hotel Monaco made it that much better. This gem of a hotel has a perfect location for getting to the best of Chicago. As for the basics, the rooms are spacious, uniquely decorated and clean with high ceilings, and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel has a tremendous view of the Chicago River and is very close to the Magnificent Mile. Our kids loved the window seats that give you a close up view of the city and the river. It is also within walking distance of many of the city's best attractions including Millennium Park, Grant Park, and the Art Institute of Chicago. If you don't want to walk, the hotel is close to CTA bus stops, subway and elevated trains to get you to Shedd Aquarium, Adler Planetarium, Field Museum, John Hancock, or Sears Tower. We took a CTA bus to Navy Pier to watch the fireworks on the Fourth of July. With all the people on the pier, we were concerned about getting back to the hotel safely. We were able to take the Shoreline water taxi from the pier to Michigan Avenue and walk a short distance to the hotel. This allowed us to completely avoid all the traffic and congestion in the aftermath. The staff at the hotel is extremely helpful and accommodating. They went out of their way to make sure that our family was enjoying our stay and that we had everything we needed. While the entire staff was exemplary, I was especially impressed with Peter and Amy. Peter was very friendly and answered every question that we had about making the most of our first visit to Chicago. When I called down to the front desk, Amy made sure that we received anything that we asked for. We exhausted ourselves for three days trying to see it and do it all. The hotel was an oasis to return to from the day's activities. The staff was very service-oriented, providing the little extra touches that made the stay memorable from chocolates on the pillows and a full ice bucket to the animal print robes. Each day we were there, they served lemonade and iced tea in the lobby at 2 p.m. We also enjoyed wine tasting from 5 p.m. to 6 p.m. daily, while the kids were able to play Wii. On our last day there, we were given late check out and our luggage was stored until it was time for us to head to Union Station to catch our train. The bellman made sure that we had a minivan taxi to accommodate our family. From beginning to end, the hotel's attention to detail and service made our visit more than we expected. We would not think of staying somewhere else if we are able to return to Chicago in the future. Chicago is an amazing city and this hotel is an amazing value. Thanks, again, Peter, Amy, and the entire staff!

Reviews.Title: “I would live here if I could!!”
Reviews.Author: pradamary
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Hotel Monaco and a great Chicago trip!! I researched this site and finally decided on the Monaco because it seemed funky...animal print robes, goldfish in your room, pet friendly, gay friendly...It just seemed like it was my kind of place...The hotel far surpassed my expectations. The staff was phenomenal...so helpful and friendly! The room was beautiful, clean, and what a view of the river!! I passed quite a bit of time in my "window seat" sipping wine, looking out on the city...while Mr Wigglesworth (our goldfish) watched on..The bed was soooooo comfortable, nice down pillows, great cotton sheets. Neighborhood was perfect. Walked from the river walk, across the street all along the river, to Lake Michigan, and back up through Millenium Park. The city was gleaming, and the weather was perfect. I enjoyed a glass of wine at wine reception, with a nice appetizer before dinner in the South Water Kitchen. Great burger and beer battered onion rings, my son had a Cuban Sandwich with sweet potato fries. The staff is so friendly, they will bend over backwards to make your stay pleasant. If I could, I would move in tomorrow...I will definitely NOT stay anywhere else when in Chicago!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price Paid”
Reviews.Author: happytrails2uall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Monaco and upgraded to a suite. I was disappointed with the room layout, and shabby furniture. I bumped into the coffee table and the top almost crashed to the ground. The make up mirror in the bathroom didnt work, the TV reception was very poor and overall the room just wasnt worth the $450 we spent there. Next time, we will go back to Trump Tower across the street, which is far superior to Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Kimpton Group Hotels”
Reviews.Author: SceneITNOW
Reviews.Content: Kimpton Group Hotels are always our first choice. Enjoyed the decor and service was great. Good location to theatre and resturants. Good for singles, couples and families. Wish parking was a little cheaper but that's Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As It Gets!”
Reviews.Author: WileyWanderer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel Monaco a few years ago and enjoyed ourselves so much, we decided to return. As impressed as we were with our first stay, this trip was even better! We enjoy Hotel Monacos primarily for the attentive service and individualized care. While the accommodations are consistenly first-rate, it is the staff who truly set these hotels apart. At the Hotel Monaco in Chicago, the staff are simply superlative. From Ryan (Concierge) to the reception staff to the housekeeping staff, we were made to feel like special guests. We were at the hotel to celebrate my son's birthday. Ryan made it clear that he was committed to make this stay special. From a gift basket waiting upon our arrival to gourmet cupcakes in our room, every detail was addressed. Despite reserving this room at a special Kimpton discount, our 11th floor room was facing the river and Michigan Avenue--just as we had hoped. As if we weren't delighted enough with the service, our housekeeper left us bottles of either lemonade or water each morning--noticing that our trash included empties of water and lemonade! In addition to the remarkable personal attention, the hotel was spotless, from our room to the elevator and the lobby. Despite our short stay (only 3 nights), we will not forget the treatment we received at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago. If you are looking for a boutique hotel with a warm personality, look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Arrived on short notice”
Reviews.Author: EAZELIFF
Reviews.Content: My plan yesterday was to travel by train Washington to Chicago and continue to Arizona. Three hours before departure, Amtrak called me that the train was cancelled. Not wanting to ride Greyhound overnight, I quickly booked a one way flight to Chicago, and figuring that Amtrak owes me a hefty refund, booked the Hotel Monaco, so these should balance out. I was delighted with the Hotel Monaco, this being the third Kimpton Hotel in which i have stayed. I appreciate their sleek, artsistic decor and nice little touches. The staff were most helpful and I was recommended Andy's Jazz Club a few blocks away, where I spent an enjoyable evening. Referring to some of the other reviewers comments, I was on the back of the building and looked into a bick wall. Not a problem - the room was gorgeous. Now I don't mean to be too picky, but for the price of the room I do note these two items: the curtains did not completely close and the bathtub was very ordinary looking. Considering the thoughtful decor and fixtures, I am surprised that they decided to leave a bathtub which looked like the house I grew up in. Small matters - even though my travel plans were changed, my time in Chicago has been very good.

Reviews.Title: “Another Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: max2lucy
Reviews.Content: My 3rd stay in the past year must make this a favorite for me in Chicago. Check-In staff was very happy to see me and welcome me back. I really like the location as well as the atmosphere of the place. Right between the loop and Michigan Avenue puts you pretty much in the center of things. The rooms are still in good shape and if you have breakfast at the restaurant by all means have the malted waffle....the best i have ever tasted..had to repeat it again the next day!

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: mrpalmbeach
Reviews.Content: The staff was extremely friendly and had personality which is great. However the main problem I had was that the drapes didnt close all the way and the bright yellow lights from outside came into the room all night. I tried to watch the Yoga channel which only went 4 minutes then rewinded itself from the beginng over and over. It seemed like everything had an additional charge I was suprised that the Toilet Paper didnt cost extra. I question the hotel security because as soon as we walked out the door of the hotel 4 bums where in out grill asking us from money and for us to buy them cig's. I dont like people touching my wife and the Hotel should have security making it a safe enviroment for its guests. The bed was comfortable the pillows where great but bathtub and shower looked very cheap like a motel 6 and everytime I walked in my room we where unable to park to unload because the taxi cabs prevented us from being able to unload our car.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms with view of brick wall next door”
Reviews.Author: freddy2300
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Monaco March 20-24, Room 1118. Most everything was up to Kimpton's usual high standards, but this room had a really awful view (with a window seat) of the brick wall of the adjacent building to the east. Avoid this room, though I suppose the upside is that you won't hear the screeching el train from this side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with some design glitches”
Reviews.Author: Momsdayout
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with just about all of the positive comments here. The staff is top-notch - friendly and helpful. The location is super - convenient to both Michigan Ave. and State St. shopping (but keep in mind that sales tax - a whopping 10.25%!), Millennium Park , and public transportation. Hotel is clean and well-maintained. We did, however, have some concerns about the room - it looked good, and the beds were fine. BUT - the only storage space other than the closet was a large nightstand with three drawers - neither adequate nor convenient for anything more than a very short stay. Their was not enough lighting (one small table lamp on the very small table/desk, on lamp on the nightstand, and a not-too-large overhead light in the entry hallway near the closet - no general lighting in the main area), and no light in the closet. There was no full-length mirror anywhere in the room. The picture on the TV was really sub-par, but that really wasn't much of an issue because there was nothing on - I have never seen such a limited selection of channels in an upscale hotel. Even taken together all of these issues were not much more than an annoyance, since we spent very little time in the room, but they were disappointing, and resulted in the lower rating for the room. One other issue - the hotel is 1/2 block from one of the corners of the "Loop" elevated rail station, and at night you can hear the squealing when the trains come around the curve. We were on the 8th floor facing Wabash, so this wasn't a bother, but we could tell it was there, and it might be an issue if one was on a lower floor. Join the Kimpton "rewards" program for free internet. Good signal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: Trini_HotFoot
Reviews.Content: Great location near to Magnificent Mile, Millenium Park, public transportation and lots of restaurants! The room was comfy and charming, and the staff was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: jakost1
Reviews.Content: Booked for $99 a night and stayed two nights with friends. Short cab ride from Union Station. Loved the wine hour from 5-6 and fresh coffee in the morning. Room was overlooking the street. Short walk to the river. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Really? Couldn't you have bolted the toilet to the floor?”
Reviews.Author: venice4504
Reviews.Content: We got a spanking deal at this hotel for $99 a night. It's in a good location to the Loop. Excellent transportation options abound. My gripe comes from the fact that we were obviously put in a "crappy" room. It overlooked the back of the building and the roof of a building next to us. The toilet in the room was not bolted to the floor. Other than that, if I needed to stay in the Loop again for something and I knew I wasn't going to be put in a undesirable room, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MIBobbi
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Hotel Monaco. I was a little apprehensive staying there this time because last time was perfect and figured there was no way they could live up to that again. Well, they it! We again had a wonderful room. My 5 year olds enjoyed the window seats for hours on end. We were greated by name and asked about our day every time we returned to the hotel. My children were welcomed at the wine reception with a cup of hot chocolate. The staff was eager to help us in any way possible. We are definately looking forward to staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Touches All Around the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elchie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night while in town on business. Rooms are huge and very well outfitted. The highlight for me was the window seat - saw it on the website and wasn't sure I'd use it, but ended up climbing in and working from the window for a couple of hours with an amazing view of the city. Bed was huge and comfortable. The room also had quirky amenities like a zebra print robe. Staff was incredibly helpful - they let me check in early and when I had an issue printing from the business center computer, the front desk let me use a hotel computer. Free wine in the lobby was also a great touch. One downside is that internet is free in the rooms, but to use the business center and printer it is about $6/15 minutes and 50 cents a page.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodation, can't beat the location”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuchToronto
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant front staff, wine in the evening in the lobby, large rooms, great rates, and free Internet for those that are members of the loyalty program. Overall an excellent value. Close to the El for those coming in from either Midway or O'Hare airports.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near to all attractions Chicago has to offer”
Reviews.Author: stillsomuch2see
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel and although I booked it after carefully reading tripadvisor and other reviews I did have a bit of 'what to expect' feeling since you only know how good the hotel really is after you have been there yourself. I can only confirm all what has been said about this hotel is true. The staff is very friendly and extremly helpfull. Nothing is too much. You want a cab, no problem, you want a restaurantbooking, sure. You need to know how to get somewhere... they will explain you without making you feel like a dumb tourist. When I arrived they couldn't find my booking although I had the printed confirmation with me. Immediatly they told me that if they couldn't find it that would not be an issue. In the end my booking was there and there was just a mix up with first name and family name so all was fine but to compensate me for the waiting (10 minutes max) they gave me a riverside room at a high floor. Just as an example that customerservice is not just a word in this hotel but they really put it into practice. The only thing I would advice future guests is to ask for a room at floor 8 or above. You are still in a big city and even during the night there are noises and sometimes when ambulances or police drove by with the sirenes on you could hear it really well and I was on the 8th floor) but that is just a minor detail that is easily fixed with some earplugs. The location is right in between the Loop and the macnificent mile. Walking distance to Millenium Park, Willis (Sears) tower, shopping at Michigan Ave, Hancock conservatory. Maybe some prefer to take taxi's but when you are not stressed for time I would recommend to walkt. I had a great offer of l100$per night (excl taxes) and compared to a lot of other hotels I checked that was really good deal. That the hotel turned out to be so good just made the value for money rate go up. The outside doesn't look so "grand" as some other hotels but it also doesn't look bad and by the way who cares if the outside facade will not win any esthetical prices it is what is inside that really matters. I certainly don't care about it. I can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “First time to Chicago, and LOVED this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JCutie2
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed at this hotel at the end of January for 4 nights, under $100 a night, and we loved it. We stayed in room 1010 and it had a view of the city building across the street and the river. The room was spacious, clean, and nicely decorated. The window seats were cute too, loved the view, but I did notice that depending on the room you have, the window size varies. The service at this hotel was incredible. Everyone said Hi as you walk in and out, they hold the door, ask if you need a taxi etc. We had drinks one night at the bar downstairs and the bartender was very friendly. We got into the elevator with one of the employees one night and he asked if we were having a good stay, and my fiance said we just got engaged (he proposed in millennium park the first day we were there) and he told us congratulations and said he wanted to do something for us and asked for our room number. Later that night when we came back to the room a bottle of champagne and a card from the hotel was waiting for us. It was so thoughtful of them. They didn't have to do that for us, but they did. The location of this hotel is the BEST. It is just a block or two away from the mile, and a couple of blocks away from millennium park. We both thought this was the PERFECT location to see everything in Chicago. We walked everywhere. We went out every night for dinner across the river and it was an easy walk and we felt safe. Everyone is out and about. The only issues I had was the pillows were not comfortable and also we were close to the elevators so we could sometimes hear people outside. But everything else about the hotel made up for it. This is by far one of my favorite places I have stayed at. Thank you so much for making a special event in my life even more special!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: Beckwasthere
Reviews.Content: If you have stayed at a Kimpton Hotel then you start to know what to expect. Having stayed at another Kimpton Hotel since then, I now realise how special this one was. The location is fantastic, walking outside the hotel you are confronted with amazing buildings, it is just off the Magnificent Mile and there are lots of great bars and restaurants and bars right near by. We booked a King Deluxe room. The room itself was a little smaller than I've experienced with regards to American hotels but by no means tiny and very nicely decorated, clean and comfortable with an enormous, super-comfortable bed. One thing I must add though, is that before I booked this hotel, I had read about these wonderful window seat/meditation stations in the rooms - unfortunately our room did not have this luxury. Having booked through an agent with a Kimpton Hotel before and again, been given the smallest room on the floor both times (evident from looking at the fire escape layout), I am of the impression that the hotel favours guests who book direct through them for the best rooms. The added bonus of robes, the complimentary daily wine hour (with nibbles), free internet access and morning complimentary Starbucks coffee all gave this hotel a great welcoming and homely feel. The maid even left us a soft drink on occassion which was a nice little touch. The adjoining bar was great and did a 'TV dinner' special at a set time each day which was great value. The funky music in the lifts also added a touch of fun to the hotel. The lobby was very plush and a great place to sit and relax with a glass of wine after a hard day's shopping. The fitness suite was also great, kitted out with personal TV's on the machines and all the usual necessities. Overall, although my first choice for Chicago would be the Omni, I would still definitely stay at this hotel again and would certainly recommend it to anyone due to its fantastic location, great staff and comfortable rooms, and of course, the daily free wine hour!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ceklarsen
Reviews.Content: Location, atmosphere, rooms, service, restaurant - all great!

Reviews.Title: “extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: daydayday
Reviews.Content: we've been staying at hotel monaco in early september 2009 for eight nights. the staff is fantastic: super friendly, funny and helpful and always greet you with a smile (this includes housekeeping as well). hotel's location is simply great, right next to chicago river, few steps away from mag mile and state street which gives you some extraordinary views from the rooms. we had a room on 9th floor overlooking marina city, chicago river, willis tower, trump tower and much more... the best (!) feature, as mentioned before, are the huge sills you can sit and lay on. perfect to chill and relax. our room was nicely renovated (we loved the wallpaper and the mirror) and the mini bars feature several items for every traveler's situation. we didn't feel anonymous at all (especially compared to big chain hotels) because you always had the feeling of being pampered with genuine friendliness. go somewhere else if you're looking for sniffy stuck-up personnel, extremely luxurious marble-stuff and a big choice of bars and restaurants. book monaco if you want the perfect location for discovering the heart of downtown chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Five star service”
Reviews.Author: Pbish-592
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a weekend in Chicago and stayed at the Hotel Monaco. The location is at the north edge of the loop and the south edge of the miracle mile shopping district which affords great access to both the theater district, museums and shopping. The colorful decor is fun, and our king room featured a window seat big enough to nap in. The linen was top of the line and the heating and cooling responsive and precise. The hotel puts on a nightly wine reception, free to guests ,which is a great transition from day to evening. Our concierge booked reservations for our dinners both nights which really removed our stress. The adjacent restaurant was great for both lunch and breakfast and not over-priced/under quality as many hotel restaurants can be. The best part of the stay was how friendly and helpful all the staff was. We booked a great rate and still got top level service.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a mini-break”
Reviews.Author: Puddle_Jumper_2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend in Chicago. The front desk was very helpful and cheerfully recommended a restaurant and made the reservation for us. The room, although small, was fun and festive and QUIET. The location is fantastic and we really enjoyed our weekend. We did not go to the happy hour in the lobby on Friday afternoon, but the other travellers look like they were having a great time. We will be back for a couples weekend and also would consider bringing the kids there too.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: User1234_10
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Hotel Monaco and stayed in the Rock and Roll Suite. We were looking for something out of the ordinary and that's what we got. The room was spacious, the bed was comfortable and the service was awesome. On top of all that, there is even a juke box in the room!
