I would totally recommend checking this hotel out if you're looking to add a little bit of fun to your trip to Chicago. I would love to rent this room again and bring some friends.

Reviews.Title: “Now one of our favorites in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: edegenhard
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Monaco in January--our first time but probably not our last. It was perfect for a couple's quick getaway. I got a great rate to begin with, but upon arrival we were upgraded to a riverview room (something i probably could have requested but did not realize) and given a $10 card to use for items in the mini bar, a very nice touch. (I had joined the free Kimpton rewards program online--not sure if the little gift was because of that or if they were giving these to all guests at the hotel.) Our room was nicely decorated and pretty roomy, for a boutique hotel. The staff seemed very willing to help with any questions. We enjoyed the wine hour in the lobby one of the evenings, although it was a bit drafty for those who had to sit closer to the doors (there is a fireplace on the far wall--seats on the couch and chairs there get quickly taken). The lobby also offers coffee and tea from 6 to 9am. (A poster in the elevator says that hot cider and cocoa is offered from 2 to 4pm, but i saw no evidence of this.0 We especially loved the location of the hotel--we could walk to the Goodman theater and to shopping, as well as many restaurants. We often take our three children to Chicago--the Hotel Monaco is not the kind of place for families with young kids. But next time we head to the city by ourselves, we will definitely keep the Monaco in mind.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice for a little bit of TLC”
Reviews.Author: Angel_maesbriallu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in January, and everything about the hotel and staff was great. The room was very comfortable, and the "rent-a-guppy" program is a nice touch! The location makes walking in The Loop and up to the Magnificent Mile very easy (even in the 'Arctic Blast'), and we will definitely check out the rates for a return trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous AND affordable!!!”
Reviews.Author: ryderchic7
Reviews.Content: This hotel was even nicer than I expected! I'm a bit picky when it comes to cleanliness and decor and this hotel exceeded my expectations all around. I paid $119 for a river view king room and couldn't believe how "fancy" (for lack of a better word) this place felt. From the concierge hailing our cab, the upscale lobby (with a wine hour), to the nice bedding and toiletries and lighted make-up mirror in the bathroom, I was really impressed. I've spent a ton more on not so nice rooms with stains and generic , cheap decorating. The best part? THE WINDOW SEAT AND LOCATION! The river view was well worth the extra $20. We actually spent quite a bit of time looking down onto the city. It was a quick easy walk to Michigan Ave. and we had no problems walking back late that night from pubs on Division St. And the area is crawling with cabs if you choose that route. Also, while we didn't bring our pooches this time, we usually travel with our 2 dogs and LOVE the fact that they are dog friendly! The worst part? While the valet parking was REALLY handy, it was $42 a night. But we knew that coming down and had the choice of taking the train down from Wisconsin. And if we were driving to our city destinations and parking, it would have cost a lot more. It was worth it. Plus, even though check out is at noon, your parking is good until 2pm. So we could have left our belongings with the concierge and grabbed lunch or done last minute shopping before getting our car. I've always wondered about the Kimpton Hotel chain and the Chicago Hotel Monaco has officially made me a fan. I will be looking for their hotels on our other vacation destinations. p.s. If you like meat, lots and lots of meat.... eat at Fogo de Chao. Good food and neat atmosphere. Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Excellent”
Reviews.Author: IrishWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days at the Hotel Monaco over the New Year period and what a fantastic experience. The hotel is in a perfect location to explore all the sites that Chicago has to over. Everything thing is just a few blocks away, from fantastic shopping (participially State Street, Lake Street and the Mag mile) to ice skating in Millennium park. We stayed in a Mediterranean suite, which was very large and offers all the mod cons. An added bonus is the jacuzzi bathtub in the bathroom. If your travelling with children you'll have plenty of room. The sitting area contains a double sofa bed. The sitting area also contains its own flat screen TV. The bedroom is also large, giving you all the space you will need. Don't forget to asked for your in room goldfish, your children will love it! There is a small fitness room within the hotel. It is very small but it contains 2 treadmills, a step machine and 2 exercise bikes, with the addition of some free weights. Get in early, as it can get busy. What makes this hotel special, isn't just the excellent accommodation, it is the staff. They are simplely out standing. They are helpful, polite and courteous and make every effort to make your stay memorable. Would I stay here again........absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service - Just What We Were Looking For”
Reviews.Author: gemdomer
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco over Christmas to have a night to ourselves amidst visiting family and friends in Chicago. The hotel has a wonderful location, nearly on the corner of Wabash and Wacker, about three blocks away from the shopping on Michigan Avenue, and within walking distance from Macy's (formerly Marshall Field), Millennium Park, and all the action in the Loop. I also enjoyed running along the lake nearby. The hotel lobby was small but functional. Since we were there over the holidays (and I imagine this is a business hotel), there were not very many other guests. We had requested a Tall Room, which was quite large, on the top floor, and featured an extra-long bed and tall shower. The decor was quirky and colorful. The view was of a brick wall, but we didn't mind. As a Kimpton In-Touch member, we got free Wi-Fi service (a great touch, as some hotels charge $15 or more). We also used the CD player and enjoyed the $10 coupon to the minibar. We loved our "pet" goldfish (nicknamed Chubby). The service was outstanding, from the general manager confirming our special requests (which included early check-in), to the front desk staff to the bellmen. Everyone was extremely accommodating and friendly. We checked out the wine hour in the evening, and it was a great start to our evening out. There was a problem with the bathroom sink when we first arrived, but it was promptly resolved. We did not use the gym or the morning coffee, so I canâ€™t comment on those services. I would definitely recommend this hotel as an excellent value for the money (location, price, service, room quality). We had dinner at the adjacent South Water Kitchen and thoroughly enjoyed that as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: meglu
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful. room was spacious and lovely. Free breakfast was a nice plus. Would stay again--- thought it was great and a wonderful valiue.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, courteous staff!”
Reviews.Author: pghandbags
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago in mid November for a conference. I brought along my fiancÃ© and we had a lovely time at the Hotel Monaco. The staff was so friendly when we arrived. During the course of our stay they put up their holiday decorations and made things even more lovely in the lobby. The wine hour also included fresh fruit and various snacks. The free Starbucks in the morning was much needed! The toiletries are top notch (L'Occitane is among my favorites!). We got a great deal on the room so the view was expectedly lackluster, but well appointed. When we had a problem with a shorted out lamp, it was fixed promptly. The art deco decor is so cute and although the room was small, I found it to be cozy and not too tiny. The printed robes were fun. They gave you free wifi if you became a member of the Kimpton In Touch program. But the best part about this hotel was the prime location! We're not big on taking cabs and loved the nearby public transit options. We could easily take the subway from O'Hare and roll our bags the few blocks to our place. We were also just a short walk from an El stop in the Loop! We could walk to the Chicago Art Institute's museum, there was an Intelligentsia coffee shop nearby, we could walk to tons of shopping (Macys, Nordstrom Rack, Loehmanns, Filene's Basement, etc.), the river, and Millenium Park. We walked to Publican. Although we had to take the train to shop North Michigan, I still thought we made the right decision in picking the Hotel Monaco. I would definitely choose to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excelllent value and location in typical Kimpton style”
Reviews.Author: wkmoon
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco Chicago is a great value in a wonderful location. If I compare it to hotels of equal price and location, it gets five stars, but if I compare it to another Kimpton property that we loved, the Monaco in Portland, OR, I have to dock it a star just for some areas that aren't quite on Portland's level. Anyway, we'd stay here again in a heartbeat. We had a "river view" King. Room 1409 (top floor) that we booked on a special rate of $159/night. Now, it isn't the same river view that we've had on a high floor at the Chicago Hyatt, but we didn't pay only $159 there either! Views were best if you climb up into the roomy window seat, and then the view is of the Wabash bridge, river, and the Marina Towers ("corn cobs"). If you increase in room numbers, you will get closer to Wacker St and have more view of the Trump tower and overlook the Christian Science reading room. Smaller numbers (01-07) are going to put you farther from the river and closer to the sounds of the el. We could hear the train, but it was not loud enough to bother us. If we had been in 1404 or 1405, it may have been loud enough to keep us up, but i don't know for sure. Looking back in the other direction, we had a view of the Sears tower, lit up for the holidays as well as the lit steeple of the First United Methodist Church which is across from Daley Plaza. Upon arrival we had a morning flight and then about a 40 minute ride on the blue line from O'Hare with a 4 block walk from the station at Clark and Lake to the hotel. That was all very easy and made me glad we'd skipped renting a car and paying the $42/night parking! We arrived earlier than we thought, around 11 am, but they had a room for us, so it was great to be able to go ahead and check in. Our Kimpton program perk for the weekend was simply a key to the mini bar and our choice of 2 free items, up to $10 in value. On the other hand, when we stayed in Portland, we had a room upgrade and a bottle of wine, but, sigh, I know that can't happen every time! The Riverview King is a typical King room, with one upholstered chair in the corner, and a desk. The bathroom had a nice size granite countertop, but a traditional tub/shower that was not oversized. We were very surprised that the hotel tv had limited cable and was not even broadcast digital (which I am not sure how that could be the case). I really think they need to go ahead and be providing HD. We've had it at home for 7 years! However, we weren't Chicago to watch tv, so that's all I need to say. I noticed some faint odors of mildew each morning, but I could not pin-point it, and it was not all that strong, so I did not complain. Overall, the room was quiet, and in comparison to other chains, it is exceptional, but there was some hall noise and distant chimes of the elevator. Also, I heard a barking dog from a room down the hall one night, and another night there was a crying baby. This is another reason that I only gave four stars. At the Portland Monaco, we never heard a THING and were so amazed at the soundproofing there! The nightly complimentary wine reception was cozy and the staff also brought out some flatbreads that were tasty. A psychic/handwriting analyst casually circled the room and offered her services in a non-imposing way. Interesting touch, but we did not partake. There is lobby coffee in the mornings but only until 9am. Our housekeeper must have noticed (from the empty paper cups) that we went down for coffee and brought it back to the room, so she had left us an in-room coffee maker on the 2nd day of our visit. We had turn-down service each night with chocolates on the pillow and the tv turned to a yoga program. (I'd been doing a yoga program one evening before we went to dinner, so perhaps the staff noticed and tuned it to a different program for me for the night??) I also like that we left for dinner at varying times each evening, but somehow the staff must have known because they always did turn-down service while we were gone, instead of knocking while we were still in the room, which I find awkward when it happens in other establishments. We walked or took the train everywhere we went, and found the Monaco a perfect location for Michigan Ave/Oak St shopping and checking out the German Christmas Market in Daley Plaza. We also walked to the Art Institute on Thursday evening because it stays open late with free admission (5-8pm). We took the brown line up to shop in Lincoln Park and rode the red/purple up to Evanston to visit friends. If you are a walker, then all of this is doable from the Monaco without a car! It was not a problem to check our bags with the bell hop on our last day and stop back by the hotel and get our bags before walking to the train station to catch the blue line back to O'Hare. So incredibly convenient!! Yay to Kimpton! It's the little things and the friendly staff and the mentality that hotels don't have to be super expensive to be a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Richland34
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 stayed for 4 nights over the long Thanksgiving weekend. We were warmly greeted by Frances who checked us in without any problems. Our room was excellent, and YES, the window-seats are so cool! So nice to cuddle up in a blanket with a cup of coffee and watch all the shoppers scurrying around the streets. We had traditional Thanksgiving dinner at McCormick & Schmick's, less than a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Starbucks coffee in the lobby each morning was wonderful, and the wine reception in the evening was very nice. The hotel sets up the Wii for the kids to enjoy while their parents sip their wine and relax. The hotel is amazingly friendly and comfortable. Everyone on the staff had a smile on their face, even on Thanksgiving day. That means so much. Finally, the location. What else can be said? Perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs a little updating”
Reviews.Author: StopForDirections
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a few times and have always had a good experience. On our most recent trip, we noticed that the floor smelled very musty. Our room was good but some of the wallpaper was peeling off of the wall and that it generally needed a little TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel - great service, even BETTER price/value”
Reviews.Author: LATESHO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite a steal - great prices with some of the best hotel service I've had in awhile. Greeted everytime I entered, all hotel staff acted as if it was a pleasure to serve me. The rooms are cozy yet have plenty of room. And the rates are excellent. They even have complimentary wine in the evenings. Close to trains, Millenium park. Highly recommend. If I go back to Chicago, I'm staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice For Price !”
Reviews.Author: SamiSeppala
Reviews.Content: This is very nice place to come and see chicago. It is situated close to river and just steps from the Loop and Theaters and all the action there. Rooms were very nicely decorated, and soundproofing was very high class, even at 1st floor facing the street. Would highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: sbass68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night only during September 2009, whilst attending the amazing u2 concert at Soldier Field.. I booked it through priceline, so got a really good deal. The location is fantastic, very central, just off Michigan Avenue - next to river. The hotel has some lovely touches - nice robes and toiletries in the lovely clean rooms. Complmentary morning Starbucks coffee and newspapers in the reception and very polite and helpful staff. Staying at this hotel certainly contributed to our wonderful stay in this beautiful city. We would definately look to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with an Old World Feel”
Reviews.Author: bluefairy223
Reviews.Content: I prefer staying at Kimpton hotels b/c there's usually a high standard of customer service, great L'Occtaine bath products, rooms are spacious and clean, and free Wi-Fi for InTouch members. During my stay, they had a Summer Happy Hour event, where they served free wine and snacks in the lobby. I loved the doormen's uniforms. They were dressed in these uniforms that make you feel like you're stepping to a different time and place. Location is perfect. Definitely would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: sasa2010
Reviews.Content: We had trouble from the first step inside. The asked for a $100 cash deposit, made us fill out a bunch of papers, and the front desk person didn't even know what they were for, he told me to call and aks the HR deprtment during the week !!!!!???? WEIRD! The room was horrible, we had a view of the buildings' garage, right above the garbage, the windows did not open (Thank God), there was no heat, just blowing of cold air. The papers on the wall were coming off, very dirty and over used bath ropes, too disgusted to put them on, no amenities in the bathroom, without paying for them. Charged for phone call I didn't even use. Charged my credit card for the stuff I did use, instead to take from the deposit, and then being very rude about thier mistake. They seemed all nice in the begging when we came in, but when we had trouble and obviously on thir part, they didn't even let me speak over the telphone. Very bad experience, will never in a million years ever go back, a total nightmare. And were weren't the only ones going with our wrongful charges to the reception. I don't know who makes the other super great remarkes about this hotel, but it's a lie, they are probably made to write this during their shift to cover all the bad posts about them. WASTE OF TIME, AND I HAD A GIFT CERTIFICATE AND IT WAS FREE (and still had to put down a $100 deposit), AND I STILL HATED IT, SOOOO GO FIGURE!!! Plus parking is $40, which is far more than any other, for a hotel of just 10 floors. Cheapest hotel ever!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Room”
Reviews.Author: COguy
Reviews.Content: I am staying here now and actually am compelled to write this review before I fall asleep. The front desk staff were brief and one of them was chatting with her friend (gossiping) as I checked in (VERY unprofessional). The room she offered me was on a 'high' floor (5th.... HA) and when I checked in there was a big bag of grapes left behind by the previous guest on the window sill and some of the previous guests hair in the bathtub....I was DONE. Called down and had them re-clean the room; they made no offer to compensate or upgrade...not even a bottle of wine. The front desk clerk suggested I come down and get a key to another room (like I have time for that). Disappointing as I do like Kimpton hotels and am a Kimpton In Touch member (btw they've done away with the amenities...you just get a free item from the mini bar).

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Bienvenue”
Reviews.Author: Tvlnmomko1
Reviews.Content: My French friend was visiting the US for the first time. After visiting the countryside where I live, we planned to visit the big city. She wanted a budget hotel, but I love being able to walk around downtown Chicago, so I kicked in a bit extra and treated us to the Monaco. It was totally worth it. The location is excellent, the staff was wonderful. We enjoyed the wine in the evening, and enjoyed breakfast next door so much, we ate there every morning. I love a view and water, so we were glad we had a river view from our window seat. The room was very comfortable, and the whole place was cozy and pleasant. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Window seats!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjw5131
Reviews.Content: Great location, friendly and helpful staff, and totally cute room with cushy window seats you can plop yourself down in and watch over the city below.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: KramerMinnesota
Reviews.Content: Amazing location just a few blocks from Michigan Ave and not far from Macy's. The decor is gorgeous, it's right by the river, the staff are friend. They have wine tastings in the evenings. We've stayed here a few times on trips to Chicago and it's always our go-to place.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Service, Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: This hotel has that nice upscale boutique hotel feel to it. The staff greets you by name when you enter or exit, they have a wine hour in the living room like lobby (with wine served along with snacks, and even access to a wii game) and excellent morning coffee in the lobby. Since my traveling companions and I were only there for one night, we didn't seek out a goldfish, but it is a cute Kimpton touch. Our room had a lovely view overlooking the river, with two nice cushioned window seats to enjoy the view. Several bars and restaurants were within walking distance along with a 24 hour convenience store across the street. The reviewer who mentioned "beware of train noise" is correct, but it doesn't bother me--it's just a sound of the city that I kind of like, so not an issue here. The bed was very comfortable. I asked for a wakeup call in the morning and behold! A real live human called. It's been years since that's happened to me. Free wi-fi if you join the "In Touch" Klimpton loyalty program. A couple of things that I didn't like so much: There weren't enough outlets to charge phones, computers etc. There was no IPod dock which I do expect in these more contemporily styled hotels. The coffee in the lobby was wonderful, but there are people like me who just don't feel ready for primetime unless I have had my morning dose. Even a small one cup coffee maker would do the trick. I know most hotels feel they must have bathtubs for their guests, and I guess for those guests who have kids, or consider a leisurely soak in a bathroom some sort of luxury, they would get complaints if a room had no tub. But I really like a walk in shower with a real door instead of the bath/shower/shower curtain set up. The decor was fine, but not really stylish to me. I'd definitely consider returning to this hotel or the Klimpton's Hotel Allegro again when staying in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: gbogan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two friends spent the weekend at Hotel Monaco. Our rooms were updated, clean and attractive. The hotel staff was outstanding--friendly and always willing to out of the way to find answers to questions or provide suggestions. Several additional features would encourage us to return besides the good location (close to the river and a block from Michigan Avenue.) The staff will print boarding passes while you are out if you so request; the hotel offers a lovely wine hour late in the afternoon and when we were there they offered up to two free items from the mini bar (up to $11.) The concierge was knowledgeable and arranged tours for us. When we return to Chicago, we will certainly plan to stay at Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Had a pleasant stay!”
Reviews.Author: LarJay
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Chicago Marathon, and stayed here because it was walkable to the start/finish of the race (Grant Park), and could nicely accommodate 4 people in a suite. The location was great - everything is within walking distance, and the staff was friendly, helpful, and accommodating. The decor of the rooms is a bit over the top, think "circus" theme, but I thought it was fun and different. Our suite had a HUGE, jetted soaking tub, and window seats the size of a twin bed (someone could easily sleep on one). The room could use slight updating, but really, it was fine. If you're a light sleeper, make sure you request a room away from the trains (which run right at the end of the block). We could hear them all night long in our room, and it was a big problem for two of us. If the hotel hadn't been full, we would have switched rooms. Loved the free nightly wine reception in the lobby, and the Wii is a fun touch and would be great for kids. Also loved the free wifi. The attached hotel restaurant was good, but not great; I wouldn't eat there again over all the other great places in Chicago. Definitely recommend to travelers looking for a reasonably priced 4-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: LeighD
Reviews.Content: The customer service at this hotel is outstanding. The front desk graciously changed our room when my daughter (a frequent Kimpton guest) explained it was my first trip to Chicago and her birthday and we were hoping for a river view. The concierge, Ryan, was incredibly personable and helpful. Ali, the hostess at the restaurant, was fabulous...helped us pick a wonderful bottle of wine for our room and then later personally delivered us a cheese plate to enjoy with it "on the house". Wow! After my experience at this hotel and the Hotel Monaco in Alexandria, VA I am a Kimpton fan.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Retro66
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and would definitely come back. Initially we weren't given a goldfish, which was disappointing, but then we left a tip for the housekeeper, and she rewarded us with one. We had fun sipping wine and playing Wii in the lobby every afternoon. The staff were quite friendly and helpful, even printing our boarding passes for us. Our room was very comfortable, with a cozy little alcove at the window where we read the paper. At first we were worried about noise, since our room was next to the elevator, but we hardly heard it, and didn't notice any street noise either. The hotel is colorfully and tastefully decorated, well-lit, and ideally located.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Very Good Hotel w/Great Location but I Notice Budget Cuts”
Reviews.Author: DaylilyFan
Reviews.Content: I think the recession is taking its toll since our previous visit 11 months ago. The concierge now works behind the front desk, assisting with check in/out, and there's a WII station off the lobby where the concierge desk used to sit. I didn't see a bell captain, but there was adequate staff ("bell boys" sounds outdated) to handle the luggage very promptly. There was a delay fetching our car at checkout, but that's common at most hotels. As In-Touch members, we received a free newspaper of our choice, free WIFI, and turn-down service. We did not request a coffee maker in our room this trip. There is coffee and Taza teas with skim milk and cream in the lobby. However, one day the hot water and skim milk urns were both empty. We have a standing request for a quiet room on an upper floor, and this time we were on the 14th floor with a king room behind the stair well with no view (#1418). It was indeed very quiet (though you can hear slight elevator noises in the bathroom) and a bit larger with two easy chairs and a wider closet. The bed was as comfortable as ever, but I noticed a stain on the carpet, a couple of stains on the ottoman, and a rip in the chair slipcover. Excellent, adjustable HVAC. The hotel offers a yoga bag (mat, towel, blocks) on request, and there are various free yoga, meditation, and Pilates workouts on the hotel's TV menu. We like this hotel because the staff is friendly & helpful, and we can walk to the Lyric Opera, the Art Institute, Michigan Avenue, and the great River North restaurants. We even walk to the Field Museum! If you don't need a full breakfast (we spent about $30 with tip in the South Water restaurant), there is a Corner Bakery nearby and various Starbucks a little further. The downside is the $40/day parking cost, so perhaps we will try the parking garage around the corner next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Monaco Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABKBPeoria_AZ
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Monaco Hotel. Manager surprised us with a fruit tray compliments of the Harbor Court Hotel in San Francisco (we had stayed there several months ago). A big THANK YOU TO BOTH HOTELS (check out the attached picture). Great room . . . window seat was the best for relaxing, reading the New York Times and just looking out the window. Room was made up in a timely manner. Front desk staff very helpful and nice. Our room was on the 14th floor (the top) and we enjoyed every minute of staying at the Monaco. Give it a try . . . it won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: cb3121
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco in July, 2009. We have stayed at previous Kimpton hotels and have always been pleased. I am an Intouch member, so I was able to get a discounted rate for that weekend which was a big plus! The rooms are spacious and trendy. The free internet was a plus. I was concerned about no hotel parking (they have valet) but was able to find a parking garage around the corner from the hotel. The convenience to the "L" was a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff great location”
Reviews.Author: pkb2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Monaco, Chicago for 5 nights on business and I was very impressed. The staff was friendly from the time I checked in. The concierge was helpful with reservations for restaurants and even got us a reservation at a place that normally doesn't take them. My room had a beautiful view of the Chicago river. There was some noise from neighbors slamming their doors late at night (2-3am),but that only lasted one night thankfully. The location, within the Loop, makes it easy to get to various points of interest. Overall I had a great stay at this hotel and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: debraGbreckenridge
Reviews.Content: Nice size room, very nice staff and great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelohyeah
Reviews.Content: We don't normally stay right in the city, but we were without the kids and got a great deal on the room. We had a wonderful time. The room was gorgeous, clean, and quiet. The staff were very attentive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “No Fish!!!!”
Reviews.Author: worksalot7
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with this hotel. I had read such great reviews and gave up a hotel with a pool to stay here under the premise that there would be a fish in the room to entertain my child. I emailed the hotel well in advance and they assured me they'd put one in the room. Upon check in they again told me the fish would be coming. Nothing happened. I called again and was finally told, hours later, that they had no fish, much to my child's disappointment. The reason given was vague - either the fish dies or they ran out. The point is that they never bothered to tell me this - I had to find out after many attempts and I don't like that kind of treatment at what is supposed to be a four star hotel. The room was not that clean, either (hair, dust), and the wallpaper was coming off the walls in spots. If I were to make a choice again, I'd go with a hotel with a pool. There are many other choices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Kat_york83
Reviews.Content: We've been to Chicago before but have always stayed in the suburbs so this was our first time staying downtown. We chose Hotel Monaco as we were attending a Wedding Reception at the Hard Rock Hotel (just round the corner) and we made the right decision. The staff were friendly and helpful. We requested an early check in and this was noted on our reservation but we didn't actually get to the hotel until 5.30pm as our flight from Heathrow was delayed. This hotel is in an excellent location for all of the Downtown attractions. We walked everywhere - well nearly everywhere - we got a cab when it rained! There are only 2 negatives - 1. Our room was quite dark as it over looked an alley and didn't get any sun 2. No Tea/Coffee Making facilities in the room (it is offered in reception though but you have to get dressed!)

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: junebug1955
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is a rare find in a busy city! This fantastic and friendly hotel caters to every individual whim or fancy in style. The room was spacious and beautifully decorated, and the window seats provided an incredible view of the city and the Chicago River. We enjoyed the Wine Reception and the free morning Starbucks coffee. I let the hotel know that I was celebrating my birthday in my favorite city, and when we returned to our room that evening, a bottle of champagne was waiting. Two evenings later, we were pleasantly surprised again with champagne and fruit from our concierge, Ryan. Our housekeeper Beatrice even left M'Ms for me! Mark and Frances and all of the great staff (I wish I could remember all of their names), made our visit indeed memorable. Ryan's dinner suggestion of Hugos and Pizanos were right on. The architectural river cruise is beautiful- Chicago's First lady We flew into Midway and took the Orange line right to the loop- cheap and easy! We went to a Sox game and also took the El. The ball park is modern and spacious with delicious food and drink. Hotel location is perfect! great shopping in the loop and magnificent mile. We will definitely stay again at Hotel Monaco! Where else can you have a goldfish in your room, and have your palm read during a wine reception in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustwoman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend in Chicago recently for the U2 concert and wanted a reasonably priced hotel in a good location. We picked a winner with Hotel Monaco. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean and the bed was soooo comfortable. We are actually due for a new mattress soon and may buy the same one. Best of all you can't beat the location. You are within walking distance to many sights and since it's in the Loop every El line is 1-2 blocks away. We flew into O'Hare and simply took the blue line and walked 2-3 blocks to the hotel. If we go to Chicago again we will defiantely stay there again. We HIGHLY recommend the Hotel Monaco!!

Reviews.Title: “An absolute delight!”
Reviews.Author: christysla
Reviews.Content: I've traveled far too much than I'd like to admit, but the Hotel Monaco Chicago has refreshed my memory of what a hotel really can be. How refreshing it was to arrive to a comfortable lobby and a genuinely warm welcome from the desk agent. Don't expect the usual, "give me your credit card, here's your key" routine here. The staff actually TALKED with me--not intrusively, mind you--but they made a connection. We were here for a long weekend and every time I came and went, I was greeted. The staff asked how things were going with my stay. When I mentioned something I might need, they took care of it. Forget "might," they've got it covered. Two days after we arrived, one of the agents who helped check us in asked how our dinner at Volare was. He actually remembered the recommendation we received from the concierge! The room was just perfect. Just a touch run-down on some upholstery. But I wasn't looking at the upholstery. I was looking at the delightful view of the river from our spacious window seat. It was easily 6-feet long and 5-feet deep. I could imagine sitting there for hours in a rain storm, reading a book or wasting the hours away. I've stayed in all of the boring big hotels that aim for mediocrity. No thanks. I can do without the super-chlorinated lobby fountain. I'll take the Hotel Monaco from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Rare Find”
Reviews.Author: Muriel12
Reviews.Content: My time at the Hotel Monaco was a wonderful experience. I had never traveled to Chicago and relied upon reviews and my previous stays at Kimpton hotels to choose my hotel. My experience far surpassed my expectations. The Monaco is in a perfect location. It's within blocks of all CTA locations, and the primary Metra location is also very close. It's one block from Michigan Avenue, and only a few blocks from Millenium Park. It's very easy walking distance from the wonderful restaurants and shops of the River North area. I felt very safe, regardless of time of day/night that I was in transit. Hotel staff were always available--and with a smile and generous spirit. The lobby, unlike many Kimpton properties, is expansive with plenty of locations to mingle with colleagues and friends. My room was very large with tall ceilings and great windows. The bed was wonderfully comfortable, and only the loudest street noise (wailing sirens) could penetrate the room. I never heard neighbors, plumbing or normal street noise. I haven't slept so well in ages. Housekeeping was stellar. The room was meticulously cleaned every day. I left an average tip on my first day and was rewarded with bottled water that night, compliments of my housekeeper with a lovely note. My Kimpton In Touch arrival gift included bottled water and caramel corn. I didn't try the restaurant, but it was busy every evening. It seemed particularly popular with locals at happy hour. My only possible critique is that coffee/tea service ends at 9:00 am every day (including weekends). If you opt to sleep in one day, plan to walk to a nearby coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: papillonmarron
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the night of our wedding. The views facing the riverfront were spectacular. Everything in the room was immaculate and perfectly coordinated. The colors were bright and bold, but overall the decor was soothing. Beyond appearances the amenities were neat and comfortable. The hot tub and window seats were our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: altimase
Reviews.Content: My initial thought of the hotel was, this place is just ok, I didnt look up any reviews as I was staying there with 2 other friends. I was truly impressed from ceiling to floor with the room. Views were good, its just the surrounding buildings unless your towards the front where the river is located. I'm crazy about huge bathrooms and this one is HUGE. I love all the space they have. Flat tv, traditional seating and I admired the fabric-based headboards. Those are very nice! Walking distance to restaurants were convenient. I'm a highly frequent traveler to Chicago almost 20 years now and always stay with relatives. In any event, I'd recommend staying at the Monaco again!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: Joebaba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for three nights in August, 2000. It was excellent in every way. The doorman on arrival was excellent â€“ friendly and accommodating. He explained where I should go to check in and what to do if my room was ready, and what to do if it wasnâ€™t. He arranged quickly for a valet, and gave us help with our many bags. Our room wasnâ€™t ready (it was only 1 PM) â€“ but the deskman was very friendly and clear and explained that we could wait for our room on a high floor, or they could get us into a lower floor room right away. We chose to wait. They tagged and stored our luggage. We spent about an hour in the hotel restaurant/bar having a drink â€“ that was the only time we frequented the restaurant, but it was very good â€“ lots of drink options available. Then we got to our room and went WOW! We got a great Travelzoo rate on a suite, and it was very large and nicely laid out. The dÃ©cor was very funky â€“ not what youâ€™d probably do in your own home, but for a hotel it was lots of fun. They provided two animal print bath robes. The room had a very comfortable queen bed and some nice chairs and couches. The room also had window seats, that provided for a nice secluded space to read while watching the world go by. The high speed internet was included in our rate and it worked very well. The bathroom was huge with a shower stall, and giant hot tub. The staff were all very friendly the entire time. We had one issue with the internet, and it was resolved right away. Any questions we had about Chicago were answered quickly. The evening wine reception was nice, though there were a few too many toddlers roaming around for our liking. Morning coffee and paper was a nice touch. As was the evening turn down service â€“ chocolate mints on the pillows, and a relaxing, recorded stream/waterfall "movie" on the TV. The room was very quiet. The air conditioning worked well â€“ good thing as it was hot and muggy outside. And the location canâ€™t be beat. Itâ€™s right on the Chicago River, a block from Michigan Avenue. It was a short walk to the theatre district, Millennium Park, and of course Michigan Avenue. Being a Kimpton Hotel, it is pet friendly, though we didn't have our dog with us. We didn't ask for a goldfish to go in our room. All in all a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco a Hit”
Reviews.Author: brodiekid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for three nights from August 11 through August 14. This was our first trip to Chicago and were pleased with our choice of both city and hotel. Location: We chose Hotel Monaco based on the many positive reports on Trip Advisor and other sites. We wanted to be close to the river and the trains and with the Lake station a few blocks away, the location for us was perfect. Wicker Park/Bucktown, Oak Park and of course Oâ€™Hare are easily accessed. In particular, the convenience of taking a train from a major international airport downtown as opposed to a taxi, bus, etc. was appreciated (Hello Toronto, get your act together). The Loop location (Wacker and Wabash) was great with many major attractions within easy walking distance (we are a couple in our early 50â€™s with a teenage daughter). Hotel: This isa great hotel, very reasonably priced with excellent amenities, rooms and staff. We were given room 1208, overlooking the intersection of Wacker and Wabash with the river, the Trump Tower and a Mies Van der Rohe tower forming a backdrop. The room was very clean, large, cool and bright with two queen beds. Our only concern would be the lack of drawer space (maybe due to this being an adjoining room with 1207. The window seats are wonderful to lay on and gaze out on the view or for catching a short nap! The hotel was very quiet with no hall or room noise. On the 12th floor we could just hear the El down on Wacker which we really enjoyed (the El was a major interest of ours). We enjoyed the size of this hotel where front desk and lobby staff recognize you. Complimentary Starbucks coffee in the morning and wine late afternoon, offered in a double height room adjacent to the lobby, were very nice touches. Staff: The staff were very helpful and professional, offering interesting and important facts and advice. At 11.30 am arrival, our luggage was stored and front desk staff called our cell a few hours later to inform us that our room was ready. Bottled drinks were left for us be the housekeeping staff when they realized we liked orange juice. When a family emergency occurred on our day of departure, staff offered to help get our luggage to the Lake station for the trip to Oâ€™Hare. Excursions: We are by no means Chicago experts but weâ€™d suggest the following: 1. Check out the Wicker Park/Bucktown area for some great little shops (used books, movies, etc.) and wonderful food. 2. The Chicago Food Planet Food Tours are a wonderful way to slowly get to know interesting neighbourhoods (and to get away from the repetitive nature of places like the â€˜Magnificent Mileâ€™ (not so mag in our minds). 3. The Steppenwolf Theatre in OldTown was a nice treat and we were able to get some good food and drink at Oâ€™Briens. 4. The trip to Oak Park (self guided walking tour and home tour) is very interesting. This part of Oak Park is beautiful and the home tour guides offer great insight into the life of Frank Lloyd Wright. 5. Whatever you do, GO to Millennium Park and the Art Institute. World class all the way. Unfortunately Millennium Park closes at 11.00 pm so be sure to go earlier to catch the amazing light of the Pritzker Pavilion and the surrounding buildings. In conclusion, we would highly recommend this hotel for your next trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco Has Flair”
Reviews.Author: HotelGuestTraveler
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent travler to Chicago. I was part of a larger group conference and probably had the smallest room the hotel offered. With that said, it was very comfortable. The furnishings were very nice but the bathroom was small and spartan with lmiited toiletries. I have stayed at Hotel Monacos in DC, Denver and Portland, and Chicago suffers by comparison. The building is quite old and there was only so much improvements that could be made. With that said, it is still a nice hotel and worth considering for the location and price.

Reviews.Title: “loved the window seats!”
Reviews.Author: kroberts0525
Reviews.Content: Great location and helpful, professional staff. Elegant lobby and fun comfortable rooms. Ours had a view of the river. My only complaint was that the rooms both had a bit of an odor. My sister described it as "leisure suit".

Reviews.Title: “great service and location”
Reviews.Author: trlyons
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights. Service was very good. Hot cookies at check in. Room was ready on time and very well kept. This hotel has three star accomodations with 4 star service and wonderful location. Can walk to shopping, restuarants and threater. Grand Lux Cafe had great food on Michigan Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous w/fabulous location, but staff could use improvement”
Reviews.Author: nyauthor
Reviews.Content: The location and decor couldn't be nicer! And the price was right, too, because we took advantage of a TravelZoo special. Nothing could beat the windowseat in our upper floor room which looked out onto the river over the North Wabash and State Street bridges and the newly finished Trump building (which is a lot more architecturally aesthetic than any of his NYC monstrosities). But the staff seemed as though they weren't thrilled to work there. They weren't unhelpful, per se, but appeared to prefer that they hadn't been bothered to answer a question, whether it was for a restaurant recommendation or for directions to a Southside location. We were assured by two concierges that mass transit from the hotel was unavailable. A bit of internet research on my part (as an NYC native I'm used to navigating a mass transit system) revealed that the closest El stop (State & Lake) to the Hotel Monaco would drop us at a station on the Southside and from there it was an easy bus ride (the connection was right outside the station) that would drop us right across the street from our destination. Because we'd bought a one day fun pass for the cta, the round trip bus and train was included in the flat fee for the card (which we used earlier in the day). So, the concierges could be a bit more knowledgeable and helpful to guests traveling outside the hotel's immediate neighborhoods. One of them also gave us incorrect directions to the Willis (formerly Sears) tower. And when we checked out on a Saturday and discovered that there was an erronious restaurant charge added to our bill, the front desk clerk informed us that she could not reverse the charge herself. It would have to be done by the accounting dept., which doesn't work on weekends, so the problem wouldn't be taken care of until Monday. The promised follow-up from the accounting dept. didn't happen either. BUT ... for atmosphere and location (it's also within walking distance to some superb and highly affordable restaurants, as well as its proximity to the State & Lake El, from which you can go just about anywhere in the city, the Monaco can't be beat. It is truly gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Better than advertised”
Reviews.Author: lefty713
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other Hotel Monaco's, this is my favorite. Staff was friendly and helpful, room and products spectacular, and the location couldn't be beat. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Catt20
Reviews.Content: The location is the best, better than the Magnificent Mile, I walked everywhere. The rooms are very clean and a good size, the service is excellent. After staying at this hotel I will try other Kimpton Hotels

Reviews.Title: “Smart, comfortable hotel in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: WTurville
Reviews.Content: Although even "boutique" hotels in this part of the world are pretty big and high rise, this one has a lot more character than many of the larger chain offerings. Rooms are very chic and comfortable. Service is friendly. Location is excellent for Downtown and the Loop. Breakfasts are good, and ate lunch a couple of times which was well above average. The bar has a really nice buzzy atmosphere for a hotel, with a good range of local "craft" beers on draft (not the ubiquitous Bud Lite) if you like that sort of thing. Overall, not cheap but definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Missed the Mark”
Reviews.Author: 214book
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed during my recent stay for a conference. Given the favorable reviews, I was anticipating a much happier experience. Several things were just "off". Although check-in time is posted at three, our room wasn't ready until 4:30. The desk staff appeared either overwhelmed or disinterested. For instance, as I was leaving one day, the counter person asked "Shall I call you a cab?". I responded that I would be taking the 'L'. The response? "I'll have X get you a cab." Also had a rather unpleasant experience with housekeeping. I returned (albeit early afternoon) to find that my room was being cleaned. I dropped off some material and said that I'd be back soon. I returned an hour later and while the room wasn't pristine (water glass still on the table) the beds were made, towels refreshed and I thought all was well enough. As I started to change clothes and relax, there was a knock on the door. It was housekeeping. A rather grumpy "I'm not done cleaning the room yet" came through the door. At that point I didn't want to be disturbed any longer, and said that everything was fine as it was. Too, I realize that the rooms can't all face the river, but our alley facing window did give way to lots of noise (from the 'L' and trash removal). I visit Chicago every couple of years on business and thought I would give something besides the larger chains a try. I certainly will not be re-visiting this hotel, though.

Reviews.Title: “Not Top 40 in the U.S.”
Reviews.Author: Davunger
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at the Hotel Monaco, opting out of the better chains, primarily basing our decision to stay on the reputation of the Kimpton Hotel chain and the Travel Advisor ranking. Even though we stayed during a convention--understandably there's little choice in rooms--, we would have expected better. We arrived at 12:30 PM and were shown two rooms that we rejected. The first one was very dark and the second one though a bit less dark, had a funny smell (in fact the beds in all the rooms smelled funny--poor soap or old feather pillows). We were told that at 3 PM we would be offered a nicer room. At 3:20, we inquired and were told that our room was not ready. After discussing this (the manager said to me with veiled sarcasm: "I'm sure you have stayed at better hotels" when I said I was upset by this), we were finally given a room facing a wall on the 14th floor, which was otherwise fine. We did complain about the coldness in the room and were told to take off the fan and the temperature would be fine--it never went above 68. The hotel is in a good location, the rooms are tastefully decorated (though showing their age) the adjacent restaurant serves a great breakfast, but I will never come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Whimsical in the best sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: solotravelerToronto
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at the Hotel Monaco. Everything you would expect from a quality chain hotel with the feel of a small, boutique hotel. The rooms are richly decorated. Nothing bland. The window seats are fantastic. And check out their goldfish program. I've already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: rawbacon
Reviews.Content: Location is unbeatable! Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Hotel is beautifully decorated inside. Our room was showing a little bit of wear (wallpaper peeling in one place, floorboard scuffed in several places, shower made some annoying noise) I would definitely stay here again! (Hotel has valet parking...which they neglected to tell me was $40/day! That was a shocker on the bill!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Lauralooe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed in. The location is great, just a short walk to Michigan Ave. The rooms are HUGE! Biggest hotel room I have ever stayed in. Great decor and ambiance within the hotel. There is a wine hour between 5-6pm where all residents can make the most of free wine, snacks and there is also a Wii console to use within this hour. This is a great way to meet other travellers and enjoy the beautiful hotel. I would definately reccoment this hotel. There is a gym, however it is small. The attached bar/ restaurant is also very nice. Free breakfast bars are also available on the rception desk - I have never been in a hotel that gives so much free things! Suitable for all. Dogs are even allowed!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: TorontoBarb
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Chicago and wanted a hotel that was in a good location. This definitely fit the bill. I could walk to all the places I wanted to see - very close to Michigan Ave and the Magnificent Mile. About a 15 minute walk to the Art Institute. The hotel staff was very friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. There was coffee in the lobby every morning, that was very welcome. The room was comfortable and clean and fairly quiet. I could hear the train and some traffic from the street (considering the location, this wasn't bad and didn't affect my ability to sleep or relax). I would definitely recommend this hotel - a gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: jl2117
Reviews.Content: We had a top-floor suite at the Monaco during Fourth of July weekend and loved it. The suite was very large with a comfortable bed, jacuzzi, two large flat screen tvs and a sleeper sofa for the kids. Our girls loved the huge window seats overlooking the river. The staff was very friendly, prompt and helpful. They gave the kids stuffed animals when we checked in and brought up a pet goldfish for us during our stay. The location was fantastic, right off Wacker across from Marina City on the river. We were in manageable walking distance to lots of kid-friendly spots: the American Girl Store, the Rain Forest Cafe, Cheesecake Factory, Hershey Store, Portillos, Millennium Park, the Art Institute and plenty of pizza places. The museum complex was also a short train ride away and it was easy to find a bus to take to Navy Pier. You couldn't see the fireworks from the hotel but we only had to walk a couple blocks to see them from the street. On the whole, I'd highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: cdukesbic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I LOVED our stay at the Hotel Monaco. The location is fabulous - right downtown in the loop and close to everything - including El stops. The room was great. We both LOVED the window seats. I could just sit up in there and read and look out over the city and the river. There were a couple of parts of the hotel that looked a little "worn" - for instance the entryway (the carpet, etc.), looked a little "old". But, all in all - it was a great place. I appreciated the free Starbucks coffee in the morning and the free evening reception, although we only got to go to that once. In short - Chicago is an amazing city and Hotel Monaco was great!

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Decat08
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Monaco. Rich, the concierge on duty when we checked in, was welcoming and very helpful, and we found the rest of the staff to be friendly and helpful as well. The room was clean and well appointed, and we loved the window seat. We were less than 10 minutes from Grant Park and the State Street Macy's (check out the ceilings there...fantastic!), and we were close to the train as well. We didn't try the food at the affiliated restaurant (South Water Kitchen) because there were other restaurants nearby we wanted to try. Overall, it was a great experience, and the next time we're in Chicago, we'll be sure to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “In one word..."fabulous"!”
Reviews.Author: Th3HappyTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago for 3 nights (6/22-6/25). The purpose of this trip was to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday & to do some sightseeing/shopping. On a previous visit we stayed at The Drake Hotel (which is also very nice) but the staff at the Hotel Monaco went out of their way to make sure this trip was memorable as well as comfortable. We booked on Priceline and got a great rate--the only drawback was that you cant guarantee a queen room (Priceline's fault--not the hotel). However, the front desk cheerfully upgraded us to a King Mediterranean suite (Room 905) with a partial view of the river. The padded window seats (3 of them!) are amazing as is the massive jacuzzi tub--so relaxing. My youngest daughter actually preferred sleeping in the window seat to the sofa bed. There is no in-room coffeemaker and we are late-risers (coffee is served 6am-9am in lobby) but a quick call produced a coffeemaker that we used throughout our stay. We didnt have turndown service on any night of our stay (slight negative) but the manager did send a personal welcome note & complimentary champagne for my daughter's birthday--a nice touch! I might mention we are Kimpton InTouch members--all of my requests were met (non-pet floor; quiet room w/view, highest floor possible, etc.) even though we booked with a 3rd party so I would suggest joining their rewards program (free) if you arent already a member. I hope to return to Chicago again soon and we will definitely stay at the Hotel Monaco!! My hats off to Kimpton for making us feel like "special guests"--not just ordinary travelers.

Reviews.Title: “An almost perfect stay.”
Reviews.Author: mouseRD
Reviews.Content: This review is rather late, but I had some time to think about what I wanted to write & essentially we (my husband & I) had a great stay. My only complaint was that I slept very little due to very loud construction noise (i.e. jackhammers, etc) which was a result of the city doing roadwork the entire weekend of my conference; the hotel said they had no advance notice of this when I asked about it. We stayed in a lovely Mediterranean suite w/ river view, which I would highly recommend - lots of room to spread out. Service was great. Dining in the restaurant was ok (Hotel Birnham's restaurant was wonderful). We also enjoyed walking to other restaurants in the area (loved Osteria Via Stato) & picking up snacks at Trader Joe's. We also were able to see Wicked our first evening in Chicago & went on the Chicago Architectural Foundation riverboat tour. My first introduction to L'Occitane products which I have since ordered (love that Verbena scent). We loved the complimentary bath salts to use in the jacuzzi. In the future, if I ever return to this or any other hotel that is doing roadwork, I will change my room to an interior room or change hotel altogether as it was very unpleasant to exist on so little rest, but I guess this wasn't the fault of the hotel. It was a rather expensive room because it was conference season.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: pamylah
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel Monaco 6/24-6/26 and really enjoyed my stay there. Hotel staff was friendly. Stayed at room 912 which was a King river view room. Absolutely loved the bed and the window seat. So comfortable I took a nap on the window seat. Loved the turn down service to the Hotel lobby to the free wi-fi. The only thing from my experience there that I didn't like was the walls from the hall way to the room apparently are too thin or something. There was a loud guy in the hall way talking on his cell around 930pm on 6/24 on the 9th floor. Was about to say something to the front desk when I heard someone from the other room confronted him. He continued to be loud for a few moments then he left. This really didn't have anything to do with the hotel but just made my experience there was slightly diminished because of that. Anyway. The room was beautiful and clean and would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites”
Reviews.Author: adamwineguy
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I have stayed at the Monaco in Chicago for the past several years on our anniversary. As a veteran of the hospitality industry, the Monaco always meets our standards. From beautiful art deco rooms, to fabulous customer service, we will always return here on our special day. And since we can't bring our beloved dog along, we always treat ourselves to a complementary goldfish as a stand-in pet for the evening. Always a treat for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Stay Again, But Will Be More Specific Next Time”
Reviews.Author: LouKYLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monace on June 19-20, 2009. The visit was to celebrate our 20th anniversary, although we didn't make any type of announcement to the hotel staff. Wine reception and turndown service were great touches - loved the window seat, though not the best view, and the concierge staff was most helpful. While the stay was relaxing in all respects, there were a couple of little disappointments. First, we had requested a quiet room on a higher floor and away from the elevator. We were given a 4th floor room that was right across from the elevator -- ding, ding, ding. The first greeting we received once inside our room was barking from the dog(s) next door -- but that soon quieted down. We later found out that this pet-friendly hotel puts the patrons with pets on the 4th floor if possible. I'm not sure how a middle-aged couple without a pet ended up on the that floor; we probably should have asked for a different room, but we didn't. Later on Friday night (after midnight), I was awakened by two couples, obviously staying on opposite ends of the 4th floor calling down the hallway their plans for the next day - and, of course, their goodbyes for the evening! That was rude to the highest degree. The room itself was excellent, we just would have been happier with a better location within the hotel. Without reservation, we will stay here again, but next time will make sure to follow through with making sure our room request is exactly what we want.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Hotel Monaco!”
Reviews.Author: yede1
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago with a bunch of friends to see the MN Twins play at Wrigley. We booked our rooms via priceline and Hotel Monaco was the chosen hotel. We were not dissapointed. The hotel is just a block or two off of Michigan Ave where we spent a day walking around shopping, eating, etc. There are several bars, places to eat in the immediate vicinity, and tons within a short walking distance. Ryan, the concierge, was always there and very helpful with directions, and he made reservations for us for dinner a couple times. The bell staff was quick with getting cabs whenever we need them. The hotel is situated about 3 blocks from the train which we took to and from the airport. $2.25 vs. $40-50 cab fare. (and quicker) Our room was nice and clean although the view was of a roof and the side of another building. What can you expect by using priceline? We saved alot of money by using priceline! Every night the hotel put on a wine party with free wine and there was coffee in the morning from Starbucks in the lobby. We got room service for breakfast one morning and it wasn't very good. We had some friends who walked across the street to the Emerald Loop for a breakfast buffet, we should have gone there. The hotel had free wi-fi, which is always nice. Morton's of Chicago is right next door, we had dinner there one night and it was one of the best meals we have had in a long time. Make sure to check the website before going there for a really great special! There are so many hotels in downtown Chicago we are not sure we would pick this one again, not because we didn't like it, but because we like to try new ones all the time, but if priceline chose this one again we wouldn't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: americaninparis08
Reviews.Content: Our whole family LOVED this hotel and will never stay anywhere else in Chicago. Our 4-year-old wanted to move in and never leave.

Reviews.Title: “I can't imagine a better place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BBHME
Reviews.Content: We had a truly great time on our first visit to Chicago, and the Hotel Monaco was a large reason for that. The hotel is perfectly located, just a couple of blocks from the El and subway, the Magnificent Mile and Millennium Park. Get a river view room; we were so glad we did as we spent lots of time just sitting in the big window seat and looking at the river and the buildings. The staff truly went above and beyond. We got a (great!) room even though we arrived before check-in, and after we mentioned that we were in town for our anniversary, Sheena, the truly awesome manager, sent us up a bottle of champagne. Ryan and Sylvia, the concierges, were both tremendously helpful. We enjoyed helping ourselves to the sangria at happy hour, free ice cream and warm cookies at 3pm. I hate staying in big name highrise hotels, so this is right up my alley. Friendly, convivial atmosphere, funky design. Highly recommended! One pointer - sign up for Kimpton Rewards if you aren't already a member.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Genuine Service”
Reviews.Author: LeBonRobert
Reviews.Content: I want to recognize so many people who were exemplary in their service. 1) Sylvia Rollins, Head Concierge. I wanted a fairly last minute reservation at MK restaurant. I spoke with Sylvia on the phone just a few days prior to arrival and within 15 minutes had the desired reservation. 2) Ryan Lettier, Concierge, provided us detailed information on the architectural cruises. Our morning cruise ended up being cancelled by the tour operator and Ryan provided a late check out time to cover us until we could get back to the Monaco. 3) Turndown service was provided as requested and housekeeping in general seemed to be at a high standard 4) Even the bellman went out of their way to ask if we knew how to get the train etc when leaving the hotel. The rooms are tastfully furnished in that whimiscal Hotel Monaco feel. Beds and bedding both very comfortable. The complimentary happy hour and morning coffee/tea service were both very utililzed by the hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem In The Heart of The Loop”
Reviews.Author: STYLEONTHEGO
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at this wonderful Kimpton property for a romantic getaway weekend. The staff were extremely friendly. Our room was upgraded from a standard king to a larger room with a California King at check in. The room itself was spotless, nicely done with funky, yet tasteful decor. The oversized bed was extremely comfortable. Large bathroom with powerful shower pressure. The afternoon wine happy hour and w-ii is a nice touch. We also very much enjoyed two nights of cocktails at the adjacent bar and restaurant. The hotel is well located just off the Chicago River and almost anything you need/want to see is within walking distance, or a short cab ride away. Fast WIFI service that is also free (something not common at even the most upscale hotels). Our only complaint was the poor housekeeping service. Room was not cleaned until 2PM on our second day, requests for turndown service and extra towels took a couple of calls. The on site gym is tiny, but workable. I would definitely stay here again. This place is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: kristineLA
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful, whether it's directions or restaurant recommendations. The rooms are clean and the bed and pillows are comfortable. Good water pressure on the shower. The location is very convenient to walking to many locations and it seemed like everything else was just a $5 cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Over the Top”
Reviews.Author: RMorris09
Reviews.Content: From the minute I arrived and saw the river just steps away, I was quickly greeted by the door man. I went to the front desk and the young lady knew we were checking in that day and realized we were part of a wedding party. On her second guess she guessed who we were and quickly checked us in and gave us an excellent room with a million dollar view. This was all within the first 15 minutes of arriving, and things never faltered from this top notch service, and courtesy that initially greeted us. The on site restaurant is excellent as well as the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for our weekend in the city!”
Reviews.Author: Andrea074
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Everyone was very friendly from the doorman to the hotel desk clerk to the concierge. They were very considerate and give us an option of a quieter room or a room with a better view given our reservation request. I really liked that they guaranteed the types of beds at the time of reservation since it was a girl's weekend out and we certainly wanted two queens, not a king. The location was perfect for our needs. We were only a couple of blocks from Macy's (the old Marshall Fields), the art institute,theaters, restaurants and the Chicago Times building that starts the Miracle Mile. I had two minor complaints. The attached restaurant was a bit pricey although very good and while there were actually lots of restaurants all around us, it seemed that the staff were not that familiar with options that would suit us which meant some trial and error on our own. The other complaint was that I took my iPhone rather then my laptop to stay connected. The hotel has wireless but every time my phone went to sleep, it dropped the connection and logging in was so difficult that I stopped trying after a while. This seemed to be a function of the phone and the ISP. We had a great stay and I will certainly stay there again the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “Happy NE Loop location”
Reviews.Author: Gay16
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago in January--snow, ice and sunshine--to see the Oprah Show. Hotel is located one block off Michigan, steps from the River at the North corner of the loop. Great hotel service with the concierge steering us to good food as well as a walking pattern that was do-able despite the snow and weather. Love the wine happy hour at 5pm. Another happy Kimpton experience! Restaurant next door provides room service. We ate lunch there and had huge portions just ordering an app + an entree each. Had to empty the fridge to store the food (and this hotel does not have that annoying feature that charges you if the bottle is moved). Medium sized room with a good sized bathroom, tricked out in the striped motif that is all Monacos. Didnt hear our neighbor who apparently had a dog (phew) so sound proofing was good.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Rover55
Reviews.Content: This was such a treat from the moment we stepped out of the cab until the moment we reluctantly left Hotel Monaco. The staff (from the doorman to the front desk to the housekeeping department) was very accommodating and friendly. Some of my favorite things were the wonderful beds and selection of pillows, chocolate chip cookies hot from the oven and 3 and wine at 5. The rooms were a nice size and very quiet. The location is within walking distance to many of my favorite sites in Chicago. I would recommend (and have) this hotel to anyone going to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “my favorite hotel anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: agobot
Reviews.Content: my last stay here was around the holidays in december. in march i stayed at the hotel allegro which is also a kimpton hotel, and it was larger with a much nicer gym, but i still love hotel monaco the best. the location is great--about 2 blks away from the cta station (wabash randolph, i think) and the staff is the most warm and wonderful ive ever met. the rooms are comfortable and cozy, and i love lounging in the window box, overlooking the river and the bridges below. tiny gym is serviceable, turndown is so much fun with different candy every night, and if im lucky, i get a go at the freshly baked cookies in the afternoon on the front desk. just a block away from michigan ave, and a few blocks away from grant park.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: suechucky
Reviews.Content: What can I say? Our stay at the Hotel Monaco was perfect! We had a very quiet, clean room on the 6th floor. All of the employees we came in contact with were extremely polite and helpful. We got a great deal from travel.zoo that included free valet parking. We asked to have a goldfish in our room. The kids thought it was great. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret!”
Reviews.Author: dav205
Reviews.Content: My mother and I celebrated my birthday in Chicago with a girls' weekend. This was our first stay with Kimpton Hotels. Little did we know that Hotel Monaco would make note of my birthday and leave me little touches like candy and a bottle of wine for my celebration. Everything was set according to my Kimpton InTouch program preferences, and I couldn't be more pleased. From the eco-friendliness of the hotel, to the L'Occitane toiletries, to the attentiveness of the staff and housekeeping, every little need I had was taken care of. The only wish I had was that they not charge for the use of the business center computer so we could check in with our airlines. Mom and I are very particular, and we were both pleased with the exceptional service, decor, cleanliness and location of Hotel Monaco. It's conveniently located just across the river from the beginning of the Magnificent Mile which we shopped along every day. We had a quiet Deluxe Queen Queen room, and it was very spacious. I will be visiting Kimpton Hotels again for future stays!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and impeccably clean”
Reviews.Author: mikeftl
Reviews.Content: My first stay at a Kimpton, and I became a fan and joined the loyalty club. Personalized service but not snobby the way W hotels can sometimes be. Room was spacious and comfortable. Hallways and public areas are well maintained and the bartender was friendly even though it was late. The only reason this isn't 5 star is that the exercise room is the smallest I have *ever* seen. It was in very good condition but more than 2 people is too many. Staying at the new Kimpton in Atlanta next: The Palomar

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what an amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingSoul
Reviews.Content: This place and the staff are amazing! We arrived around noon, even though official check-in was 3:00, and the front desk let us know a room was ready for us right then!! Beautiful river view --- great window seat built for 2 -- and the room was spacious and inviting. We spent the afternoon out and about in Chicago, came back to our room around 5 and found a delightful treat in our room and the wine hour going on in the lobby. Even had turn-down service and chocolates on our arrival back from dinner that night. Best service ever!! Would definitely stay there again - and again - and again!

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-loop location, fun hotel style and pleasant staff service, poor soundproofing...”
Reviews.Author: WemberlyWi
Reviews.Content: Entered the hotel with a friendly and smiling welcome. Received a free spring gift - a plush goldfish. Able to get early check-in about 30 minutes before standard 3p check-in. The 9th floor room was away from elevator and had foam pillows (both as requested). The room was spotless and the warm color palette was inviting. I absolutely loved the padded window seats and cozied up there both nights of my stay - with the bolster pillow, the beautiful and soft throw, a book, and my camera. I had wished the room had an in-room coffee maker. Although the hotel provided a free coffee and tea service from 6a-9a, I didn't want to have to get dressed just to get a cup of coffee from the lobby. The walls and door to the room may as well have been made of cardboard, as hallway voices were as clear as if the door was open. And I awoke at 230a the first night and early the second morning to folks in an adjacent room gettin' busy... loudly. Folks can do whatever they wish in their rooms, I just don't want to hear them clearly. Turning on the tv and radio helped to mask their sounds...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: lvvisitor
Reviews.Content: We were able to stay at a promtional rate of $81/night, but would have considered it a good value at 4X that price. Location is perfect for tourists (a two minute walk to the river and to Michigan Ave, and very near the public transit loop). We never told any of the staff we were actually on a mini-honeymoon, but we were treated as if they did know that... very professional and friendly, with a few personal touches like treats delivered to our room daily. The room was average size, but extremely clean with very charming decor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Mblaca
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights. The room was very comfortable. Big king bed, enough room to stretch out and do some work. the Bathroom was spacious and the showerhead was mounted at about 7 feet so I didn't have to bend down to rinse my head. The room (5th floor) had no view. Didn't bother me though. Free NY Times and WSJ every day. Staff very attentive. I didn't eat there - too many other delicious choices in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Ataner76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monaco on a leisure trip with my husband. Hotel was great - true to Monaco form it was very trendily designed. Very nice rooms and excellent window bed overlooking the river, which was a nice perk. Staff were extremely helpful. And great location - close to shopping and other sites downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean Hotel in a great location”
