Reviews.Author: CallAttendant
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to spend 3 nights at the Hotel Monaco and we were extremely pleased. The staff were all incredibly helpful and friendly. The rooms were on the smallish side, but with the high ceilings, we never felt cramped. I loved the window seat and spent some time just staring out the window watching the world go by. I rate hotels by the cleanliness of the grout in the bathroom and our room was clean and bright. I would definitely stay here again! We took the complimentary shuttle to the Horseshoe Casino in Hammond. It was very convenient and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit”
Reviews.Author: milinxs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for a long rainy weekend. We stayed in a Mediterranean suite which was just perfect. We had a nice seating area with a TV, a very comfortable bed, large window seat and a fantastic bathroom with a huge whirlpool tub for two. Our only complaint would be the small standing shower. The service was great. Eric worked with the concierge for very specific flowers to be delivered to the room, which arrived as requested. The location was convenient for walking to many great Chicago sites and great restaurants. We will stay here again if we find ourselves in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but no working internet”
Reviews.Author: sksuthneedham
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for the first time after many stays in the Hyatt, Marriott, Hard Rock and Renaissance near the river. I appreciated the satff attention and the very quiet rooms (especially when compared to the high volume Hyatt) but the hotel internet service wasn't working all day which was a significant inconvenience. Will try again though as the alternative choices around Wabash for the same $ are not as appealing

Reviews.Title: “Great location great service!”
Reviews.Author: emandj
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the second half of our honeymoon over new year's in chicago. We really liked the decor of the place - definetly a distinctive, boutique hotel. The staff was really nice during the whole stay. The location is great for the price we paid - really close to the "loop" stations and a reasonable walk from the magnificent mile, grant park, and the theatre district! They brought us a goldfish after we asked for it, and the maid left us a bag of candy and complimentary water bottles. I liked the free wi-fi and the stereo (which I promptly hooked up my i-pod to), and the beds were really comfortable. Would stay there again any time!

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: RMF328
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco as we started our honeymoon in downtown Chicago, after reading the positive reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel definitely lived up to our expectations! We felt welcome right at check-in, and from the beginning the hotel felt like home. The decor in the lobby as well as the room was a classy blend of modern and traditional, and we found the rest of our stay to be a reflection of that. The room was spacious, the bed comfortable, and the food via room service was some of the best that I've had (we had the breakfast in bed package--very good choice!). The wine reception in the lobby was a great touch too and a wonderful way to start an evening on the town in Chicago. The only issue that I had was at check-out, when I found they charged me for the breakfast which should have been included in the room price. My compliments to the front desk though--they worked through it quickly and were able to credit it back to my account. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Return visit to the Monaco- Proposal Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: pickles1107
Reviews.Content: We came to Chicago in March and stayed at the Monaco, and loved it so much that we went back in August. I was planning on proposing this trip, so I splurged a little and booked a Mediterranean Suite on travelzoo for $189/night. What a deal that was! This promotion booked you into a standard Med. Suite, so I emailed the hotel and told them my engagement plans, and they upgraded us to a river view Med. Suite gratis. This was above and beyond but greatly appreciated. I am a Kimpton InTouch member as well, so all my preferences were noted and accomodated. These suites are large with a separate living room with a rather uncomfortable sleeper sofa and bedroom, each with their own flatscreen TV. In the bedroom, we swiveled the TV around and watched the Olympics from the infamous window seats. The bathroom houses a humongous whirlpool tub, but the small standup shower tucked away in the corner seems like it was an afterthought. View the attached photos for a better idea of the room. Being from out of town, I dealt with the concierge quite a bit trying to work out the details of the special occasion, and Ryan truly exceeded expectations with trying to plan this special day. He went to Fox and Obel on his off day to pick up a picnic basket as well as Target to pick up a few items, set me up with a local florist, and even picked up our food the day of the event from Pastoral around the corner. Everything went off without a hitch. Let me sing the praises of a few other staff members. We met Oscar, one of the Bellmen, during our visit in March, and he recognized us this visit, which was fun. Also, a couple of new friendly faces this go 'round were Jared and Mark (red-haired guy -- hope I got the name right!). Jared was interested in our plans and provided friendly conversation as we came and went, and both offered suggestions on where to grab a late night Chicago dog, etc. Now with that being said, we did experience a few inconsistencies during our stay. For example, the first two nights our room was not turned down, and with the exception of the above, the overall mood and vibe from the staff was not as friendly this visit. The front desk staff often did not welcome us back when we returned from a day of adventures like they did in March, and no one ever greeted us by name our entire visit as they had previously done. I do know the hotel was booked solid this trip with a large convention in town, and in addition the hotel was hosting a wedding this weekend as well, so obviously they had a lot going on. The staff just seemed over the top before and seemed to exude cheerfulness, and now I'd say they were just above average with the exception of the above folks. They set the bar so high on our maiden voyage and couldn't sustain that perception with us this time. Lastly, while staying at such a property, one comes to expect a certain level of service. I just didn't feel the attention to detail was there. For example, since the hotel was heavily involved in the engagement, I halfway expected a congratulations note, or them to send up a piece of cake, etc. Overall, I'd give the service from Shannon (the director of rooms) and Ryan prior to arrival an A+++, and the service post arrival a solid B. We will be back... Oh, and she said yes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family-friendly hotel!”
Reviews.Author: samsmom2006
Reviews.Content: My husband stays here for business. He suggested we book The Monaco for a family getaway weekend. This is a TERRIFIC hotel for a family weekend in Chicago. Great location- in the Loop- walking distance to all the great shopping and Millenium Park. Right around the corner from a CTA bus stop. And walking distance from the elevated train (we took the train in from Midway Airport). The staff at The Monaco are SO friendly. Housekeeping was excellent. Our room was quiet- even though the hotel seemed quite full of guests. The room's furnishings were elegant and comfortable. They offer a free pet for the weekend: a goldfish in your room. My 10 year old son LOVED this treat. He also enjoyed the Kimpton Kids gift bag he received at check in. The concierge team was also friendly and full of good information.

Reviews.Title: “It's Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TYOTP
Reviews.Content: I can only confirm the positve reviews previously mentioned. We stayed in room 1112, King with River View. No noise and very comfortable.The price was a bargain at $191 a night. I would stay here again. The "L" from Midway Airport lets you off about two blocks from the Hotel. It's a $2 ride - no need for a $40 taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Tek
Reviews.Content: Since we live in the Chicago area, we were looking forward to spending a night in the city. We found the hotel uneventfully, but as we drove up to the hotel, we discovered that the one way street was now two way and there was no signage. There was no one outside to either take the car or tell us which way to go. We drove away and I called the hotel from my cell and was told, "I am with a customer and can't talk to you." We drove around the block and tried again. This time there was a doorman who took the keys. The front desk check in was efficient, although not friendly. The room was small. The only chair was the one at the desk. The two "window seats" were built into the window wells and so high that I could only reach them by climbing up onto the bed. The closet held clothes that looked like someone had left them there; on closer examination it was apparent they were for sale. The bathroom was nice but ordinary. The bath bombs were $8.00 apiece. Was it worth $259.00 plus $40.00 in taxes and $40.00 for parking? NO.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrynMawrBK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Monaco the weekend of October 24th and had a generally good experience. The location is terrific, overlooking the river in a nice area close to restaurants and shopping. I stayed in a fifth-floor two-room corner suite with great views. My rooms were very comfortably furnished with oversized couches and chairs, two large flat-screen TVs, and three huge cushioned window seats looking out at the river. I enjoyed the large whirlpool tub with an ample jar of fragrant bath salts on the side. The downsides were a corner shower so tiny that I literally had difficulty turning around, a VERY limited room service menu, and construction noise during the night from the street below. This is a boutique hotel, so there is no bar or real hotel restaurant; if you go through a door at the end of the hall in the lobby you enter the South Water Kitchen, a casual-looking place that I didn't try. The hotel has a complimentary wine hour from five to six in the evening in the lobby, which is nice but rather spartan: the wine was accompanied solely by a dish of olives and a glass filled with breadsticks. There is nothing on the room service menu in the way of snacks or something light to tide you over to a late dinner. One other weak point was that my room did not receive turndown service on either of the nights I stayed there. On the second night I telephoned housekeeping a few minutes after 8:00 p.m. to request turndown service, as I was about to leave for a 9:30 dinner reservation. I was told that the hotel does not provide housekeeping services after 8:00 p.m. This makes no sense to me in what is supposed to be a luxury hotel. After all, not everyone goes to dinner at 6 p.m. in a city like Chicago. Other than this, my stay was quite satisfactory and the staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay, perfect fit”
Reviews.Author: kaywinnit
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at the Monaco, and it was too short a stay. The location was perfect for me, close to the theatres. I had a tall room, which was fun (think tall ceilings, extra-tall robe plus regular sized robe). Only problem I had was to adjust the shower head--I needed to climb on the side of the tub to reach it! However, the staff was very accommodating, and I'm sure someone would have helped me had I asked. Loved the lavender chocolate for my pillow, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, atmosphere and service”
Reviews.Author: FlyingDutchman049
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Monaco six nights when we were over for the Chicago Marathon this year. The location close the Chicago River is excellent and very central. With River View rooms you have a proper view including Trump Towers and Marine City on the opposite side of the river. The atmosphere of the room and lounge is very comfortable. The gold fish (on request) and daily wine bar (5 to 6 in the lounge) help to make you feel at ease. The reception and concierge service is great. Very small gym though, but who cares when the park (and the marathon start) are that close.

Reviews.Title: “Ni ce hotel, good amenities, noisy L”
Reviews.Author: dcv2002
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Monaco from 10/9/08-10/13/08 for the Chicago Marathon. Hotel is in a convenient location to get to from airport (Midway). Take Orange Line from airport to State/Lake on Loop and you're a short walk from the Hotel. Hotel is right by the river. Arrived very early (10am) and was able to get room which was nice. Room had OK/poor view as we were on the 5th floor on the Wabash side of the hotel. Room was nice, not too big, not too small. Bathroom was nice size. Could see river from room and that weird 70s building on the other side of the river. Extras from hotel were few. No pool. Wine hours between 5-6pm (which we made only once). Free coffee from 6-9am which we used once. Staff was friendly and completed quickly all requests. Room rate came with $20/night credit so we used at the attached restaurant. Since we were on the Wabash side could here the screeching L from 5am-1am since the hotel is near the L part of the loop where there is a turn. You will notice it if you are on the Wabash side of the hotel. Got used to it however, and it never really interrupted sleep. Close to L, and CTA buses. However, if I visit Chicago again I probably would choose a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel - with some (minor) flaws...”
Reviews.Author: kaio1
Reviews.Content: The Monaco is a very nice and comfortable hotel in an excellent location. Rooms are spacious, comfortable and clean. The staff is not as "friendly" as some described, though - we found them rather "professionally friendly", some even a bit smug (the concierge and one tall front desk guy). We got a good deal and paid only 180$ per night. But if I had to pay 250-300$ (their regular rates) I would find it too expensive. On the other hand chicago is an expensive city, when it comes to hotels... *Important*: if you book the hotel, make sure to book a room to the street (on a high floor). We had a room to the back, where you have no street noise, but a constant "humming" sound from the ventilation system of the parking garage on the back alley -een on 12th floor and with closed windows. This can really get on your nerves, especially at night. First we thought the sound came from the air condition in our room - until we realized that it was turned off... And don't make long distance calls from the room! For a 2 minute call we paid more than 20$ - a shameless rip off. These 2 things cost the Monaco points. Nevertheless I would recommend the Monaco any time - if you can get the "right" room!

Reviews.Title: “Monaco worth the money, and then some”
Reviews.Author: junemonkey
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Chicago with my daughter for her 16th birthday, and we booked a riverview queen room. It was great, beautiful, and she was really blown away by the windowseat in the room where you can look out over the river. We were very close to the theater district and also right down the street from the architectural foundation boat trips (definitely don't miss that). The hotel staff was sweet and attentive, bringing us little treats, offering us assistance with finding things around town. On the second day, we were gone during "turndown service". We were very tired from all the walking, and the room was read for us, robes on the bed, meditative music and ocean video on the TV. Very soothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KRH81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco for the Chicago Marathon and found it to be convenient, comfortable, and very accommodating. Our first room was on the 2nd floor and fine, though a little too close to the street noise. So, on the second night, they happily moved us to the 12th floor, which had a great big room with little noise. They also extended our checkout time for an hour free of charge. It is conveniently located to sights and the staff was very friendly. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Monaco-Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LTN22
Reviews.Content: We recently hosted our daughter's wedding at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago. It was a wonderful experience on every level, thanks to the superior service and attention that we received from the hotel staff and Mitchell Ray, the event manager. We cannot say enough about the hotel and Mitchell's amazing service. Every detail was checked carefully and the wedding was an amazing event that was perfectly executed. The small European hotel was a perfect venue for an intimate evening. Our guests have not stopped raving about the perfectly prepared and absolutely delicious meal and wedding cake. About 40 out of town guests stayed at the hotel for the weekend. They were very impressed by the hotel personel and every request was handled with pride and care. A private dining room at The South Water Kitchen was a cozy and convenient site for an informal dinner on the Thursday night as out of town guests began arriving. The Emerald Loop Pub across the street provided a great spot for late night drinks and treats. The hotel's convenient location made touring the city fun and easy for out of town guests. The hotel was a wonderful and intimate experience in the heart of Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sruffs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. We got a good rate through hotwire. As it was my first time using hotwire I was unsure what sort of room we would get. I needn't have worried as we were given a really nice room. We got to the hotel early and our room wasn't ready. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful and locked our suitcases away and said they would phone us when the room was ready. The room was a really good size, very comfortable, really clean and very quiet. The hotel put on a free wine reception in the evenings and after a busy day sight seeing this was very well received. We also liked the downtown location of the hotel. The down side of this (and the only reason for not giving it 5 stars) was the expensive parking at $40 per day. Overall we really liked this hotel and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: wallyworld2007
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with the Hotel with kudos to the staff. It is the best value and it is close to the Oriental Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: usatraveller10
Reviews.Content: I choose this hotel for our 7 night stay in Chicago after reading the many great reviews about it on Trip Advisor. The hotel certainly lived up to all of the reviews and my expectations. I had asked for a quiet room on a high floor and this is what we were allocated, I had also requested a goldfish for our stay and there he was waiting for us in our King Room upon check in. The hotel is in a great location within easy walking distance of many attractions and great shopping, there are also numerous restaurants in the area. The staff at the Hotel Monaco could not have been better they are very courteous and attentive and helped out with every request or question asked. I would definately return to the Hotel Monaco if I am fortunate enough to visit Chicago again and would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the loop”
Reviews.Author: TopDMC
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel, I am not sure how many rooms there are, but considerably less than some of those vast hotels in the centre of Chicago. I would stay again but read below so as not to get caught out. The location is fantastic being just a couple of hundred yards from the "magnificent mile" (main shopping street of the city) and a very short walk to the cta underground station. It is my first stay in a Kimpton Hotel and certainly won't be the last if they are all the same quality. What I particularly liked is the free internet (I travel on business a lot), that in itself often adds $30.00 a day to my bill and I also loved the idea of free wine between 5pm and 6pm (anyone who knows me will vouch that wine would add many more $$$ to my bill! The wines offered were quality as opposed to cheap plonk. They also offer free coffee in the morning between 6 and 9 - it would have been nice if they also added a biscuit or two, but can't have everything. My only concern and the reason to only give 4 stars instead of 5, you should be aware that because the hotel is really close to the cta at the "loop", the noise from the trains is considerable, they are frequent and they start at around 5:30 every morning! Easily overcome I am sure if you ask for a room that gives onto the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ADeckerCampbell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 3 nights and really enjoyed our time. The room and hotel overall was very cute. I loved the striped walls in the bedroom and the big sun like mirror. I enjoyed our pet goldfish too! The staff was very friendly. We were able to get tickets through the concierge for Cubs tickets the night before! The man at the front desk who likes white chocolate(the staff had fun name tags)recommended a good pizza joint for dinner our last night in town. The hotel was in a great location just around the corner from Michigan Avenue. The best thing is the hotel is small not like the big chain hotels. It definitely felt very intimate!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bubzilla
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor ratings, we chose to stay here on a recent trip to Chicago. Our room was awesome with plenty of space, clean and quiet. The staff was very helpful and eager to please. The location was also very convenient only two blocks from the Red Line station for our ride to and from Wrigley Field. We highly recommend the Hotel Monaco and would not hesitate staying there again the next time we're in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable! Highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: Roxii
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this is THE place to stay by far in Chicago! From the staff to the room to the valet to everything!! The beds were VERY comfortable, I wanted to sleep all day in that bed! The goldfish they brought up was a very nice touch and was super cute. You have to ask them ahead of time that you would like one. I brought my cat to the hotel, and they had rooms with LARGE pillows, right by both windows in my room for my cat (or your dog) to sit and look outside. My cat, who is usually terrified of staying in hotels, felt so comfortable and fell in love with the hotel too! She actually felt like it was home instead of hiding out all day and night! The turndown service was fabulous. We requested to have them clean while we were there (in the case my cat got scared) and they came fairly quickly. She did a great job though of cleaning up. Bed sheets were clean and bright white, they even had animal print robes for you to wear! The shower amenities I absolutely LOVED! The concierge was great! Gave us some fun things to do and maps so we wouldn't get lost. LOCATION: I MUST say that this is a GREAT location. I read some reviews before booking about how you have to cross the bridge to get to magnificent mile, but honestly, it's like a 5 minute walk and you are right at the beginning of the street! I would never stay closer than where this hotel is located. It's not too busy where you hear fire trucks and loud noises on the street from teenagers coming home from going out, yet it's COMPLETELY safe. Lots of people walking during the day, and even night (as we did some walking at night from a long day of shopping!) Oh, and if you haven't done this already, while you are in Chicago, you MUST go to Bobby's Bike Hike! Amazing time, cheap and such a GREAT tour of the city! You can rent the bikes on your own, but the tour is so worth it, and our tour guide was just so funny and entertaining! If you're there in the summer months though, i'd recommend doing a morning bike ride so your beat the heat! All i can say about this hotel is you MUST try it. It's not the cheapest, but it's well worth your money. You can't go wrong with this hotel. PURE luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel..Great Location....A real Gem!”
Reviews.Author: RhonaDublin
Reviews.Content: We absolutly loved this hotel. We arrived early in the morning and the concierge brought our luggage to our room that was already available even though was before check in time. Room was lovely, 2 large double beds and big bay window with window seats for you to relax while looking out over the river. We even got our goldfish delievered which was an added treat! Right outside and across a small bridge and your on the magnificant mile....with the bus tour of chicago starting right there, so everything is within walking distance! Overall a lovely hotel and a lovely city! would definetly recomment to a friend and if im back in chiacgo will defo go to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan2
Reviews.Content: The hotel Monaco is a great hotel, located in the heat of the Chicago by the River and in the Loop, it is within easy distance of all the major attractions in Chicago: the Sears Tower, The Hancock Tower, Water Tower Place, the Lake Front, Navy Pier, Millenium Park, and also the theatres (went to see Jersey Boys at the Bank of America Theatre would recommend if you can get tickets). We stayed for three nights at the end of a 10 day Holiday before flying back the the UK from O'hare. We had been sent the option 4 weeks before of being put on a waiting list for an upgrade and thankfully it was available. We upgraded upon arrival to a Mediterranean Suite which was a large room split in two with a large bedroom containg a queen size bed and a small lounge area with a roll out bed. The room had numerous special features like a jacuzzi in the bathroom as well as a shower which was well used during the stay. A window seat favoured by everyone. Hours spent staring down to the river and the streets below. We were lucky enough to be given a room with a view of the river and onto Washbee Street oppisote. There is no shortage of eating options at the hotel or in the surrounding area. We ate at the hotels restaurant "South Water Kitchen" one night the food is good quality prepared infront of you at a large open kitchen which was a nice touch. Within the area around the hotel is a seven eleven (across the street), a corner bakery where we had breakfast most mornings, countless Starbucks a Subway and numerous restaurants, we werent short of options. The hotel offers Starbucks coffee and tea in the morning to help yourself between 6am and 9am cookies at 3pm and a wine tasting in the evening before you go out for an evening meal 5pm-7pm. The Hotel Monaco is a fantastic Hotel and Cannot be Faulted on anything. On a next visit to the Windy City we will be staying at the Hotel Monaco. And yes we did have a Goldfish! We requested ours before we went emailing the hotel who added it to the reservation. He was waiting for us in our room when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: mclps
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is a gem. The hotel is a boutique hotel located in the River North section of Chicago. The rooms are very spacious and the hotel accomodating. The concierge, Ryan, was extremely helpful in recommending activities, entertainment and restaurants. By just asking us a few questions, he was able to choose the perfect restaurant or spot to visit. The hotel is very near to many local attractions, such as Millenium Park, The River Walk, Magnificent Mile, The John Hancock Center, The El, etc......We were able to walk everywhere! Each evening, in the hotel lobby, a wine and cheese social took place, with a different wine each day. It was a lot of fun and the staff is extremely friendly. Although we only ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant, it was very good. What was great about them is that they accomodated my special requests, with items that did not appear on the menu. Chicago in July is a joy and the Hotel Monaco is a must when I return to the windy city!:)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: njp313
Reviews.Content: First time visit to this hotel property! It was a great experience and fabulous view overlooking the Chicago river! Near enough to walk to Nordstroms and other great stores on the magnificent mile. Staff was very friendly! Room was spotless and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast in the hotel dining room was good! I would recommend this hotel to anyone! Also close enough to some great restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “Monaco is tops!”
Reviews.Author: willSA
Reviews.Content: We (my wife, myself and our teenage son) stayed at The Hotel Monaco for four nights in mid-August. This was our third Kimpton Hotel experience, and although they have all been great and offer that Kimpton charm, the Monaco was exceptional. First, the location--on the river on Wabash near Wacker and a block from Michigan Ave and the "L" and two blocks from the subway--could not have been better. Second, the facilities were outstanding--charming decor both in the lobby area and the room, modern flatscreen TV, wi-fi throughout the hotel and in the room, expansive bathroom, charming window seats and excellent beds. The river view rooms also afforded an excellent view of Wacker Avenue, the Chicago River, and the dazzling new Trump Hotel. The Monaco's staff was among the best I have experienced anywhere. Everyone was friendly and helpful, particularly Ryan and Rich (the concierges), the desk staff and the cleaning staff. Speaking of the latter, we never saw a cleaning cart or maids in the hall; they cleverly stay out of sight and seem to duck in and out of rooms without ever being spotted. And the maids left notes and special treats for us on a daily basis. The hotel's reataurant--while a bit expensive--was also excellent. The decor is classic Chicago, and the breakfasts and dinner--both food and service-- were top notch. And we loved having the goldfish with us during our stay! A final note: as a Kimpton-in-Touch member, I felt we received even better service. This included a strong effort to accommodate us in the best room available, along with a welcome letter and small welcome gifts awaiting us in the room. All in all, this was a fantastic hotel experience. I could not recommend a hotel more strongly that The Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel called Monaco”
Reviews.Author: HappiestCampers
Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Monaco... from its funky interior design to the added bonus of having your own pet fish during our stay... Hotel Monaco was a fantastic choice. With an excellent location, friendly and attentive staff we really enjoyed our time in Chicago. Parking is a little steep at $40.00 per night - but so is parking in any major city. Ooh and nice soaps and lotions in the bathroom but the bath bombs are for sale $7.00 each

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful serice and character”
Reviews.Author: Zann11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top quality. My room was very well appointed with an extremely comfortable bed, big flat screen LCD tv, marble countertops in the bathroom, plenty of storage, a nice desk, and comforable corner chair and ottoman. I also loved the window seat! The professional staff provided excellent service and were helpful at every turn. The location was the best. So many amazing parks, restaurants and shopping within easy walking distance. I would definitely stay here again, in fact, I fear I'd be disappointed staying anywhere else in Chicago. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: BladeRnr
Reviews.Content: What a great property and stay: - the location is great for tourists: 1 block from the north branch of the river and it's riverwalk; 1 block from the 'L and a half block farther to the subway, but not on a transit route itself (quieter); 5 minute walk to Millennium Park (and the least expensive long-term parking in the area); three blocks from the major live theatres; close to everything or to how to get to everything. - without fail, we were greeted at the door and front desk coming and going. - clean, comfortable, functional throughout; our room was spacious and the bath and shower were excellent. Although we didn't confirm that we'd been given it, we'd requested the "Tall" room that some Kimpton properties offer: since we ended up on the Business floor (but well separated from the meeting rooms) which often have higher ceilings, the shower head was 6 inches over my 6'2" scalp, and the complimentary robe *actually* fit me (they almost never do) I'd guess that that's where they put us - loved it. - very nice restaurant/bar on the premises with free continental breakfast (coffee/tea/juice!, toast and large fresh fruit plate for each person) - free Starbucks coffee (6-9am) and wine (5-6pm) in the lobby daily - they are pet-friendly (and have a photo album of their previous 4-legged guests) - all the city's attractions were within walking distance - either directly or via the extensive and efficient transit system; get a CTA visitor pass for unlimited L/subway/bus usage, it's not worth driving to most places. In contrast to previous reviews, the only noises we heard were the occasional siren (we were downtown so this is to be expected) and the occasional faint screech from the 'L cars on the turn at the end of the block - the A/C was like central air at home, but quieter. We'd recommend this property to anyone - especially tourists - who are traveling to or thru Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Not the 2nd best hotel in chicago!”
Reviews.Author: AuroraMom
Reviews.Content: While this is a decent hotel, it was not in our experience one of the best Chicago has to offer. We arrived at 2:00 on a Friday, with check in being at 3:00. No rooms were available, and were told to come back at 3:00. Came back at 3:00, still no rooms? My husband was in his work clothes, after a meeting. It was a hot day, and he just wanted to shower and change. We were told they would call us in a few minutes with a room. By 4:00 still no call, so we called. Amazingly a room became available, but probably the worst in the hotel. Right next to the fitness center, and across from the elevator. Obviously we ticked someone off by actually expecting check in at check in time. Usually this is never a problem with us, just one of those days my husband really needed a room. The room had no view, was rather small with a small bathroom. Nothing spectacular. We did call to complain, forget it, no rooms until tomorrow. We were only staying two nights, and really did not feel like packing everything up after staying one night. Who knows when we would have gotten the room anyway, After we had already gone to sleep? Perhaps we were treated this way, because we got a great rate through a travelzoo promotion. I don't know. But we are Klimpton in touch members. We stayed at the Nine Zero Klimpton hotel in Boston with a travelzoo rate and were treated wonderfully, by the way. The Monaco could learn something from this sister hotel. We did enjoy the hotel restaurant, South Water Kitchen. Service was good and food, tasty and fairly priced we thought. There is also construction right in front of the entrance to the hotel/restaurant, which is a bit of a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small boutique hotel: Stayed in their suite!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley24
Reviews.Content: Our family (two daughters 13 and 10) just returned from a stay at the Hotel Monaco for one night (also stayed at the Park Hyatt~ wrote a review for that hotel as well). The Hotel Monaco does a nice job making you feel welcome but it is no Park Hyatt as far as the greeting goes. What I mean is that the PH has at least 6 people meeting you between the car and the front desk. At the HM there is a person to help you with your luggage (dressed a bit casual, I thought) and the person at the front desk. The front desk was very pleaant and informed us that our room was not ready but would call when it was, which she did. We had the hotel hold our luggage while we went to see Wicked (loved it!). When we returned our room was ready and we were given a key. Unlike the Park Hyatt, we were not taken with our luggage up to the room. Instead we were pointed to the elevator and the luggage came up a few minutes later. We splurged and stayed in the Karen Newburger (sp?) suite. Since I was not able to find any info on this suite, I will try to elaborate as much as possible. The door is special with curtains pulled back along the side and the door itself is padded. Nice touch! You feel special just arriving! Inside the door is a small hallway with a closet containing the robes (safari prints), even ones for the children, Karen N. pjs and socks that you can buy, ironing board and iron, blankets, etc. The blanket was extremely soft~ My dd13 loved to wrap it around herself while lounging in the window seat! Next is the dining/living room. There is a small round table with two chairs, a couch that makes into a queen size bed (not too comfy according to dds), a cupboard with games and misc. in it with a fountain hanging above it. They make a big deal of this fountain on the website but it's just ok. This room also has a LG flat screen tv on the wall and a big window seat with lots of pillows. Each window seat (I think there are four total) has a very comfortable cushion to sit on...So comfortable I could easily sleep on it! The window seats are very deep with a ton of pillows. Our family loved to people watch from these, especially the construction of the Trump Tower just across the street. We also enjoyed watching the boats on the river. The next room contains the king size bed which was very comfy with a pillowtop on the mattress. There is a bench at the foot of the bed, a tv in an armoir which also holds the honor bar, a large, very tall chair with a small table next to it where we put our 2 goldfish, and 3 more window seats. Lastly is the bathroom with a very large deep tub with a built in sitting area like in a juccuzi. It has jet sprays too. The sink is adequate with a rolling cart underneath with a blowdryer, wash clothes, and fizzing bath balls (I tried one and it was just ok, I think it cost $6). The shower stall is very small with no room for the shampoo, conditioner, and soap. The shower is stuffed into the corner like they used up too much room for the tub and the shower was an afterthought. The toilet is in the same room as the shower and tub. There was only one garbage can in the whole suite, the one in the bathroom. The towels are very soft! We had room service which was timely and very courteous. The bellstaff was friendly, helping with restaurant suggestions. On our departure, the bellhop was also efficient and friendly. We didn't partake in the evening wine festivities so can't discuss that. Overall, my family enjoyed the hotel and would recommend it. Especially if you are planning on doing activities close by. We were able to walk to the following places: Millenium Park, Art Museum, Oriental Theater, Chicago Architectural Boat Tour (go early if you plan on doing the 10:00 ride). If/When we return, we will probably try the Rock Star suite as it seems like it would be more fun. The Karen N. suite is great for a romantic visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cliff_rock
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night after an evening on the town. Room was quite large with a King bed, small desk, nice side chair and table. Visually pleasing design. Large flat screen TV was new. Bedding I found to be pretty average, and a little skimpy on the pillows. Bathroom was again very nicely sized. Tub and shower were pretty average. Nice towels and complimentary toiletries. Complimentary wine service in the evening was a nice touch. Did not use the gym, but it was pretty small. Looked like about 6 total machines (treads, elliptical, bike). Equipment looked pretty new but it's a tight space. Great service from the valet. Parking was $40/night w/ in-out privilege. Front desk staff was good. First rep gave me a room on 2 next to the gym. I was concerned about noise, and they were able to move us to another room far from elevators, etc. No drama, very professional. I would stay here again w/o hesitation; however, I find I have a preference for a more classic presentation vs. the 'hipness' of this boutique hotel. Ask yourself: do you prefer a white bathrobe, or leopard print bathrobe? Hotel Monaco is all about the animal prints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Traveler9876
Reviews.Content: We had a great weekend at the Hotel Monaco, a mother-daughter getaway. We arrived Saturday morning by train and were able to check into our room at 10:00. We requested a coffee maker and goldfish at check-in. The coffee maker arrived within minutes, and the goldfish arrived in the afternoon. The window seat was absolutely fantastic. From the 7th floor we were able to watch the city below, including the river. If at all possible, get a window seat! Theaters and shopping are all convenient - easy and enjoyable walks. The staff always welcomed us and seemed to enjoy their jobs. The room was well-appointed and comfortable. The el (elevated train) turns a corner near the hotel, and is loudly squeaky outside, but it didn't bother us in our room. Great hotel, great weekend! We'll definitely be looking at Kimpton hotels in other cities in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Barbara2644
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! From the doorman who greeted us as we arrived, to the young man at the reservation desk to the young woman serving complimentarily wine, everyone was very friendly and helpful. We were "strangers but for a minute!" The room was extremely clean, well appointed and we had a pretty view of the Chicago River, especially enjoyed from the large window seats. Loved the purple polka-dot paper on the toilet paper roll! Hallways were large and quiet. The restaurant next door, South Water Kitchen is very nice too. The location is in walking distance of the theatres, parks, the river (take a cruise), Michigan Ave. It's ideal. The only negative is that the concierges were not nearly as friendly or inviting as the rest of the staff nor were they very helpful. For a self-sufficient traveler, you wouldn't really need their services (although it is nice) but for someone coming to Chicago for the first time, a concierge can be very helpful. I would definately stay at this hotel again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay - it's all in the details!”
Reviews.Author: Calliopea
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked a suite at the Monaco using travelzoo.com for a 4 day sisters weekend. We previously stayed at the Serrano in San Fran, and wanted to try another Kimpton Hotel since we loved the service. We were not disappointed. We registered as Kimpton points members, and received fantastic treatment! Early check in, welcome notes from the hotel management and staff, and smiles everywhere. We especially loved the hotel's complementary wine reception. It gave us a chance to unwind and share stories about our day with the other guests. I highly recommend spending $20 to have the fortune teller entertain you - her analysis on my handwriting was errially accurate! We booked the Mediterranian suite for $189/nt on travelzoo.com. The room was spacious, with a jacuzzi, twin flat screens, and LARGE window seats. The turndown service and chocolates were welcoming after the long day! The location of the hotel was very good. We stayed here to explore the city and found the location to be close to everything. In terms of food, there was a 7-11 across the street, and lots of local chains near by (Quiznos, Starbucks, Corner Bakery) as well as the upscale (Morton's, Smith and Wolensky's). We loved the authentic Chicago deep dish pizza from Giordano's, which delivers to the hotel! All and all we were most impressed by the standard of care provided by the Monaco. The housekeeper even left us a note with bottles of upscale water since she noticed we loved our bottled water. Because of their attention to detail and how welcomed they made us feel, we will definitely stay here or at another Kimpton hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific service!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal3Nashville
Reviews.Content: The personal service at this hotel was simply perfect. We had a noise issue with neighbors the first night and the staff moved us the next day while we were at a meeting. The staff recognized us by name and made efforts to meet our every need! The concierge got us tickets to Jersey Boys (sold out for months). In short, everyone went the extra mile. Rooms were clean, attractive, and well-appointed. We will be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Sitting Pretty with a View”
Reviews.Author: TheJeffries
Reviews.Content: Our family of four just returned from a 5 night stay at Hotel Monaco. This was our first visit to Chicago and as always, we used TripAdvisor to plan our vacation (thanks!!). We were not disappointed with the outcome! We took in all that Chicago AND Hotel Monaco had to offer. Hotel Monaco is conveniently located on the edge of the Loop and the Magnificent Mile -- it's a wonderful place to stay for those seeking luxury without snobbery. As a side note, we're from the suburbs of DC (Northern Virginia) and are accustomed to having private transportation. However, based on our research, we decided to "rough it" and not rent a car while in Chicago. We're so glad we didn't rent a car. The El is less than a block away from the hotel and bus stops are EVERYWHERE. On with the review of Hotel Monaco...the entire staff was friendly and extremely accommodating. Service is always important....we received extremely pleasant service from the doormen and front desk. It was especially kind of the hotel to allow our early check in AND late check out. Sometimes those traveling with children may feel as if they're treated inferior to other guests...but we were always treated with kindness and respect at Hotel Monaco. The room itself was spacious, whimsical and clean. We had a fabulous view of the Chicago River and Trump Tower. The major highlights included: *Great hotel rate! *THE WINDOW SEAT!! My husband is definitely a manly-man and I never expected him to be overwhelmed by a window seat...but this was his favorite hangout spot *welcome notes and present from management (don't want to give away the surprise) *stuffed fish, activity backpacks and ice cream gift certificate for our 2 children *comfortable beds with pillow options (we chose down pillows) *actual pet-away-from-home (goldfish) *L'occitane products *turn-down service with chocolates *complimentary wine reception each evening at 5 *complimentary fresh baked cookies at 3 *familiar/friendly faces among the staff *complimentary Starbucks each morning until 9 (I think Hotel Monaco should consider offering coffee all day every day) *close proximity to everything Extremely Minor Complaints: 1. The concierge gave us wrong directions for the bus (circled the route on our map), but that wasn't too big of a deal as we would've gotten lost on our own anyway. From what we could tell the concierge was well respected by the other guests. 2. Housekeeping was adequate but we had to request extra towels our first 2 nights as there were 4 members of our party (they only provided 3 towel sets). Whereas housekeeping was prompt to respond to our request (to leave extra towels, more soap, clean our tub, etc), we would've preferred a more proactive approach. Hotel Monaco is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: anm123
Reviews.Content: A group of girlfriends flew into Chicago to celebrate our 40th birthdays and we stayed at the Hotel Monaco. The location was perfect! The room was a great size with 2 large window seats overlooking the river. The beds were comfortable and even though we were right across from the elevator, we did not hear noise from the hallway. Service was prompt and friendly - a call to housekeeping to bring some extra towels to the room resulted in someone at the door in 2 minutes. The free cofee in the lobby and the wine at night was a really nice touch. It was fun to come back to the hotel at the end of the day to get ready for dinner and have a drink in the lobby before heading up to the room. There is construction going on outside the hotel so there is a lot of scafolding & blocked sidewalks, but noise was never an issue. Ask for a goldfish, it definitely adds a bit of whimsy to your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: DCgirl99
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco was wonderful. We had a Mediterranean Suite, which featured an enormous living room with pull out couch, desk, chair and flat screen TV and an enormous bedroom with king bed, chair, sitting area and another flat screen television. The bathroom was spacious with a very deep 2-person whirlpool tub and free-standing shower (the shower could be a touch bigger, though, it's tough to shave in there!). My favorite part about the room was the window seats - these were at least 3' deep with lovely cushions and was a great place to perch and watch the river or read a book. Complimentary wireless internet was great. Housekeeping was really friendly - as was all of the hotel's staff. We got the suite at 50% off because of a Travelzoo sale, and I can't believe our luck. We were so spoiled - it really raised the bar for our hotel standards! It was convenient to the El train (which you can hear a bit, but it doesn't bother you) - just a block away. The river is also right there, and a handful of blocks from Millenium Park - just a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Night in a Fun Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stina76
Reviews.Content: A group of girls and I were celebrating a friend's bachelorette party and stayed at the Hotel Monaco for one evening. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. I thought it was neat, each person who works in the hotel puts their favorite food underneath their name on their nametag! Funny! I was wondering why the man who checked me in had Mac N Cheese under his name! We had 4 girls in a room and we all slept very comfortably. The beds were great! I thought it was decorated very nicely and very clean. We had cocktails in the bar while we were waiting to go out and we found the bartender also very friendly. The food from the restaurant smelled wonderful! The location is great, although we are all from Chicago so we weren't really going to the sites. They have a fish in a fishbowl in all of the rooms, which is interesting. So glad that the fish survived with us rowdy girls coming back at 2 a.m.!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: junechild
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in perfect location, 2min work to train station, less than 5min work to the river for boat tour. The room we stayed in was simple but very clean with nice decoration and had a huge tv & comfortable bed. Why you pay more for hotels close by when you can get everything you need at hotel monaco and it's cheaper!! the restaurant down stairs had excellent food, too. We travel all over the world, and we're picky. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco in Chicago: What a find!”
Reviews.Author: EricDunstan
Reviews.Content: I stay at Kimpton Hotels when I can because they continually deliver a great experience for business and personal travel. The Monaco in downtown Chicago (on Wabash) continues to live up to my expectations for a Kimpton. The hotel is centrally located for business trips or site seeing. The front desk staff is helpful and can provide direction on how to get to point B. They are also responsive to requests to make the stay more enjoyable. There is also free wireless access here...which is nice when one is traveling on the personal budget...I HATE paying $20 to access the web from a hotel...which is not the case here! Check out my blog for further detail about the hotel and site seeing recommendations... http://travelswithsunnyd.blogspot.com/2007/09/erics-trip-to-chicago.html The Monaco Rocks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, quick thinking---what service!”
Reviews.Author: cheilaugh
Reviews.Content: We booked ourselves an anniversary weekend at the Kimpton Hotel Burnham, but for some reason the room wasn't ready at 11pm when we arrived, so they quickly sent us to their sister hotel, the Monaco, for the night into a "sweet suite", cab fare included and they picked up the tab for the night. Fantastic service, friendly and accommodating. We loved the room, the view and the beautiful, funky furnishings. It was a pleasure...then back to the Hotel Burnham in the morning for another excellent stay in a beautiful room with wonderful service from bed turn-down to chocolates, soft music on the radio and bathrobes on the bed awaiting us after a long evening out sightseeing. The clean, appointed rooms were a nice plus for these weary travelers who usually stay in middle of the road places. Highly recommend the Kimpton chain...both the Burnham and Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Our romantic get away”
Reviews.Author: jennykr1
Reviews.Content: This is the fanciest hotel I've ever stayed at. After spending 6 months overseas, my then fiance met me in Chicago, and we had Christmas here. The room, bed, picture window with inset seat, bathroom were huge. All decor was new and lovely. Wide range of electronics and bathrobes and all the comforts of home. The valet parking wasn't great, as the dude was unhappy when he brought the wrong car and punched out a vent in our car, but the front desk reimbursed our mighty pricey parking fees for the stay. We were in heaven and the hotel was great. It was clean as well...I'm a bit OCD when it comes to cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “So Accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: JMNehrenz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco while we were visiting friends/celebrating our anniversary. They couldn't have been more accomodating. Since we were celebrating, they moved us to a room by the river for free. They also set the mood by putting sparkling grape juice on ice with champane glasses in our room, music was playing, and chocolates were on our pillows. It was such a nice gesture...The hotel staff was always saying "Happy Anniversary" to us, it made for a very special weekend. The hotel was clean and beautiful. The beds were comfy, the view was awesome-especially sitting on the window seat at night! It was quite a sight to overlook the city! The hotel restaurant was really good...I hear they have great mac and cheese, but we went for brunch. We forgot our toothbrush and toothpaste-it wasn't 5 mins before someone was at our door with a substitue. Awesome service, awesome service, awesome service. We have stayed at Ritz Carleton's in the past and Hotel Monaco's service is very comparable. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It ....great for kids too”
Reviews.Author: HouTraveler10714
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from a wonderful stay at the Hotel Monaco. We had our two kids (17 months and 5 yrs) with us as well at a set of grandparents. We had a wonderful experience. Our adjoinning rooms were very spacious and clean. It is so important to have nice, clean rooms when traveling with kids and the rooms lived up to my expectations. The rooms were very large and the BEST part was the fact that they had huge window seats (my 6 ft plus husband could lay comfortably on them) looking down at the L and the Chicago River. My children took all their toys up there and were facinated by the comings and goings of the city. They could have spent hours up there. In fact, my 5 year old made a bed up and slept there. The grandparent's King room had one huge window w/seat and our room (2 queens) had two windows. Very light and bright. My children were also greeted with a Kimpton Kids goodie bag and goldfish in the room. Big hit! The hotel staff were great as well...very friendly and helpful with suggestions, cabs etc. The location was very convienient to downtown. The front door is actually off a less busy street. Although the room service and South Water Kitchen menus were not very kid friendly, the staff prepared special dishes for my children upon request. For example, they made up chicken tenders (not on the room service menu) for a late afternoon snack. They also created a custom made breakfast for them at the South Water Grill. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad; not great either.”
Reviews.Author: x2fr
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 3 nights. Here's my pros and cons: PROS: Pretty convenient location; very clean rooms, eclectic decor (if you like that style); nice beddings/linens, service is adequate, staff is polite. CONS: Small, dark rooms--small windows because building is old renovated space; small closets, bath tub/shower combo small, eclectic decor (if you DON't like being surrounded by funky stuff); small lobby, pricey restaurant. Bottom line is...given the level of quality in terms of service, amenities, and location, this should be a 3-4 star hotel, and it wouldn't be worth paying more than $200 a night for it, above that and you'd find something better around the same area of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: J214
Reviews.Content: We booked one night at Hotel Monaco Chicago - and a large snowstorm threatened our travel, so we decided to stay another night. What a time! The staff was friendly, helpful and genuine. The room was funky and cozy. Great decor! We loved the window seats where we watched people and traffic hustling by. Free Wifi was a plus. Location was exceptional for the variety of touristy things that we wanted to visit. We really liked the goldfish we requested. Maybe a little silly, but it was fun to have a pet to "come home" to. We loved the wine hour and the Starbuck's coffee in the morning. The snowstorm made for a chilly touring day, and it was nice to come back to a warm, cozy room. We will stay here again and highly recommend you give Hotel Monaco a try!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything here!”
Reviews.Author: RJDLondon
Reviews.Content: Everything about Hotel Monaco was excellent. Friendly check-in, gorgeous furnishings in lobby and corridors, and a large, delightful room - we likened it to Ralph Lauren does French Provincial. Loved it! The Concierge was very helpful, all staff were full of smiles and hellos, its in a great location right near trains and shopping, and the restaurant was lovely and not too pricey. Would absolutely stay again, and would recommend to anyone going to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Monaco Chicago”
Reviews.Author: isa2win
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco's staff was friendly and accommodating. The decor is attractive and lively. The interior is well maintained and the room was quiet and very clean. The bed was absolutely the most comfortable I've experienced in a hotel. Wine hour in the lobby was an added treat. Our stay was flawless and we look forward to visiting again. A great location in downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and (Relatively) Affordable River North Option”
Reviews.Author: mqt1984
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my first stay at the Hotel Monaco and I loved it! Great location just minutes from the Magnificent Mile, restaurants, shopping, bars and more. Check-in was fast and efficient. Front desk reminded us about the nightly wine reception and the free Starbucks coffee in the morning (both of which we didn't take part in) . As a member of the loyalty program, they knew my floor preferences and more. Room was great (river view, queen queen room). Loved the window seats, spacious bathroom, comfortable beds and TV. A few minutes after arriving, hotel staff brought up a chocolate bar, water and two welcome notes which included 15% off at the hotel restaurant. Very welcoming environment! We did end up checking out the restaurant in the morning and their Sunday brunch was great. Even their room service rates were really quite affordable. Overall, I'd definitely recommend a stay and I know that I'll be back the next time I want to catch a show at the House of Blues.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and Inviting”
Reviews.Author: ss12374
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights during a trip to Chicago with my sister. The room was gorgeous in an unconventional way--Green and beige striped walls, Red-trimmed mirror, and numerous color-coordinated pillows. The beds were comfy and the large window seats were fabulous for city-gazing. The best (and worst) thing that was unique to this hotel was the goldfish companion the staff brought to our room upon arrival. I was actually very excited to receive my pet. My sister and I named him Chewy and said goodnight to him before going to sleep. Sadly, the next morning Chewy was floating lifelessly at the top of the fish bowl. Not a pleasant way to start out the day! These things happen I suppose, but I hope the hotel does have some system of trying to prevent it from happening, such as keeping track of how old the fish are and which ones are likely to die soon. Our goldfish was replaced by the time we retuned to the hotel for the night. Chewy II survived for the rest of our stay, thankfully. Since we did not know about the turn down serivice, we were delighted to come back to our room the first night and find it comfy and waiting for us with Lindt chocolate on our beds. But, they did forget to turn down one of two beds in the room on the 3rd night. All in all, I enjoyed my stay very much and would recommend this hotel. The location was great too.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BearsFanChicago
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay at the Monaco after receiving a fantastic $159/night rate from Kimpton. Like many of the Kimpton hotels I've stayed at, the Monaco delivers what it promises: it is a cool little hotel in a great area that provides a fun experience for its guests. Advantages to the Monaco include its perfect location, its attention to detail, the food in the South Water Kitchen (located in the hotel), and the daily evening wine reception for guests. Disadvantages include parking ($38/night) so taking the train is a great option, and the tiny fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little hideaway”
Reviews.Author: travellytimes
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Hotel Monaco when we decided to stay extra days in Chicago following a conference. We chose the Hotel Monaco due to the high quality of our previous stays this year in Kimpton Hotels in Portland, OR and Seattle. The Hotel Monaco Chicago did not disappoint. Quiet, clean, hip, centrally located, prompt room service, free wi-fi with strong in-room connectivity (we both travel with a laptop and always appreciate the free access). I plan to continue choosing Kimpton Hotels when spending my own travel dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: opie60
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay! Room was beautiful and very comfortable, staff was friendly and accommodating, restaurant was excellent, and the wine happy hour was a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Always perfect...”
Reviews.Author: giallebaby
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time that I have stayed here and I loved it yet again! I'm a Kimpton Intouch member and all of my specifications were met with this past trip. The hotel goes out of their way to make you feel special and everything went smoothly. We stayed in a Mediterrean (sp?) suite and if you have the money to splurge, do so! The window seats are to die for! The bathtub was perfect for two and the goldfish was a perfect little touch. I love everything about this hotel and it is my favorite place to stay while I'm in the city. Though it is expensive, it's a must have splurge for anyone and everyone! I will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: Greataunt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a recent business trip. The staff was excellent from the front desk person to the concierge to the wait staff. As a Kimpton "In Touch" member, my preferences were on file and honored. The room was quite large by city standards and had a great little window seat overlooking Wabash. The workout room was very small but they did offer $10 passes to a nearby gym. I preferred the Monaco to their other property, The Burnham. The service was really superb!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique at its finest!”
Reviews.Author: KBURNSINBUFFALO
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Monaco twice in the last 3 years. The hotel is a classic boutique hotel. Cozy, well decorated, friendly staff, and a interesting unique style. The staff was very helpful and competent. The bed was very comfortable. The room was spacious and decorated with a cool contemporary style. The attached South Water Restaurant is excellent. Ate there for several meals and each meal was really good. Complimentary cocktails at 6pm, complimentary coffee in the morning. Complimentary homemade chocolate chip cookies each day. Very close proximity to everything including the Magnificent Mile. I have also stayed at one of the sister properties in Chicago, The Hotel Allegro. Equally as good. The 3rd property in Chicago is the Burnham which looks even nicer the the other 2. Joined their loyalty progam. I will look for Kimpton Hotels wherever I travel now.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for price - Very conveniently located to shopping/theatre”
Reviews.Author: PKFelix
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco 1 night and found the place to be very nice. The staff was nice and professional, the room was of a nice size, clean, and designed nicely. Lots of toiletries available at our fingertips. What I liked most was that we could walk to the Oriental Theatre and to some very good restaurants - we felt safe at all times as well. Really no complaints -- just a few minors ones: no coffeemaker in the room - although they sent one up immediately upon my request; insufficient lighting in the room we had -- one of the lighting fixtures had a light bulb out but I didn't take the time to call housekeeping to get it fixed. Otherwise, everything went well. I recommend this place to anyone and figure that kids will like it too since they can get a goldfish in their room during their stay (for free). We did not try this but I figure a kid or an adult with a thing for goldfish would really like this aspect of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your Credit Card Statement - Extra charges your not notified about”
Reviews.Author: GovTravWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and most of the staff was great. Billing was terrible, they charged the wrong rate for the room, I had to get it corrected and when I got home and received a credit card statement they charged for a day they said my reservation started. They never said anything about this charge while I was there nor was it on my bill when I checked out. Bad business practice, I've never stayed at a hotel that tried this trick.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, but #3 in Chicago? No Way!”
Reviews.Author: bunkylunk
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying I am a Kimpton In-Touch member and huge fan of their hotels having stayed at a significant number of their properties from coast to coast. The Hotel Monaco-Chicago is a fairly typical Kimpton which means to me...friendly staff, funky decor, offbeat amenites and a general "hip" vibe in a small boutique property. This location adds the positive of a excellent location right on the river, one block from Michigan Ave., which made walking to all downtown sights and shopping easy. My only complaint is this. At check-in, I was immediately recognized and welcomed as an In-Touch member and was told that a room with all of my preferences (high floor, quiet room) had been "blocked" for me. I appreciated the greeting and assumed that my allegiance to Kimpton would land me a choice room location. We headed up to our room on the 14th floor (top floor, so preference met!). Though, we had to search for the halls for the room awhile, it turned out to be down a small hall with only one other room located off of it (quiet room preference met!). The disappointment came upon opening the drapes to check out the window seat and views you have read about in other reviews for this property. To say I was shocked to find no window seat and a view of a solid brick wall from the building next door not twenty yards away is an understatement. Upon investigation, it appears there are only three rooms on each floor with no view and I was afforded the privilege of staying in one of those. Would it not have been better for the Front Desk Clerk to explain that in order to meet my In-Touch preferences, I would forfeit any view and give me a choice? Okay, I've vented and with that said, don't hesitate to book this hotel for business or pleasure. If you know and like Kimpton properties, you won't be disappointed. Just ask them what your room looks out on !

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jodmeister
Reviews.Content: My sister, neice and I stayed at this property over the weekend and were very pleased with the location, room and service. Within walking distance to great shopping on State Street. Corner Bakery for breakfast was a 5 minute walk - great place for simple breakfast - would have liked to try a diner but nothing within walking distance. The rooms were clean, well equipped. Great high ceilings and the window seats rock! The goldfish is a nifty gimmick...the hotel assures you that they are well looked after - I hope so! The Starbucks coffee bar is handy in the mornings - unfortunately we didn't have time to take advantage of the complimentary wine in the evenings. Concierge staff were very informative and helpful. Only downside from the hotel perspective is that they were not aware or not advising departing guests that the subway line to the airport was closed on weekends - even though we ordered a taxi with our luggage to depart to the blue line to O'Hare so that was an unexpected extra cost. All in all, would definitely return to the Monaco!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NanNanDaphne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco for 5 days in October, 2007. I cannot begain to tell you how great this place is. The service was impecable and the room was fantastic. Huge window seat to look over Chicago. It was great. The wine reception in the evening was a special treat as was the morning coffee service in the lobby. This was our first trip to Chicago and I hope not our last. I will definately stay at Hotel Monaco again when we return. We booked our room through a safety convention web site.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely suite - wish I had more time to party like a rockstar”
Reviews.Author: ams54
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights at the Hotel Monaco for business travel, and wish I could have stayed longer for pleasure! By a stroke of luck, I was given the hotel's themed "Party Like a Rockstar" suite (605), complete with a jukebox and electric guitar. As I was there for work, I would have appreciated a desk and more outlets, but did get a kick out of the decor and amenities. My only other minus was the valet parking - $37 is a bit steep. South Water Kitchen makes a great egg white omelet. Staff were super friendly and helpful. There was roadwork being done during my stay and the back-up beeping sound from the trucks lasted far into the night (like past midnight), which, while annoying, was not the hotelâ€™s fault.

Reviews.Title: “Uneven service”
Reviews.Author: TravelDick
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is in a great location, rooms are large, decor is sophisticated and it has a lot of boutique hotel touches, e.g., wine reception in late afternoon. But the service is as uneven as a cobblestone street. One example: I wandered down to the lobby on a Saturday morning at 9:15 a.m. looking for coffee. The desk clerk told me that coffee service ended at 9 a.m. but she would see if there was anything in the kitchen. While I waited, another guest came by looking for coffee. This time another desk clerk brusquely told him "coffee service ends at 9 a.m. You can buy a cup in the restaurant." Same hotel, same day, different definitions of hospitality. The day before when I checked in at 10 a.m., the desk clerk told me "check in is at 3 p.m. You're room's not ready." Asked when it might be ready, she said "At 3 p.m." I asked if I could leave my bags so they could be brought to my room when it was ready. "You can check your bags, but you'll have to retrieve them yourself," she said less than helpfully. I left my cell phone number and asked to be called when the room was ready, Guess what? No call. My bags? The bellman was out when I returned at 5 p.m. My bags didn't get there for another half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the center of a great city”
Reviews.Author: norcalmama
Reviews.Content: Spouse and I spent 5 days in Chicago in early October. Chose Hotel Monaco based on location and also an enjoyable stay at the sister property in Seattle last year. It was a good choice. For me the best things about the Chicago Monaco are its location and the excellent and friendly service. From here we were able to cover a lot of territory on foot (and wheelchair, in the case of my hubby). The staff were great starting with when we made our reservations - many hotels will not block a particular wheelchair accessible room, meaning you could arrive and find that you have a room that doesn't work for you. The staff at the Monaco blocked us a room that met our needs. We arrived tired and hot from the airport an hour an a half before check in time. Rather than giving us grief because we were early, the front desk crew immediately offered to hold our bags and then call on my cell phone once the room was ready. This little courtesy made us feel good about the place the minute we arrived. It was especially appreciated because it was the day of the Chicago Marathon and everything was hopping. We did not use the concierge so can't comment on that. But otherwise all staff were friendly and responsive, including when we asked for a chair to be removed from our room to give us more space. Someone arrived to do so almost immediately. We were a little disappointed in the restaurant, having been spoiled by the good one adjoining the Seattle Monaco. The South Water Kitchen is convenient to have next door, and is fine, but not quite up to the standard set by the hotel. The restaurant adjoining the Hotel Burnham, a nearby Kimpton property, is much better. Price was steep (with tax a 5 night stay in a not-very-big room totalled almost $2000) but since this was hubby's first trip to Chicago (and only my second) I thought the splurge was worth it to stay in a pleasant hotel in such a central touring location.

Reviews.Title: “Another great Kimpton hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NolaDoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco for five nights for an anniversary trip in early October. We stayed at a Kimpton hotel for our honeymoon three years ago and were hoping for similarly splendid service and accommodations at the Monaco. We were not disappointed. We were able to check in early (around 11am) and received our requested coffee maker within minutes of arriving in our room. The staff members were very friendly and helpful. On our first night, the concierge recommended a very good local Italian restaurant within an easy walking distance. Housekeeping services were prompt and thorough. The location was perfect for exploring the Magnificent Mile, going on several architecture tours, and going to the opera. The free wireless Internet was a nice bonus. We will definitely book the Monaco on subsequent trips to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, funky, upscale: Great access to public transport...Love it”
Reviews.Author: pyegirl
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at the Hotel Monaco, the first time for pleasure. Chose this for a weekend girlfriend getaway. The Hotel Monaco is an expensive hotel. We got a AAA discount and the bill for two nights, including taxes was about $600. It was fine for us because we were splitting the bill, but obviously it's not for those on a budget. The good things: cute, funky decor that is well kept-up---not a bit worn. I love the Hotel Monaco for their originality. They will give you a pet gold fish if you like, will accommodate your dog, and will even help you find a place for doggy day care if you need to be at work during the day! What else? Great location. It's easy to arrive on public transport from the airport (I took the train in from Midway airport and walked no more than one block). Once there you can walk to more touristy things or take the L. I really love the location. It's close to the art museum, the magnif mile, and the theatre. We took the L to the Second City theatre (the etc stage) and walked everywhere else. Our room had a view of the river and fantastic funky window seats with big pillows. So much fun for window gazing. Oh, and FREE WIRELESS. Loved it. We looked at other "cool" boutique hotels and found that the Hotel Monaco had the largest rooms (vs. The Burnham which has rooms about half the size--be sure to ask, they can tell you in square feet how big the room is) or the best location (vs. Hotel Indigo). All were in the same price range (ie, EXPENSIVE). The downside: The price. It's not cheap. If you are on business, go for it! You'll love it. If you are splitting the cost, it's a good splurge. The only other thing I'd warn about is the concierge service. We got a TERRIBLE recommendation for a restaurant...I mean this was one of the worst restaurants I've been to anywhere. This has happened twice while staying at the Monaco, so I am not sure what motivates their recommendations, or whether they just aren't that good at this. Too bad because Chicago has terrific restaurants. So, word to the wise for true foodies: do your own research on restaurants so that you are not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dublingirlabouttown
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location. Well done Kimpton!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: GrantParish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monaco for a business meeting in early September. The location is great - close to Michigan Ave and the theater district. It is a quirky, comfortable, small hotel - just the right antidote to some of the large impersonal chain hotels nearby. The bed was very comfortable and the room was large enough to accommodate a nice desk and lounge chair. It was hard to stay away from the window seats that looked down on the Chicago River. The bathroom was standard but nicely appointed with marble counter and L'Occitane toiletries. My only complaint was it did have the feel that everything in the room was for sale. The bath salts had a $7.00 price tag as did the warm fuzzy socks hanging with the bathrobe. I had to check the soap to make sure I was not being charged extra for it before getting in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: tsmith044
