Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay...convienient, staff especially helpful & the turn down service & music was a real treat to return to at night!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Kimpton Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 626calgal
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco was definitely up to Kimpton standards. It's beautiful decor, comfy beds, nice linen and bathrooms are all up to the standard you would expect. The location is great too - right near the corner of Michigan Ave and Wacker. You can walk to alot of sights from there.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: joschus
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 day stay at the Monaco and everything good you read here is true. The staff is always smiling and helpful. The room was quite large and everything worked. The location was perfect for things we wanted to see. You can take your pet with you. The South Water Kitchen is fantastic for all 3 meals - we tried it for all of them. One suggestion is that the hotel offer a better selection of snacks during the complimentary cocktail hour. They only offered a couple of glasses of olives and a few bread sticks for a rather large crowd in the lobby. Ask for a river view room!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Delightful”
Reviews.Author: AtlGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Chicago for a conference and decided to stay through the weekend. I checked into Hotel Monaco mid day Friday and had a wonderful time. I requested and received an early check in. I booked the Mediterranean Suite after reading so many great reviews regarding this room type. Well....I was not disappointed. My partner joined me a few hours after I arrived. The staff was very friendly all weekend. We received a complimentary bottle of champagne and box of chocolates early Friday evening. The conceirge also recommeded a great steak house for dinner. We loved the room. The soaking tub was huge and big enough for two. The window seats are amazing. Viewing the city late at night from this vantage point is great. We never saw housekeeping but our room was always clean. We left early Saturday morning for breakfast and returned to a clean room. Everything we requested from the staff we received promptly. We would definitley stay here again...and again...and again.

Reviews.Title: “A funky little gem just off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Meanwhile
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 2 young children, just spent several days at the Hotel Monaco. We were delighted by the staff (who were attentive and extremely polite and helpful), the room (which was spacious [we had the queen/queen room], bright and clean), the funky decor and the location. We had a lovely view of the Chicago River and the large window seats afforded the children a space of their own to watch the happenings below while staying out of the way - this helped us pass the time we spent in the room quite easily. The beds were very comfortable and the furnishings were in remarkably good shape. We also love the hotel's eco-friendly policies (and people who maybe aren't so eco-friendly will like the fact that these are not ever in-your-face). We have stayed at the Burnham Hotel as well, but find this property better suited for children. I can't stress enough how pleasant the hotel staff was. It was a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco a winner!”
Reviews.Author: muttger
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Monaco in early August for four hot and humid days. Luckily the Hotel Monaco was very comfortable and cool. The staff is extremely accomodating. We arrived just past the evening wine tasting hour and the desk staff went out of their way to make sure that we received two glasses. Our room was very comfortable and whimsically decorated. We stayed in a Mediterranean suite which was very spacious. Loved the window seats - we were on the 14th floor (top) and had a great time hanging out and relaxing there. As a family of four we felt that we had plenty of space. The beds were extremely comfortable, very firm and there was a great choice of pillows. There was very little interior noise - we were not too far away from the elevator but never heard it. The hotel was also quite busy (mostly apparent down in the lobby area) but we were never disturbed by noise from other guests. We could hear some squeal of the train, which was one block away but this always surprisingly didn't bother us. The restaurant, South Water Kitchen was very good, quick and efficient service and very reasonable prices. Location was good. To the north a couple of blocks - Miracle Mile, public transportation nearby. Millenium and Grant Park (Art Institute) all within walking distance. The workout room was very small but if you only want to use a treadmill or elliptical machine you will be okay no weight machines and a small selection of free weights. I would definitely recommend becoming a member of the Kimpton Intouch program - the extra attention and services were worth it. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for My 1st Chicago Experience”
Reviews.Author: love2travelky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Chicago for our 10th wedding anniversary. It was a perfect stay for my first trip to Chicago. The hotel sent complimentary champagne to our room for our anniversary. We loved the location and the staff at the hotel. Our conceierge, Sylvia, was fantastic. She gave us wonderful suggestions for transportation and for restaurants. Gibsons Steakhouse for dinner and Lou Mitchells for breakfast are a must. The rooms were great. The window seats really add something special to the rooms. When we returned to our room in the evenings, the bed would be turned down, there would be music playing and our robes would be laid out on the bed. It was a perfect ending to a perfect day. We loved the Hotel Monaco, we can't wait to go back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel”
Reviews.Author: fpk1005
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel with relaxing atmosphere. This hotel, in my opinion, has the feel of a 'bed and breakfast' but without the breakfast. The service was excellent as was the comfort of the rooms. This is a good alternative to a cold, impersonal hotel in the same price range. The location was also good. We walked to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Charming boutique hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: emindc
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Monaco is a fine hotel that could not be more conveniently located for the business or pleasure traveller. The hotel is close to the banks of the Chicago River, within walking distance of all Loop attractions and the Magnificent Mile north of the river. It is a medium sized hotel, much more personal and friendly than, say, the huge Hilton Chicago. The front desk staff were efficient and friendly. The room was not large but comfortable and very quiet and clean, with a lovely river view. The decor is much more lively than your typical business hotel. There were plenty of electrical outlets and an ethernet cable on the desk for your electronic devices. Coffee makers are available in the room upon the request, but coffee and tea are also available in the lobby at all times. A complimentary New York Times was waiting outside my door in the morning. There are lots of restaurants and shops within easy walking distance. Overall, Hotel Monaco is an excellent choice for downtown Chicago lodging. I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Too wonderful for words”
Reviews.Author: Babs45
Reviews.Content: We like Kimpton properties -- they are funky and friendly with great beds and good styling... oh sometimes there isn't much closet space, or the bathrooms are old, but they are always in THE best locations the city has to offer. The Hotel Monaco in Chicago couldn't have been more perfect for our stay. We had a Mediteranean Suite to accomodate 2 adults and two teens for 4 nights... the corner suite was right on the corner facing the Chicago River and we had 4 of the famous window seats that everyone raves about. My 12 year old was so taken by them that we cancelled his roll-away and he slept on one everynight.... two of them were the size of twin beds, and every afternoon we'd climb in one together and sit with cocktails/ cokes and watch the city go by! It was one of the things that make a trip truly special and I have no doubt the kids will every forget it. The location was terrific -- close to the Theatre District, the museum campus, the Art Institute and Milennium Park/Grant Park -- we walked to everything except the museum campus -- it was too hot to go that far. The valets and front desk staff were terrific and we fell in love with our evening housekeeper -- she was a doll. Our breakfasts in the hotel restaurant were delicious and fast. The bedding and amenities were top-notch. My older son even said the sofa bed in the living room wasn't too bad. The one bad bump was with a conceierge -- Richard -- who, we found out after a $30 tip, was absolutely wrong on everything he told us. He said we couldn't get tickets for "Wicked" without a broker and that they'd cost "$150 easy"-- we walked into the theatre a block away and got front row balcony tickets for that night at $80 each.... He said take a bus to the museum campus as it was much cheaper than a taxi -- Wrong -- we took a cab because of a rainstorm and found that it was faster, easier and $3 cheaper! His restaurant tips were to big chains not to smaller local places.... He kept pushing Navy Pier, which everyone told us to avoid at all costs.... The other two concierge we talked to seemd fine tho' and gave us great directions.. Bottom line -- stay at the Monaco. And take an architectural boat tour! We give the trip an A++++++++

Reviews.Title: “spacious, comfortable room and great location”
Reviews.Author: MGATL
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Monaco and would recommend it to anyone wanting to be near the downtown attractions. The room was not a standard-issue hotel room; rather, they used interesting interior design, with interesting fabrics and art. The ceiling was very high, which gave the large room a very spacious feel. The beds were very comfortable. The hotel is relatively small for downtown, and it had a comfortable lobby. Don't bother eating in the restaurant. At lunch our mussels were in an overly salty broth, the "medium" hamburger came well done, and the french fries were way too salty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bbsleek
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with unique/funky decor. Everything from the lobby to the room was clean. Staff was very welcoming and friendly. The complimentary cocktail hour from 5- 6 was also an added bonus to an already impressive hotel. Our room had a window seat right next to a huge window that overlooked the river. You can even request to have your own pet fish while there. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. We stayed over the 4th of July and encountered no problems in the city due to the holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room”
Reviews.Author: smiller376
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in at the Hotel Monaco was amazing. The view of Chicago was spectacular. They have everything you might need available for you. Front desk very helpful. We went for a quick weekend trip to see "Phantom of the Opera" It was wonderful. I cannot say enough about Chicago. You must see all the museums while you are there and walk along the lake. If you have time to head up North towards Wisconsin, I would go to Gurnee, IL to the Gurnee Mills Outlet Mall. Loads of fun.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel gets it right”
Reviews.Author: beachtraveler404
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Hotel Monaco was excellent. This hotel gets it right when it comes to customer service and thoughtfulness. I was on business and had a basic room with no window seat and no view, and still thought the room was great. The front desk staff, concierge, and bellmen were one of the best groups I've seen. I requested a Wall Street Journal and it was at my door when I woke up in the morning. The property was quiet and clean. The hotel is in a good location close to the river and was only a short cab ride from anywhere I needed to go. I had no problem getting a cab out front. The room was well decorated and had nice touches. The rooms are hip and fun, without being over the top - good selection in the mini bar, good L'Occitane toiletries, a CD to listen to on the CD player, a full size umbrella in every room, and a comfy bed. And there are many other amenities and services that I didn't get a chance to utilize - complimentary morning coffee, complimentary evening wine, complimentary shoeshine service, pet program, business center, fitness center, etc. This hotel has thought of everything and if there is something they missed, I am sure they would do their best to help you get it. The adjacent restaurant, South Water Kitchen, was good. Apparently they provide 24 hour room service for the hotel and that would be pretty darn good for room service. I usually like to try new places when I travel, but I'd definitely stay here next time. If it was booked, I'd look at the other Kimpton properties in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Funky but Fun”
Reviews.Author: TBLwatcher
Reviews.Content: A nice and resaonable place to stay. Staff was accompdating and helpful. Location suited us fine. We had a lovely time and I would stay here again. we were here for a conference and ran into [--]

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sunfltaho
Reviews.Content: The Monaco has several great things going for it, the first being the location. We had a room on the 14th Floor with a view of the river. There is a good restaurant/bar right downstairs and for other necessities like water, razors, etc.. there is a market right across the street. Walking distance to the train, Macy's, Millennium Park, etc...Free coffee in the morning and wine at night Complimentary robes. Nice Concierge and desk staff. Clean rooms. However, when we booked, we were offered a room with an iPod dock, which were only available on the 14th floor. When we arrived, there was no such thing in the room. We called downstairs and after talking to a couple people, it was determined that only the suites had docks, and even then it was only in one suite. So that was a bit confusing. The only other very minor: a small room with no mini-fridge. Overall, 8.5. Would defintely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinJen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago after a long weekend trip had to be rescheduled due to health concerns. We were delighted with the entire hotel experience! The lobby was beautiful and the staff friendly. Our room was the Meditterranean Suite and it was large, sunny, and stylish. There were large window seats where we could both sit on a comfortable mat with a pillow and look out at the city. The whirlpool tub was large and deep. The Monaco close to many things- shopping, eating, entertainment. We ate at the Frontera Grill and loved it as well. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there in the future when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, friendly staff, the decor is the nazz”
Reviews.Author: LearningCurv
Reviews.Content: Sometimes when you gain a little in luxury you also lose a lot in soul. We did not lose anything by staying at the Monaco. Having all options on the table, my wife and I chose the Monaco. We won a trip to Chicago (all expenses paid!) so we could have stayed at the most (supposedly) high end place in town. The view is among the best available in Chicago. You can see Marina city, the Wrigley's building and the Chicago River. You can walk a short distance to Millennium Park, Grant Park, the Art Institute of Chicago, some excellent restaurants, or to the Theater District or even quickly cross the river and do some shopping. The rooms were clean, quiet and always stocked with fresh towels. These are the things you need when traveling. A goldfish adds a bit of whimsy, but it's the attention to the fundamentals that is important in picking a hotel. Friendly service, comfortable beds, a centralized location and a good shower and towels are those fundamentals and Monaco delivered those to us perfectly. The decor is exotic and funky and the doormen are pimped out to lend a handful of street cred to the younger, hipper, more adventurous crowd this Hotel is marketed toward. Lots of patterns and materials. The staff did not put a tip envelope in our room for the maid service. The cleaning staff instead received a chocolate bar from the honor bar. No biggie. The concierge was very helpful, booking tickets for the Architectural boat tour along the Chicago River and providing one 1/2 off ticket for the Art Institute of Chicago. When we checked out they watched our bags. To put an image to it, if I were in the recording industry type and wanted a safe, clean place to stay while I was rockin Chicago, I'd pick this place for my girl to stay. If my parents were coming to town, maybe they'd like someplace else, but who knows. Dad might dig it. Our affluent cousins from the cape, well, they would probably prefer the Ritz. This time, we stayed at the Monaco and I felt comfortable there. The place has a real good soul.

Reviews.Title: “Monaco”
Reviews.Author: Sonicchamp
Reviews.Content: This was A great stay! I can recommend it to all travelers around the world. Nice rooms, large bathroom and a very soft bed:) Go there if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: plymouthtraveller1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Monaco is definitely to be recommended. It isn't cheap but what good hotel is these days? The location was perfect and the staff, especially the doormen, were really friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and very clean with a good view of the river. If you ask they give you goldfish to look after for your stay which is a really nice idea. The only minus was that the maid knocked on the door every night for a turndown service which wasn't requested and she had to be turned away. Putting the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door prevented this but it was a tad annoying. The hotel is really quiet and I would highly recommend it for anyone looking for a good hotel in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “satisfied, comfortable, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: mason36
Reviews.Content: We had a king deluxe room for 2 nights. We reserved the room through the hotel website with AAA discount. We paid $180/nt. We enjoy boutique hotels, as they have so much more personality and personal service. This hotel was no exception. Every employee we encountered was pleasant and helpful. The room was clean, well decorated, spacious and quiet. We were offered at check-in a room with a view, but warned it was across from the elevator, so we decided to take the quiet, large room with no view. The location of the hotel was perfect for us, we saw Wicked while in Chicago and had no problem walking to the theater. We also walked the Magnificient Mile and found the location perfect (we like to walk). We had drinks at the hotel restaurant both nights which was a pleasurable experience. We ate room service for breakfast each morning, and the food was good and the portions were quite large. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with small rooms and a very big heart.”
Reviews.Author: Atoz4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco for an all-too rare weekend of shopping and relaxing. So when I first walked in, I was a bit disappointed. The Hotel Monaco has the small rooms of an older hotel and I had hoped to stretch out in a bit more luxury. BUT, the staff and their courteous and prompt attention to detail, and the hotel's location quickly turned me around. Yes, our room was small, but it was clean, the bedding was elegant and comfortable, the shampoo and beauty products were wonderful (after this, I'm going to find them on-line to purchase them), the robes were comfy, and the bar was well-stocked. The Hotel Monaco is in a great location -- steps from shopping, dining, and entertainment on Michigan Avenue and State Street (it's just south of the river). We walked less than a block to dinner at McCormick and Schmick's (we LOVED it); got the bus around the corner to go to the Museum of Science and Industry and a few other places when it was raining; found a few spots nearby for a relaxing drink; and generally found the location to be as convenient as any (we typically stay at the Intercontinental, which is right on Michigan Avenue, but wanted to try something different this stay). Then there's the staff: from the moment we walked in the door, everyone greeted us with a "hello" or "good morning" or "good night" and a smile. The concierge was helpful. The bellhop was helpful and friendly. The first time the woman behind the front desk left her spot as I walked in the lobby and beat me to the elevator to push the buttons for me (both outside the elevator and in), I was impressed; I soon came to expect that kind of simple, extra attentiveness and courtesy from every staff member there. My husband is a very big man (6'4", 250) and so we typically like our rooms large so he doesn't feel cramped. The Hotel Monaco made up for the small rooms with its very big heart.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jojo3207
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel, we have stayed at The Hotel Monaco in Denver before and knew what to expect. I booked three rooms at hotels.com and was disappointed to find out that it is hard to make any requests when you do not directly book the rooms through the actual hotel (I later found out that the branch of hotels -I think it is Kimpton, will match the prices found on some online sources (not priceline.com or hotwire.com but most others)). I was happy to arrive at the hotel in Chicago and they met all of my needs at check-in without any problems. My husband and I were even upgraded to a suite for my 30th birthday. The suite was perfect, a big corner room with a living room, huge flat screen tv on the wall and a jacuzzi tub. The hotel offers complimentary starbucks coffee in the lobby in the morning and a complimentary wine and beer service in the evening. It was great! The only downfall was that as a group wanting to be together and still be upgraded, we were placed on the 4th floor which we were told was being converted to a non-smoking floor. The front desk had said that all of the rooms had been deep cleaned, are no longer used as smoking rooms and did not smell of smoke. They did smell of smoke and the bellhop said that the 4th floor was the only smoking floor and was still used as one, hence the ashtrays in all of the drawers of our room. A little disappointing but perfect otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Sofitel regular - loved the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: evening
Reviews.Content: Being responsible with the company's money, I just couldnt pay over $400 for the regularly $229 Sofitel this trip, so tried the Monaco. I think I have a new Chicago spot! At least for trade shows... I was worried about the neighborhood compared with the "Gold Coast" area I normally stay in, but it was convenient, safe and there were plenty of reasonable restaurants if I had the time to try them. I even took the el this trip! I think I was in a regular room, but the ceilings seemed very high and the room was spacious. The window seats are a plus. The bed is not as plush as the Sofitel, but completely comfortable with a selection of pillow styles. Free wireless - not the ethernet connected high speed internet I expected. The morning Starbucks/Tazo tea service is wonderful. Business kept me busy, but I did attend the wine tasting on Monday night and opted for the dark beer. My only complaint about the hotel was some rate weirdness they pulled that was OK since the company was paying, but I would probably have cancelled completely if I was! About a month before my arrival, I cut my 4 night stay down to 3 and they raised my rate $23 per night! Makes no sense. I was well within the cancellation period. My corporate travel agent called to question, but we agreed to live with it. If my stay was not excellent I would have cancelled the next planned trip to the Monaco in October (another convention that has driven up the Sofitel rates!)

Reviews.Title: “very trendy”
Reviews.Author: Toribear5
Reviews.Content: I just love Hotel Monaco! I have stayed their several times. It's located in the perfect area and has a nice, urban, young feel to it. They actually gave us a "tall room" that's specifically made for tall people. Not sure why we got it, but it was delightful. The bed was extra long and the shower head was by the ceiling. Great fun! The bedding is super comfortable and fluffy. One time I stayed there I was the SICKEST I have ever been in my life. The front desk with across the street to White Hen and got me medication and orange juice. They were so great. The windowsills are so big, and cushioned that one could really sleep there all night long. One time we went they had free wine tasting so we took immediate advantage of that. All and all, a bit pricey but my favorite place to stay when I drive from the northern suburbs for an evening in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A very classy place”
Reviews.Author: deartobie
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel was excellent, beginning with the warm greeting and the basket of warm chocolate chip cookies greeting us at the front desk. The room was spotless, and when we discovered that one of the lamps had a missing bulb(!), it took literally three minutes from the call to the front desk to someone from maintenance coming to our room with a replacement bulb! As mentioned before, we returned from some time out shopping to find all the lights on in our room, our beds turned down, and a couple of pieces of chocolate on our pillows. While this is a very personal touch, it was the only thing I could have definitely done without service-wise. It felt a little weird to know that someone had been in the room for a purpose other than cleaning it or requested service. I guess the jury's still out on how I feel about it! But overall, the experience was great and the location is terrific. I highly recommend Hotel Monaco.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a perfect birthday...”
Reviews.Author: stagepunk5
Reviews.Content: I reserved the "Rock star" suite for my boyfriend's birthday months and months in advanced. When we arrived at the Hotel Monaco, they told us that they doubled booked the room. This was after many emails to the hotel inquiring about the room and if it was available. They tried to make up for it by providing us with a room with a wonderful view of the river and giving us a ten dollar gift certificate to their resturant - which we didn't even use. I felt we were taken advantage of because we were young. The doorman didn't make us feel any better when he told us that it wasn't the first time they did this for the "rock star" suite. However, the conceirge was incredible with providing us with a bottle of champagne for his birthday and delivered the birthday cake I ordered. If it wasn't for the room confusion - It would have been a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a big city”
Reviews.Author: lov2vacationl
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I received a stressful call from our college student at 8:00 pm, and we needed to be in Chicago as soon as possible. After a long trip we arrived at 1:00 am and started our search for a hotel. We were exhausted, worried, and I packed in such a hurry I forgot a multitude of things. We took a wrong turn, and in trying to get back on Michigan avenue we saw the Hotel Monaco. It was as if they knew we were coming, they were so helpful and kind to us. Not only did we get a room, but the room was stunning, warm, and a with a beautiful view. The bathroom was stocked with everything we needed. In the morning there was a walgreens right next door for the extra things I had forgot to pack, and really any store you could ever want or need is within walking distance. We ate breakfast in the restaurant, and again, I felt as if the Server picked up on the fact that we were worried and tired, and he went out of his way to make us comfortable. Chicago can feel overwhelming, and the Hotel Monaco is a little gem in a big city. The location is perfect. The room was bright, colorful, and our room had two big window seats you could sit in and watch the city activities or read and relax. It would be a great place for an exciting, well planned trip to Chicago, unlike our unplanned trip in the night, but either way the service is friendly, inviting, and ready to make you feel relaxed and welcomed. Usually a place you stay during a difficult time in your life doesn't leave good memories, but for us, Hotel Monaco was a perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: travelercg
Reviews.Content: Loved this place!! It is a very convenient train ride from Midway Airport, and only a block or two away from the Randolph station. We arrived at noon, and even though checkin wasn't until 3 we got our two rooms immediately, which was really nice. My room faced the river and had a huge cushioned window seat (easily the size of a single bed). The king sized bed was very comfortable, and the bedding really nice. Turndown service each night is a great little extra. We had not expected to come back to a filled ice bucket and chocolates on the pillow. The toiletries are very nice, and we appreciated having an umbrella left in the room. My brother had a "tall" room which he liked (longer bed & taller shower), but his view was of the roof and his ice bucket wasn't filled one night. We had the bellhop hold our bags since we weren't leaving town until well after checkout. We had no problems with this either. You are in easy walking distance to Macy's, Nordstrom Rack, Goldcoast dogs, the CTA, a number of bus stops, and just a few blocks from tons of other stores and restaurants. We noticed many people with their dogs, but did not hear any barking in our room. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of Chicago River”
Reviews.Author: DavidBradley
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chicago Hotel Monaco for a one-night visit on business. I had a fantastic view of the Chicago River from a room on the 14th floor. Perhaps because I am a member of Kimpton's loyalty program they up-graded me. In any case, the view of the river sitting in the room's window seat was great. As with other Kimpton properties, this hotel has very good Internet access, a good working desk with good lighting, and a good Aeron-style desk chair. It seems like a small matter, but this hotel and other Kimpton hotels consistently offer business travelers a good work space with excellent (and free!) Internet access. It's nice to know that with Kimpton Hotels you can count on being able to get access to email and get work done on a laptop in your room. As with the other Hotel Monaco properties, the Chicago Hotel Monaco has a unique, funky decor, the rooms are larger than average, and very attentive employees. I would agree with other reviewers that the in-house restaurant is not very special. I had breakfast there, and it was only so-so. As others have remarked, the location of this hotel is great, and it is very convenient to the El (and a direct train ride to Midway Airport). I haven't stayed at the Burnham, but the Hotel Monaco strikes me as a very good value, and a great location if you are visiting downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service at Hotel Monaco”
Reviews.Author: MissBette
Reviews.Content: Mr husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel Monaco in Chicago. We were extremely pleased with the customer service at this hotel. The staff is friendly and helpful, even going so far as to hand us umbrellas as we headed out the door on a rainy day. Rooms are clean, and boast a hip decor. I especially loved the plush animal-print bath robes, available to each guest. Turn down service was a bonus. We arrived back to the hotel each evening to find ice in our ice bucket, the bed turned down with chocolates on our pillows, relaxing jazz music playing in our room, and the lights dimly lit. WOW! In addition, the wine hour each evening made our stay over the top. This hotel is conveniently located to the Magnificent Mile and restaurant district. We'll definately stay with Kimpton properties in the future. Thanks Hotel Monaco for a grand experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous view/drafty windows”
Reviews.Author: LLori
Reviews.Content: Our only problems with Hotel Monaco were few: their clothes steamer was not working, yet when they promised to locate a functioning steamer, they sent the same broken steamer back to our room. Our flight to Chicago was delayed which pushed our check-in to 10 am the next day. I called after 5 pm to ask them to not cancel our reservation but never asked them to hold the room/charge our card. When we arrived early the next morning, I was expecting some trouble since check-in wasn't until 3pm. Our reservation was indeed canceled. It took 20 minutes to check in, but the up-side was that the staff put us on the top floor, slightly facing the river. They did not charge us for the previous night, surprisingly as I assumed it was industry standard to charge the room even if the traveler did not show up. We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant, merely because we were too exhausted from our flight cancellation to venture to Michigan Ave. I would not recommend the restaurant- the fare was standard but the service was slow. This isn't a restaurant that locals would choose to go to, but isn't that a standard hotel restaurant? The room had all the standard amenities- high-thread count sheets, 2 funky animal-print bathrobes, Aveda products, but the highlight was the fabulous windowseat. I spent many times just sitting in the cushioned window, looking out at the river and the "corncob" towers. The window was HUGE and with it came major drafts, but the curtains were thick and helped alleviate the draft. Another minor fun perk were the delicious hard candies at the front desk. We'd stay here again, definitely. The location was choice, close to everything (the L, Millenium Park, the Chicago Cultural Center, some fabulous local establishments such as Moonstruck Chocolates on Michigan Ave and Intelligentsia Coffee on Randolph, and the Loop).

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JCDMMart
Reviews.Content: Living in the far west Chicago suburbs, I am often offered hotel rooms in the downtown area to use during particularly busy times, trade shows, etc. Having stayed in several boutique hotels, mostly in the River North area, I have found none better than the Hotel Monaco. The room was cleaned thoroughly every day, staff was extremely friendly and accomodating, and the room was quite large and very comfortably furnished. The view from the corner suite was outstanding and I enjoyed lounging on the oversized window seats. I felt like a VIP at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Just a standard downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: reisejunky
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room for four nights on Thanksgiving weekend and I am not suprised that this hotel has sunken in the TA rankings as of late. The location is fine and rooms are quiet enough but we had a few complaints. The biggest problem is that the windows don't open - not even a crack. The recycled air was very dry and made the room a little stuffy. The cleaning service (as mentioned in previous reviews) was not great - bed turndown was inconsistent and parts of the room seemed untouched. There was peeling and scratched wallpaper and the caulking around the bathtub was a little moldy and stained. The reception staff was inconsistent as well. The concierge service wasn't the most professional. Having said all this, I need to say that the rate I recieved from Hotwire was very reasonable. I find it hard to call this hotel substandard because compared with other downtown "four-star" establishments in Chicago, it was no different. However, the higher rates one pays when conventions are in town would have left us disappointed. I don't see any reason to choose this Kimpton over, say, the Hotel Intercontinental.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: hoobydooby
Reviews.Content: Dear TripAdvisor: You have put this hotel on your Travelers' Choice list but maybe you should rethink that decision. My husband wanted to surprise me for my 40th birthday by staying overnight in downtown Chicago. He booked a room for one night, Friday October 27th, and asked for a room on the top floor with the best view. We arrived early -at 11:00 a.m.- and were told the room wouldn't be ready until 3:00. They told us we could check in our bag and they would call our cell phone when the room was ready. We paid to check in the bag and left to do sightseeing and shopping. Although no one had called, we returned at 3:00 and retrieved our bag. The room was still not ready. Now we were told by the manager that the guests had paid to stay in the room until 5:00 p.m. so it wouldn't be ready until 6 p.m. by the time housekeeping cleaned it. They offered another room on a lower floor without the best view. I asked what the rate would be and was told it was the same. We looked at it. The view was disappointing. Since they were going to charge us the same rate we decided to wait for the better room we had originally been promised. We paid to check in our bag again. We spoke to the concierge for recommendations on where to kill some time until our room was ready. He gave us a card for a free appetizer at the hotel's adjoining restaurant, Water Street. We sat at the bar and ordered drinks and appetizers- a flatbread pizza and 2 "sliders", items the bartender described as the special appetizers of the day. When we presented the coupon with our order she said she could not honor it for the flatbread because that "is not really an appetizer. It's just what we happen to be serving today." But she could apply it toward the sliders-$1 each. We told her to call the concierge next door. She spoke to him over the phone out of our earshot. She agreed to honor it for the flatbread but asked if we wanted the special one she had previously described or the one "with just the cheese." I was ready to go back to the hotel and return the "free" appetizer coupon if it was going to be that painful for them to honor it. We were done at the restaurant around 4:30. Feeling like we were wasting our day, we went out again. At 7:10 p.m. still no one had called us. We went back to the hotel and asked if our room was ready yet. The girl behind the desk looked confused. Yes it was ready. I asked why no one had called us. She had no answer. During this conversation, the manager was present and he also offered no explanation why we had not been called. Once we were finally in the room we felt we should have a late check out to make up for the time we had to wait. I called the desk and spoke with the same girl we had just checked in with. She informed me the latest we would be allowed to check out was 2:00 p.m. I told her that was not satisfactory since when we tried to check in earlier we were told late check out was at 3. She put me on hold, returned and said we could check out at 3. Finally in the room and unpacked, I attempt to take a shower and no soap! I called the desk again. Housekeeping arrived shortly with 4 bars! I'm not trying to get extra soap. I don't think one bar of soap is too much to ask. Everything about our stay at Hotel Monaco went wrong and it could have so easily been fixed with an apology or a reduced room rate. There was nothing special about this hotel that would make us return or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: shvtraveler
Reviews.Content: I bid a room on Priceline and got the Hotel Monaco. The staff of the hotel was EXTREMELY helpful from directions, telling about hotel services, etc. Very friendly... The were a nice change of pace from the typical hotel these days. Nice to have free Wi-fi. I found the location to be great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Chicago Hotel we have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: dsgdds
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in other boutique hotels in Chicago, a national chain and a different Kimpton here in Chicago....this by far is the nicest and best maintained of the hotels. The staff is outstanding, the room beautiful, the food excellent. I have nothing but great things to say about our stay here. We are staying here for a week next month and are looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Apathetic Staff Not High Class Service”
Reviews.Author: begin23
Reviews.Content: I have a great love for Kipton Inns, this one does not even come close to the type of service I expect. It's 3:00 I have just returned to my room, and it is still not cleaned, despite the fact that the service hanger has been sitting on my door all day. I called to the front desk but they said "there is no guarantee when they will get to my room" Also my minibar was not stocked proper on arrival, (Only 2 beers) I called the front desk to notify them and the next day the fridge had one beer! I went to the front desk about this, the next morning and they said "it would be cheaper to just get supplies across the street." If I cared about cheaper, do you think I would being paying $450/night to stay in this hotel? Also, their was no room service menu in my room, when I called to get one, they gave me attitude and argued with me. This place is not worth the money, despite the nice decor and great views of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “We had a few problems”
Reviews.Author: Discerningwon
Reviews.Content: First let me say, the front office people at Hotel Monaco are wonderful and the location of the hotel was just what I'd hoped. There are some other problems; the furnishings are quite rundown, and housekeeping wasn't very helpful. We booked a suite and the sofa bed, chair and coffee table in the living room area had all had some very hard use. I've attached pictures, so you can see the considerable gap in the sofa and the lack of pillows. Comfortable it was not! The chair bottom is all broken down too. I invited one of the Assistant Managers to view our furniture, and a slight adjustment was made in our rate. As to housekeeping, we had ordered an in-room coffee service (which Kimpton's web site says is there, but you have to specifically request) and at no time did housekeeping leave us coffee. We had to call the front desk every day. And, housekeeping neglected our fish and on our next to last day we found it floating dead at the top of the fish bowl. I had requested water be added to the bowl when I noticed it going down and my note was disregarded. These things may not matter to you, but if you plan to spend a week, like we did, you might want to be comfortable. The bedroom and bathroom were superior; just the living room was bad.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: tikaye406
Reviews.Content: Hotel (and the city of Chicago) was very clean. Hotel and room decor/furnishing was beautiful and functional. Housekeeping (both morning and turn down service) was excellent. All staff members were very friendly and helpful. Wine hour is an added bonus. This is a fabulous hotel with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Monaco, As good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: JanisL
Reviews.Content: After reading so many great reviews I booked the Hotel Monaco and was not disappointed. I booked through their web site about 2 1/2 months prior to arrival for $170/night plus tax for a room with 2 queens. The location was perfect - right by the river near Michigan Ave. - minutes walk to the El, Millenium Park, the Theater District and Shopping. The room was clean, a little larger than standard and nicely decorated. We had window seats in the room with a view of the river. There was Starbucks coffee in the lobby in the morning and a wine reception in the evening. To top it off, the staff was very friendly and knowledgable about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: TrickyKid75
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this place. From the wine reception, friendly staff, great location, funky room with amazing water pressure in the shower---It's all good.

Reviews.Title: “Good Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdx2006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monaco for 3 nights on business. The hotel is centrally located, in the downtown "business district" and is a short walk from Michigan Avenue shopping. PROS: - The rooms are an average size for a major city but well laid out. The signature large Kimpton desk with 2 chairs was useful and my standard King room had two comfy chairs, one with a nice ottoman. - The beds are incredibly comfortable, as you would expect from a Kimpton hotel. - The mini bar is large - this is important to me when I travel, as I like to remove the overpriced water and snacks and place my own inside. - The staff was warm and welcoming and check-in and check-out were both easy. CONS: - My room (I am a Kimpton In Touch member) faced a dark air shaft. While this was nice due to the lack of noise, there was no natural light whatsoever. - Because the windows don't open the smoking rooms REEKED of smoke. I am a light smoker and usually request a smoking room. The second I stepped off the elevator I realized I was on a smoking "floor" as the smoke hit my like a punch in the face. Overall it was an excellent Kimpton experience and I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Recommend”
Reviews.Author: jeanettetx18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Monaco this past weekend based on the reviews from TripAdvisor. It definitely met and exceeded our expectations. The location was in a terrific spot - a few blocks from the train station and walking distance to nightlife/Michigan Ave/etc. After a day out exploring, we arrived back at the hotel around 6p and took advantage of the wine reception. In the mornings, there was a short line of people filling up on the Starbucks coffee. The two best things about our room was the window box seat - we both could sit up there and look outside and people watch. The next best thing was the bed - very comfortable and gave us a good nights rest. Oh, and the price was very reasonable for the room size, the location. The concierge also directed us to some fabulous lounges to have a drink at in the evening. Would recommend this hotel to almost anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: mrlypage
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a convenient location. I would stay at again. Pros: Nice staff, retains its historical beauty alongside clean, spacious, and stunningly decorated rooms. Cool lounge, too. Plus they offer fresh-brewed Starbucks in the morning (sorry, no Continental breakfast, just cups o' joe). Cons: Parking is $38 a night but maybe that;s the prevailing rate for the Loop. Also, Priceline made a crapload off me... I got the hotel for a $200 a night bid (with close to $40 extra in taxes) but the hotel bill revealed a $109 a night charge. Next time I'll try to phone the hotel directly before bidding with Priceline, although I have a feeling that the hotel already had committed a set of rooms to Priceline at a certain point.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice without being pretentious”
Reviews.Author: ScottinChicago
Reviews.Content: My power went out during last week's heatwave, so rather than sleep in the bathtub I got a room at the Hotel Monaco on Priceline. I knew of the Monaco, had eaten in the restaurant downstairs, knew the location, etc. I figured that if the room was half as good as the photos looked (and the AC worked) I would be very happy. The room was huge, as was the bathroom. The linens were all top quality. The colors were rich and soothing. It was much better than I expected. It was very convenient for my commute to the suburbs for work, but was right by all the theaters and shopping in downtown. And the AC was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, No Regrets”
Reviews.Author: PaintTheCity
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan of the Kimpton hotels - this is one of three in Chicago. The location is good for someone who wants to be in the middle - to be able to pick a direction and go. Shopping is all around, Millennium Park and the Art Institute are an easy walk. If you want to be in the glitzy, bustling area - this isn't it. But I like a quieter retreat after a long day in the big city. The staff was great, the restaurant is average and the rooms were comfortable, but with flaws in the design - meaning tables were in the way, the bathroom was arranged awkwardly, etc. The air-conditioning was great - the elevators were fast - and wi-fi was complimentary. It is indeed a pricey stay, but well worth the bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Close to great but still very good”
Reviews.Author: bgou
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 2 nights in a Mediteranean suite with my wife. The hotel is pleasant and we would probably stay again. The staff was fantastic and the room was comfortable. The restaurant was good but not great. The only complaint about the room was that the bathroom wasn't very functional. It isn't huge to begin with but the majority of it is dominated by the enortmous tub - very nice. Unfortunately that leaves little room for the seperate shower and the toilet is tucked behind the door in an akward fashion. Still a great value for the money and it is in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Monaco was great”
Reviews.Author: ponchogrl
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my teenage daughter and niece at the Hotel Monaco June 30-July 2. I printed out directions, we were coming from the Field Museum, but after 1 turn the street was blocked off for Taste of Chicago. So, it took us about an hour driving around downtown in Friday rush hour traffic stuck behind a bus, but we finally found it. We opted for the valet parking at 36 dollars a night. It seemed high, but when I checked with a nearby parking garage the fee was 27 dollars for 24 hours, so the extra few dollars was worth the convenience. Check in was painless, and our bellman was very pleasant. I thought he was going to unpack our luggage for us! The room was huge, two queen beds, etc, but no window seat, which was my determining factor for choosing this hotel over it's sister hotel, the Burnham. I called down to the front desk, and the very efficient clerk assured me that I had a really nice room and I should stick with it. If i wanted to switch to a room with the window seats, it may not be as large, and I may not get two beds. I didn't feel like making a fuss, so we stayed with our non view room. As I said, it was quite large, with 2 small tables with chairs, two comfy armchairs, one with an ottoman, and the cabinet in the corner with tv, honor bar, and cd player. The bathroom was especially large also, with nice size tub and shower. I was happy to see the magnifying makeup mirror, but the bulb must have been burned out. The extras like cotton balls and cotton swabs were provided, that was a nice touch. I signed up for the Kimpton customer loyalty program, and was pleasantly surprised to receive a tray shortly after we got to our room with a personalized card, a bottle of Fiji water, and a biscotti, as well as a complimentary menu item should we go to the restaurant. The beds were comfortable, one had a down comforter, one had a blanket. The decorative pillows were kind of stained and gross, but we always just toss those to the side as soon as we get into the room anyhow, so no big deal. We faced out onto an alley, and the first night I was awakened by garbage pickup in that alley, never heard a peep from other guests though. I didn't take advantage of the wine reception in the evenings, or Starbucks in the morning, but other people seemed to be enjoying them. We were in the room the first night when the turn down attendent came, so she just left ice and candy. The second night we got back late, and I was expecting to come back to a dark room. I was pleasantly surprised to come into a dimly lit room with the relaxation channel on the tv, and a chocolate surprise on the pillow. We had a problem with the toilet not flushing efficiently, and practically before I could hang up the phone, an engineer was there, plunger in hand, and had the problem taken care of. When I returned home, I received an online survey to fill out. I dutifully fill those out, as I have gotten them at other hotels I've stayed in. I was honest, and to my surprise I got an email back from the manager saying he was sorry my stay wasn't flawless, and should I stay there again, make my reservations directly with him, and he would do everything in his power to make sure I got my 2 beds plus the window seats. That was refreshing. I've had major problems at other hotels before, and no response back from management. To have this personal reply to my minor disappointment made the difference for me between looking at another hotel among the many fine ones in downtown Chicago, or going back to the Monaco. To sum it up, the location was great for the theatre, 3 blocks to theatre where Wicked is playing. Garrett's popcorn is right next to the theatre, Marshall Fields is right there.... We'd planned on going to Water Tower place for shopping, but ended up in that same little area of State Street every day. There was plenty to do. So, try the Monaco. The staff are so friendly and efficient, and their commitment to customer service is exemplary.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel, great value for price, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Rad_MD
Reviews.Content: After our wedding, we went to Chicago because did not have much vacation time (we are in Minneapolis). From the monent we walked into the lobby to our last day, our experience was outstanding: Special package that includes daily chilled champaige (including ice in a bucket and 2 flutes), daily box of Marshall Fields chocolates, dairly romantic music CD, daily coupon for room service breakfast from the hotel restaurant, and daily gift certificates to Victoria's Secret. Room: -Mediterranean Suite- enter into a main room that has a sofa bed, TV, computer desk with highspeed (though we used the wireless network via our laptop). It has 2 bay windows with a cushion so that 2 people can sit comfortably and enjoy the view of the river. That room connects to the bedroom, which has 2 similar bay windows with a seating cushion as well as a TV. The bathroom is connected to the bedroom and in pristine condition and includes a jazucci. -assortment of CDs, unique chocolates/snacks, chicago maps, etc in the room bar -daily cleaning, though the staff always respected 'Do Not Disturb' signs and happily agreed to come back at a later time when request -Aveda products Checkout: late checkout (early afternoon rather than in the morning) Services: -Restaurant in the hotel for room services and dining: we only used it for breakfast, which was good but nothing special. However, there are a plethora of dining options nearby and a taxi ride away so it does not really matter where you stay in Chicago. -Concierge: knowledgable, friendly, many guide books -quickly fixed any problems with the room (lightbulb fused) and answered questions -Doorman -Lobby personel were always friendly and helpful and made you feel like a individual patron rather than someone lost among the masses, as can happen in larger hotels Transportation: Loop El trains, including Brown line; free chicago shuttles along Mag Mile; taxi hailed by the doorman Location: in the loop area, by the chicago river, never concerned about safety

Reviews.Title: “Really nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: netme
Reviews.Content: I just spent 3 nights at the Monaco early in June and was extremely happy with this hotel. This is a medium size hotel, not overwhelming like too many giant business hotels in Chicago. The design is really nice and my room was quite large and comfortable. Bed was perfect, bathroom was OK, free Internet access very convenient, the big plus in my opinion was the large window with an alcove that provides prime views of the river. Spent hours there watching the activity on the street and the buildings around. Downtown location was convenient, not too far from multiple shopping destinations and from the new Millenium park (outstanding!). I wasn't blown away by the service but it was fine overall. All in all, I found this hotel a great value for the location, design and comfort. Will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry - have to disagree on this one”
Reviews.Author: snwarf01
Reviews.Content: I am usually one to agree with the masses and typically agree with fellow raters on TripAdvisor...but I can't agree on this one. I will preface this by saying it is possible that it is just due to the holiday weekend and the hotel being booked full, but we will not give it another chance to see. Arrival: Doorman literally just looked at us coming in with our luggage (we had to walk from down the street due to the parade). There was no offer to try and get the door or to even help us with the luggage. I thought that was a litte strange, but okay, whatever. Check-in: Perky girl at the front starts checking me in and then says "oh, no...what do I do?" Sorry, can't help you there! The young man next to her tells her our room is not ready and we can preregister. My husband and I were not upset at all that the room was not ready because we were there several hours before check-in. However, this young man looks at us and tells us "we can't just kick them out you know!" NOW I'm getting a little nervous that this is going to be the hotel from....but, we laughed and said that we understood and they said they will call us when the room is ready. We left, ate, walked the entire Mag Mile, sat at the Vet Memorial..la di dah...no calls...finally, at check-in time I ask a less perky girl if the room might be ready. She says "no". I mean, nothing else so I said well do you have an estimate? She said no, its hard to tell. I could go on, but lets just say that we finally were helped by an older gentlemen who was WONDERFUL. He called housekeeping got our room ready and we were in only an HOUR after check-in time. Room: Next time I won't ask about the room and maybe they will actually clean it. There was a mess left from the previous guest(s). Wrappers, plastic tags and lots of hair in the bathroom. UGH. To think we paid $309 for a Med Suite and actually had to inspect the sheets to see if they were cleaned. The couch had 'stains' (I won't go there) and the floor had lots of little puddle stains. I know they are pet friendly, but this seemed a little much. The shower was extremely small and you had to do some strange maneuvering with the bathroom door to get to it and the toilet. However, we did enjoy their bathroom amenities and their cute minibar offerings. Nice view of the Chicago River, State Street and Wabash. Restaurant: South Water Kitchen was actually pretty good. We ate twice in the restaurant and once as room service. It was pretty basic fare but it was all very good. Location: we liked where the Hotel Monaco is located. It was an easy walk to the Mag Mile, theater district, pretty much anywhere we wanted to go. The only thing I would suggest is if you are going to Chicago strictly to shop then the location may be out of the way. I can't imagine having a lot of shopping bags and not being able to drop them off occasionally. If shopping is your passion I would suggest staying on Michigan Ave somewhere such as the Intercontinental. In summary, I did not hate the Hotel Monaco. I think their front desk personnel needs training in basic customer service skills and their housekeepers (at least the ones on the third floor) could use some retraining. However, it was a whimsical hotel with cute touches and does offer a complimentary wine reception in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JuliePetulie
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Monaco for Memorial day weeekend with our 2 kids (ages 4 AND 11). Loved the location, the decor and the goldfish! The complimentary evening wine reception and morning Starbucks and chocolates or sweets at turn down were great! It was nice to see pets in the hotel too. It is clean and beautiful and wonderful decor! We had a whirlpool suite (room 405 for $289 per night internet deal) which encompassed 2 large rooms plus bath included a living room with tv in armoir (and minibar and honor bar), desk with phone and lamp, stone coffee table, 2 comfy armchairs and a hide-a-bed sofa adjoining a HUGE master suite with tv in armoir, huge meditation window seats, queen size bed with feather duvets, large paisley arm chair & ottoman, & phone. Bath has HUGE DEEP whirlpool tub AND shower and concrete sink - COOL - with granite top. Our room was next to ice machine which was convenient and hidden so not noisy. Nice Aveda bath products in bath... wonderful. The negatives were few but will mention - $7 lovely brightly tissue covered bath balls next to tub beckoned children to throw them in at parents' chagrin! Overpriced honor bar with cute little stuffed toys, pringles, and candy and such that could not be moved out of kids eyeshot and reach (attached to armoir just under TV) - to parents' chagrin! We were put into a smoking room when asked for non-smoking - in hotel's defense, we did not mention and did not ask for room change and only asked upon departure whether it was smoking or not (it was smoking) and there was a mix up for which they apologized profusely. Also, wallpaper torn where chair rubbed it in livingroom - no big deal but looks shabby. they need to repair and get chair rail. The room service took way too long, cost way too much and was mediocre. The delivery guy complained that the hotel took 1/2 of his tips and held out his hand for more (on top of the 18% already charged to the bill)! The parking was high $36 per night - oh well... it's Chicago and probably not unreasonable for the area. The huge plusses besides the ones already mentioned, the staff was great! The restaurant was nice with outdoor seating area too, better than room service. The concierge was very helpful. My son puked in the night and the housekeeping staff was really helpful with extra linens and no complaints (how do they do it???) Overall, I'd have to say great stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Monaco is First Rate”
Reviews.Author: oldcpa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Monaco for four days the middle of May. We had never stayed in a Klimpton hotel but booked the Monaco based on customer reviews. We were pleased with our decision. From the doorman to the desk clerk to the bellman all were friendly and helpful. There was a real effort to make guests feel welcome. Our room was first class. The bed was very comfortable as were the the linens. The closet was bigger than most hotels. The bathroom was clean and the towels thick. We both liked the shower and never had a problem with hot water running out. The television had an adequate number of channels and had good reception. We were on the fifth floor above Wabash but had no problem with street noise. I would have preferred an in-room coffee maker but there was Starbucks coffee in the lobby every morning. A selection of newspapers in the lobby included the Chicago Tribune, the Wall Street Journal and the Financial Times. USA Today was at your door in the morning. The location of the Monaco is a plus, It's one block off Michigan and a short walk across the river to the Magnificent Mile. We will look for a Klimpton property on future trips and the Monaco when we make it back to Chicago

Reviews.Title: “Way too cute ”
Reviews.Author: mockbird
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay ... from the doorman to the housekeeping service, they couldn't have been nicer ... room upgraded before i even asked .... fun eclectic decor and couldn't resist the mix cd. Room overlooked Marina City and the river, beautiful especially at night, the window seats are fun and cozy to sit and watch the city. Only drawback, beds were on the hard side, that being said will stay there again if i can afford it!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Teramo48
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the wonderful Hotel Monaco on a business trip. What a great place at the government rate! The location was perfect--within walking distance of the Magnificent Mile, Millenium Park and the Art Institute of Chicago. The decor of the hotel and the rooms is spectacular--quite funky and refreshing. The room was comfortable and clean with a nice view of the river (#809). The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, especially Barnette the doorman. Knowing how hungry I was for Chicago information, the concierge literally went out of her way to meet and greet me with suggestions. The wine served during the afternoon reception was Grade A! No cheap swill. I will definitely hunt out Kimpton Hotels during future visits to American's large cities! (I just wish I had my digital camera for photos to show you.)

Reviews.Title: “Happy Easter at the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: BB in KC
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter weekend at the Monaco with our 3 young kids and had a fabulous time. The Monaco was very kid friendly, staff were great, and we loved the location. Especially cool are the unique windows...they are practically a separate room all to themselves and we loved the in-room goldfish. A neat touch. We will definitely stay again. Thanks Monaco for a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Donnmein
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monaco for one night on business. I hadn't stayed at a Kimpton property before and was pleasantly surprised. Extremely friendly check-in staff, and comfortable lobby made for a homey feel. Interesting room decor. Greatly enjoyed dinner at the attached South Water Kitchen restaurant. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nick_and_Michael
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, friendly staff, wonderful location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rock On”
Reviews.Author: lazlototh
Reviews.Content: The staff and service made our stay at the Hotel Monaco unbelievable. Having gone in the off-season for a family event, the staff not only provided us a great reservation rate but then upgraded us to the Rock Star suite. This place was awesome with a CD jukebox, deep two-person whirlpool, giant king-size bed and comfortable sitting room with Keith Moon tv-through-the-window decorative piece. The relatives took a standard room and found it just as clean, quaint and comfortable...if less raucus. I can't say enough great things about our stay at the Monaco. The valets were lightning quick in retrieving the car on the busy, snowy downtown street. The desk and bell staffs were attentive and sincere. The complimentary evening wine tastings were relaxing and pleasant. There was an adjacent independent restuarant with suitable food and a range of other choices just a cab jump away. Ditto for sightseeing. Even if season rates are higher than you may prefer, I'd advise indulging in the Monaco and trying out a different style of hotel service.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here and we live in the Suburbs of Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Bunnybear23
Reviews.Content: Whenever my husband and I have a special night we stay at the Hotel Monaco. We have had Valentine's Day and New Years Eve there. We have had out of town guests stay there as well as in town guests! The customer service is second to none and the rooms are incredible and spotless. We eat breakfast in the hotel when we stay and the food is always very good. Good choice and nice location. It is not as loud as other truly downtown Chicago hotels. Beware of the parking charge, even if you do not have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelorettes loved the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: caribbeantourist
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hotel Monaco with 3 girlfriends for a Bachelorette Party. As the organizer, I appeciated the friendly demeanor of the in-house reservations team. I felt that the price was very reasonable for it's downtown location. We loved the individuality of this hotel over cookie-cutter hotels. The decorating was very nice, and the the goldfish and leopard-print robes were a fun addition. We enjoyed the large window seat overlooking the river. The bathroom was nice and spacious- definitely a plus when 4 women are getting ready to hit the town. Unfortunately, we were out shopping during the complementary wine reception and weren't up early enough to enjoy the complementary Starbuck's Coffee! The concierge was very helpful with planning where to go out for the evening, and she supplied us with plenty of free passes. We all can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at the Monaco”
Reviews.Author: Lindsyb
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Monaco mid-Jan. 2006 for a business trip. I loved the atmosphere of the hotel although unfortunately on a quick business trip I was not able to enjoy many of their amenities (the wine reception, the goldfish, etc.) I did eat at the hotel and although the food was very good the service was somewhat slow. The area was a short cab ride away to my client's offices but was convenient to get to from Midway airport via CTA train. I think my favorite part was the window seat to enjoy the view from my window. It was a great way to relax and enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: KrispyDuck
Reviews.Content: Having read the read great reviews here for the Monaco I was expecting more - especially for the high price. The hotel was only 'OK' in my view. Initial impression on arrival was uninspiring. The rooms were OK. The view from the window seat was nice. The restaurant attached (maybe separate management) was pretentious, over-priced and distinctly ordinary. The hotel never real felt close to anywhere and having to wait for the valet parking every time I wanted to go out was a pain. As I had to use the car most of the time anyway, when business or pleasure takes me to Chicago, I now usually stay out of town and save myself a small fortune.

Reviews.Title: “We named our Goldfish Myrna!”
Reviews.Author: ChloesMomBetsey
Reviews.Content: We loved The Monaco. We arrived very early and expected the hotel to hold our bags until afternoon, but there were rooms ready and they let us checkin before 10am! On arrival we requested a goldfish, who was delivered when we returned from shopping, that afternoon. We named her Myrna. Our first night in, turn down service included a wrapped truffle and a full bucket of ice; the next night offered tootsie roll pops. Returning from shopping we were offered fresh baked cookies. This style conscious hotel is filled with little and nice surprises. The Doorman knew us by name, even though we only had one interaction, and admonished us for waiting in line at Garretts for popcorn, when he would have been happy to take care of that. I can't say enough about the concierges. We dealt with two, both women. One aptly took care of an issue with our airline, the other pointed us to shopping with discount coupons in hand. We ate breakfast at the restaurant. The food and service were good although nothing extraordinary. The rooms have a quirky feel to them. The honor bars include the usuals and items such as silly putty and stuffed goldfish souveniers. There is no question we will stay at The Monaco on return trips to Chicago. With a fantastic location and hospitable staff, it has become an all time favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Locations, Friendly Staff (most of them)”
Reviews.Author: Michealangelo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Kimpton hotels before and the Hotel Monaco Chicago lived up to all my expectations. It's such a great location in Chicago, a few blocks from Michigan avenue and a few blocks if you want to catch a play. All the staff was extemely friendly, always stopeed and said hi, how are you enjoying your stay. The only expception to this was the female conceirge - of all the conceirges I've talked to, this one ranks up there with the rudest and most unhelpful - but it definitely didn't ruin our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Fantabulous Monaco!”
Reviews.Author: desertmom
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my first trip to Chicago, and I couldn't wait to tell everyone about my stay at the Hotel Monaco. The Monaco is a small, boutique hotel located in what is possibly one of the best locations in downtown Chicago. From the moment you walk in to the small but stylish lobby, you are greeted warmly and cordially by everyone. The front desk resembles an old Louis Vuitton steamer trunk - one of many bits of whimsy you will find here. The staff is friendly, courteous and knowledgeable. Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable with a lovely view of the river. My overall first impressions lasted throughout my stay. The Monaco is about 2 blocks north of Marshall Fields, a 5 minute walk (if that) to the theater district, minutes from Michigan Avenue shopping to the northeast and the Chicago Art Institute to the southeast. Convenient to everything! The hotel is stylish without being pretentious and eco-friendly. Aveda products, animal print robes and a pet goldfish to keep you company are all at your disposal. Relax and have fun here! I will definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to anyone going to The Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Monaco”
Reviews.Author: JO.S
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Friendly helpful staff. Rooms clean and spacious. Great location Comfortable beds. Cant wait to stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Ascenseur
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fantastic. After years of staying at generic convention hotels such as the Hyatt and Marriott, I can honestly say that this is a far better option. This hotel is charming but modern, luxurious but causual, quirky but comfortable. You won't believe the amenities waiting for you in the room! Gorgeous decor - and a catalogue with everything from the towels to the lamps. We're seriously considering purchasing one of the mirrors (from our room) for our home! It's a small hotel so the relatively small staff will remember you for the duration of the stay and they will help you with absolutely anything you can imagine. Everything is brand new so of course it's sparkling and the rooms have fantastic sound-proofing. You couldn't hear the sirens from ambulences down on Wacker! Fantastic location - 3 blocks to the heart of the theatre district and Marshall Fields, 3 blocks in the other direction to the North Michigan Avenue area. Water Tower is only a 15 minute walk north and the Art Institute the same distance south. We can't WAIT to stay here again and we're recommending it to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Go, Go Monaco”
Reviews.Author: discosturules
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Monaco on my way skiing at Easter & loved it. Staff were helpful & friendly, room was huge with fantastic view of the river. Central location, 5 min walk to the EL. Adjoining Restaurant/Bar, great food & service. I have stayed in more expensive, supposedly better, hotels in Chicago, but this is the best. Thanks Monaco, I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “FIne”
Reviews.Author: cabrnet7
Reviews.Content: This was a nice property, clean and most people friendly. Called twice for towels and never received any. Good location. Would stay somewhere else next time, just wasn't a place I would say, I'm going back to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Monaco”
Reviews.Author: nosittap
Reviews.Content: Stopped at the Monaco following recommendations from Tripadvisor and wasn't disappointed. Great location,attentive and friendly staff and comfortable rooms. Would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephen Deadelus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on Business. Nice, attentive staff; clean and functional rooms. The lobby was inviting with fire, free newspapers and morning coffee and evening wine. The location is great and many rooms have nice view of Chicago river. They didn't have a goldfish available, but that's a minor disappointment all considered.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: steph5803
Reviews.Content: The Monaco in Chicago is a perfect hotel location for business or leisure travel. The property is located walking distance to Michigan Avenue so that you can shop, dine or just wander about. The hotel itself is clean and funky...and everyone is extremly kind and helpful. The room that I was in had a two double beds, large bathroom and nice robes. The room had windows that extended out over the building, and were mini-cubbies to lay in and read or just gaze...it was a very cool place to hang out. The workout room is tiny, but efficient....and has a TV to watch while you are sweating. Starbucks and Corner Bakery are just around the corner and the hotel restaurant drew quite a lunch crowd...and the food there was really good. I love this hotel and will make it my first choice to stay when I travel to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “nice overall...a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Ganesh9
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Monaco for five nights in March 2005. My room was a tad on the small side, but the appointments were quite nice overall, though the decor may be too whimsical for some. This is supposed to be a pet friendly hotel but I take that to mean chihuahuas and not much else. Nevertheless, I didn't hear any barking dogs. March is not exactly peak season in Chicago so the vacancy rate was probably a bit on the high side. Some of the rooms have little ledges overlooking the street, and that's kind of nice. There is a convenience store located across the street, so pretty much anything you need in terms of food and supplies can be had easily and cheaply. The location was good: El and CTA stops within walking distance if you want to come in from O'Hare or Midway. Most places near the Loop are also easy to get to. Michigan Ave is just a block and a half away. I would say that the Monaco was an above average experience, though I did not feel I got a fantastic deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Service?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I love the Hotel Monaco chain (especially Seattle) but Chicago is terrible. I just stayed there August 19 - 21st and found service lacking and the staff apathetic. Both requests I made during my stay took hours. On Friday Aug 19th I requested a yoga basket for my room at 5 p.m. It arrived at 7:45 p.m. while I was dressing to leave for dinner. This was after being told "we'll send one up immediately." On Saturday Aug 20th I arrived back in my room at 4 p.m. to find my hotel goldfish dead in it's bowl. I called the front desk and was told that they would send someone up "immediately" to get it. At 9 p.m. I took the dead goldfish and it's bowl down to the front desk myself receiving no comment from the staff at all. My pillowcases had old mascara (makeup stains) on them and were not that white and clean looking. I asked the conceirge to recommend a great Italian restaurant (it is Chicago after all). She referred me to the upscale Bennigans-like Nick and Tony's chain around the corner. On Saturday night I left the hotel to go out for the evening (single woman alone) and had to hail my own cab on the corner as the doorman couldn't be bothered.
